loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. Her husband supports her in the business and others family needs. Naomi buys and sells fuel (kerosene, petrol and diesel) and molasses. Naomi has been in this business for the last nine years. She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Limited, to buy more stock of fuel to sell.

Naomi dreams and hopes for her business to grow well so that she will be able to pay back her loan. She hope to be able to save enough to buy a plot of land in order for her to built residential houses for renting.

loans.use: to purchase stock fuel to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very humble-natured lady. She always behaves well with everyone. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also manages her embroidery business efficiently. Her business returns show good profit which allows her to manage the household expenses. 

She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes which helps her in attracting many customers to her. Her clientele base is her community ladies who give her regular orders due to her neat and good work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and increase her profits. She is hopeful that her business will expand further and increase her income.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora; que vive en compañía de su mamá y su papá, a los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde que tenía 20 años de edad, se dedicó a la agricultura, siendo sus principales cultivos la papa y arveja; lo que más le gusta de su labor es poder cuidar de su becerra mientras limpia la maleza que crece entre sus sembríos, pero lo que no le gusta son las temporadas donde los agricultores cosechan gran cantidad de hortalizas, ya que saturan el mercado y no le permite tener buenas ganancias. Pero es en está temporada que ella deja secar la arveja, la cual se convierte en semilla, vendiendo el saco de semilla a un mayor precio en el mercado central de Tarma, permitiéndole estabilizar su economía. Además de dedicar su tiempo libre en la enseñanza a niños menores de 5 años de edad como profesora. Comenta que como mujer joven, el papel que cumple su banco comunal en su vida, es preponderante, ya que le ayuda a crecer y forjarse nuevas metas. Por todos lo aciertos está pensando abrir un restaurante en su zona, ya que no existe una. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera una vez más de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Además se compromete en ser puntual en sus cuotas. Elizabeth de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja que sembrará dentro de poco, además de varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito está temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26 years old.  She is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mom and dad who she loves and cares for in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

Elizabeth has been farming since she was 20 years old.  Her main crops are potatoes and peas.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to care for her calf while she is getting rid of the weeds that grow amongst her crops.  What she doesn't enjoy are the seasons when farmers harvest a large quantity of vegetables as they flood the market and don't allow her to make good profits.  However, during such seasons she leaves her peas to dry and turns them into seeds.  She then sells the sacks of seeds for a better price in the central market in Tarma.  This allows her to stabilize her finances.  In addition, Elizabeth also spends her spare time teaching children under the age of 5.  She tells us that, as a young woman, her community bank plays a dominant role in her life since it helps her to grow and forge new goals.  Elizabeth is planning to open a restaurant in her area as there isn't one right now.

Elizabeth is a member of the 'Pioneros de Cumutay' (Cumutay Pioneers) community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes, once more, to receive your support in helping her achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Elizabeth will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds which she will sow shortly.  She will also buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can make a successful start to this season.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is a married woman with ten children, five of whom attend school while five already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are fuel and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a palm wine selling business, selling to her neighbors. In addition she also sells fresh water to her neighbours which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a club in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to start a clothes selling business, and will purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sonia, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 20, 28 y 30 años, ella se dedica a la venta de especias y esencias, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años, surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de esencias, especias y ropa: blusas, faldas, camisas formales, y ropa interior, esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y tener mejor capacidad para atender la demanda.
Ella tiene el propósito de ayudar a sus hijos, estar pendiente de cualquier necesidad que se les presente, y que con la inversión pueda tener mejor capacidad de venta.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother of three children ages 20, 28 and 30 years old.  She makes her living selling spices and essences.  She has had this business for 20 years.  She started it up on her own initiative.  She is open from 7:00am to 4:00pm.
Sonia currently needs a loan to purchase essences, spices and clothing: blouses, skirts, formal tops and undergarments.  This loan will help her to strengthen the business and to have a greater capacity to meet the demand.
Sonia intends to help her children, to be aware of any need that may come up.  And with the loan, she'll be able to have a greater sales capacity.

loans.use: to purchase essences, spices and clothing: blouses, skirts and formal tops.

loans.name: Ngeima Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ngeima” group from Kenema, a city  in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is married to a teacher and they have three children.  Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells market-food – salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), flour, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy salt, Maggi, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy salt, Maggi, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 46 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle  un futuro prometedor. Anatolia viene realizando la actividad del agro hace 23 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  porque gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus cultivos de cacao y café ella adquirió más espacios de terreno para cultivar y también compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se cobijan los miembros de su familia. Pero en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Anatolia cuenta con una hectárea de terreno sin cultivar, por lo cual necesariamente requiere el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar a cabo sus actividades programadas. Ella tiene pensado repoblar sus fincas con más plantas de cacao y es por ello que acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante a sus hijos y cultivos. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP y por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes y se compromete en pagar puntualmente su pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos futuros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará más semillas de cacao para poder repoblar sus fincas.
texts.en:
Anatolia is 41 years old and a native of Quimbiri. She is a modest and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Benjamín, age 46, and their three beloved children from whom she wants to provide a promising future. Anatolia has been farming for 23 years. With great care and effort, she grows cacao and coffee. As a result of her production, she was able to acquire more space for growing these crops. Whenever she has to remove weeds or harvest her crops, Anatolia hires laborers to help with these tasks so that the work gets completed faster and she can stay on schedule. She purchased another piece of land where she currently lives with her family.

Anatolia has one hectare of land that has not been cultivated, so she needs capital for planting cacao. For this reason, she has approached MFP since the organization provides loans to people of limited resources who are looking to make progress. For the sake of her work, she hopes to bring the same level of effort and energy that she demonstrates when she is raising her children.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the necessary assistance so that she can accomplish her goals. Anatolia promises to complete her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more cacao seeds so that she can increase her plantings.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 21-year-old young man. He is a construction worker and is looking to increase his income to pay for his wedding expenses in the future. Jehad has his own business which is raising sheep to sell their products. He wants to purchase more sheep to raise, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

With this loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, Jehad will buy more sheep and increase sales from their products. This will increase his income and lead to better living conditions for him. 

Jehad is in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more sheep.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 23 years old.

Nelia is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing and selling rice for over 10 years. Nelia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. Nelia hopes to be progressive in life. She also desires for her children to finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Adelein Conception

texts.en:
Adelein Conception is from the village of Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela.  She is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, she raises and harvests corn for sale.  Adelein Conception has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month.

Adelein Conception joined ASKI to gain access to financial services, improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, 50 years old, is a pig feeder who earns $5 per day. Her husband sells palm products and also earns $5 per day. There are no children staying with them. Every month, Nim has to spend $45 on food and $20 on transportation. She wants to feed more pigs with modern techniques so that she can earn more income. Besides feeding pigs, she also makes palm sugar to sell with her husband.

Nim would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Segundo Edison

texts.es:
Segundo Edison tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene una hija , vive con la esposa y con la hija de tres años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener una casa propia para vivir tranquilo con la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Edison, 27, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office; it has 14 members, both men and women.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farmers.

Segundo is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer. His sales and his purchases take place in Chillanes Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because it will improve his quality of life.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is to have a house of his own to live in peace with his family.  In his free time he enjoys going on family excursions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Andalala Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Andalala Group in Western Kenya! Emanuel is the facilitator of the Andalala group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Emanuel takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Emanuel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Emanuel was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emanuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Emanuel will save for the future and pay bank loans.

In 2012, the members of Andalala group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Emanuel and his group members appear in the photograph above. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has been involved in the agricultural business for almost twelve years. He is happy because he is able to manage his one hectare of rice fields. Bernard enjoys his farming activity, so he is determined to improve his rice production.  He is a young farmer and yet still single. 

Bernard's main priority is to prepare his farm land properly so that he can obtain a good rice crop.  Though he feels pain through the sun's heat still he endures it because he would like to help to provide for his family's living.  

Bernard would like to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields but his income is not enough to afford this.  So, for this reason, he is requesting financial assistance amounting to PHP 40,000.  He is hoping that this amount will help him to increase his yields and generate greater income to provide the basic necessities and save some money for security purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields.

loans.name: Bidii Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Bidii Farmers Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Daniel as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Daniel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, he will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii Farmers group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercelina

texts.en:
Mercelina is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. She faces a major challenge of school fees and rent bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the local market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a motorcycle business which earns her other income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her operations.  Mercelina dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for her transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for transport business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 32 years, is a businessman who runs a spare auto parts shop that has been operating for five years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes. 90,000.

This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He will use the funds to buy more spare auto parts to sell.  Samuel hopes to open another spare auto parts store in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single woman who has no children yet. She describes herself as a promising and jovial woman. 
Nancy operates a a retail stall where she sells passion fruits. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located near a busy road and her main customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the times when passion fruits go out of season resulting in a shortage. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more passion fruits. Nancy's business goal is to buy a pick-up to aid in delivery of passion fruits within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruits.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Ms Tam is 38 years old with 3 children of school age. She  has been running a small restaurant that serves breakfast for the last 3 years. In addition, she grows cheery blossom for the Tet holidays. Joining in our credit program in 2003, she used the loan she undertook effectively to expand her business activities. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam Dong to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio tiene la edad de 48 años, es asalariado del gobierno y con lo que gana apenas le alcanza para hacer algunas mejoras en la vivienda, priorizando las mas necesaria, habita junto a su esposa con quien procreo tres hijos todos son mayores de edad y la menor habita con ellos, ademas se preocupa por sus nietos que también lo visitan.  Don Julio desde que tiene su trabajo fijo se ha propuesto en mejorar cada día su humilde vivienda, haciendo créditos a Afodenic mediante kiva es así como las mejoras se han hecho posible, pues embaldoso la sala, reparó parte del techo y otras mejoras que ha venido haciendo con muchas dificultades por su nivel de ingreso.

Nuevamente se remite a Kiva a solicitar este préstamo que sera invertido en reparar la letrina hacerle paredes de concreto, ya que en la actualidad es de zing y está con hoyos,  cambiar el techo y otras mejoras que necesita para poder gozar de un buen servicio higiénico que muestre las condiciones para hacer sus necesidades cómodamente.

Su próxima meta es ayudar siempre a su anciana madre y continuar con las mejoras en el hogar con otro crédito si Dios le concede estos deseos.

loans.use: hacerle paredes de concreto y cambiar el techo a la letrina, ademas reparar interiormente esta misma, para asegurar la buena higiene en el hogar.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school, Analee works very hard to provide for them.

Analee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods.

Analee has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Analee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Madam Josephine’s kenkey has always been enjoyed by the people in her community. She prepares her kenkey under very good hygienic conditions and therefore it is very attractive for buyers. She however needs capital to produce more to meet the high demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. She can work very hard with this amoount and pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her kenkey selling business

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Mrs Xuan’s husband left her for another woman. She is supporting a child by herself. The child is 16 years old and in grade 8. Mrs Xuan has a small hut with wooden walls and a clay floor. She has a small rice field of about 280 m2. She also buys waste daily for recycling and then sells it to a a small business in the commune. Additionally, she raises pigs at her house.

Mrs Xuan borrowed an interest-free loan of $100 and has already repaid the loan. Her income increased $2.50 per person per month. Now the average income is $10 per person per month. Mrs Xuan wants another loan of $100 for expanding her business.

loans.use: Selling recycled waste and raising pigs.

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.en:
Jessenia has a small business where she sells many different types of products. At her store, she sells school and office supplies, home products and also bottled water. In this sector clean water is difficult to come by, therefore Jessenia has a very high rate of demand for that product.

Jessenia hopes to invest the loan by improving the inventory in her store. Although the water sales do well, she is hoping she can generate more income with completely different products.

With this loan Jessenia is confident the situation for her and her three children will improve. She currently lives in a cement home and she saves towards the future of her children.

loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 7 children.  She works selling vegetables, a job that earns her $4/day of income.  Her husband is a fisherman, and earns $3/day.  One of Mrs. Sak S.'s sons is a moto-taxi driver, and she will use this loan to purchase a motorbike for him.  This will increase his income, as well as the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son's business

loans.name: Elio Obet

texts.es:
Elio is a very responsible and hard working man. He has been living in a civil union for three years and moved to Reynosa, Tamaulipas seeking for better opportunities. Motivated by the lack of employment and a desire to give the best to his young daughter, he opened his own grocery store. Fortunately he was able to pull it through and make it grow little by little increasing the variety of products he sells.

In order to continue growing and serve the demand of his clientèle, Elio needs a loan for $250 which he is committing to pay back in 4 months. Today is the time to help. Elio needs of your help and is thankful for the trust you give him.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Elio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en unión libre y desde hace tres años, en busca de mejores oportunidades llegó a Reynosa, Tamaulipas e inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes motivado por la falta de empleo y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija que acababa de nacer, afortunadamente logró sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa.

Para poder continuar creciendo y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Elio necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en un plazo de 4 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Elio necesita de tu ayuda y agradece la confianza que le depositas.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Investimento Group

texts.pt:
The Investimento Group has 3 members: Maria Talvina, president of the Group, Maria Gilda and Helena N.. The group was formed in 2006 by Maria Talvina and Maria Gilda, who were the sole members at the time. Helena joined them just this year. All the members sell used clothing at Limpopo, one of the markets in the surrounding areas of the city of Xai-Xai. They all have children and live with their husbands. With the money from the loan, they would each like to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale, as used clothing sells very well at the Limpopo market. Maria Talvina would like to take 6,160 MT, Maria Gilda 5,120 MT and Helena 6,160 MT. Each would like to repay her loan within 4 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

o Grupo Investimento tem 3 membros a saber Maria Talvina que e a Presidente do Grupo, Maria Gilda e Helena N..O grupo foi formado em 2006. Eram na altura apenas 2 membros as sras Maria Talvina e Maria Gilda. A sra Helena juntou-se a elas ainda este ano. Todas elas vendem roupa usada no mercado Limpopo. Um dos mercados nas redondezas da Cidade de Xai-Xai. Todas elas tem filhos e vivem maritalmente com os seus maridos. Com o dinheiro do emprestimo querem cada uma comprar mais fardos de roupa usada para a venda uma vez que roupa usada tem muita saida no mercado Limpopo.Maria Talvina quer tomar 6.160,00 Mt, Maria Gilda quer tomar 5,120,00 Mt e a Helena quer tomar 6.160,00 Mts.Todas elas querem pagar em 4 meses

loans.use: The members of the Investimento group would like to use the loan money to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Z. lives with her husband and children in their own home in Lourdes, Colon. She has a small shop in the home where she sells groceries, drinks and candy. With the income this generates she's is able to help with the household expenses. She will use this loan to stock the store with the products customers have requested but which she didn't have the funds to buy.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Z. actualmente vive en casa propia en Lourdes, Colon ,la señora tiene una tienda, en su vivienda, en la cual vende productos de consumo y golosinas ,su aporte con el negocio le sirve para poder cubrir parte de los gastos familiares y así poder ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su hijos su propósito con el crédito es comprar algunos productos que los clientes buscan pero que por falta de dinero no a podido comprar, con este crédito surtiría sus estantes y así podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Hadayat's Group

texts.en: I am a mother of seven: five daughters and two sons. My husband and my elder son construct building and my younger son is a rickshaw driver.  Now, my son plans to buy a small truck to transport goods from one place to another for which we request a loan.  Parween B. will use the loan in their cycle repair shop. Basheeran M. requests this loan to buy stock for their general store. Zareen K. will use the money to buy an additional video game for their video games club.

loans.use: To buy a small truck

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and is married with one child, age 6. Mariam owns a food vendor store, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 6 am to 5 pm at her business.

In the past, Mariam has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros E., 51, is a widow and has a business selling banana ice cream (the ice cream is mixed with banana) in her community. She normally earns around $12 a day in revenue. She has five children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. Two of her children sell banana ice cream like their mother, earning about $6 a day in revenue. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to transfer the ice cream to sell door to door (they now use a bicycle). People like banana ice cream in her village so this business is also lucrative.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to sell banana ice cream.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
Born around 1966 in Ouidah in the Atlantique department, southern Benin, Mrs Virginie B. is married and the mother of four children. The children are cared for by both parents. She sells bags of coal at retail and wholesale. Having run this business for about 20 years, Mrs B. has a great deal of experience in the field. Working in a very competitive sector and lacking the means with which to meet demand, she is requesting this loan to expand her business activities as well as satisfy the ever-growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1966 à OUIDAH dans le département de l'ATLANTIQUE au sud du BENIN, dame B. Virginie est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Les enfants sont à la charge des deux géniteurs. Elle est une revendeuse en détail comme en gros de sacs de charbon. Exerçant cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années, dame B. Virginie est dotée d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine. Opérant dans un secteur concurrentiel et les moyens insuffisants pour répondre favorablement à la demande, elle sollicite ce prêt pour étendre son secteur d’activités et aussi pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of coal

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
Adrian Sambrana is a married man with two children and the duty to provide them with everything needed for their development. He has a photography business and his own studio in this house and clients that want photographs for various purposes. He also works outside of the studio if his clients require it.

Since he started the business ten years ago he has managed to improve the living conditions in his family. Today he is requesting a loan at CEPRODEL in order to improve his studio as well as his darkroom where he develops his photos. That's why he trusts that he will receive his loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Adrian Sambrana es un caballero casado y con dos hijos con el deber de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo por ser menores de edad. Este caballero se dedica al negocio de la fotografía teniendo su propio estudio en su casa de habitación donde es visitado por clientes que desean tomarse fotos para diversos fines. Además trabaja ambulante si así se lo requiere algún cliente.

Desde que inicio este negocio hace diez años ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la mejora del local del estudio fotográfico y además para el revelado de las fotografías. Por eso es que confía en que recibirá el crédito sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: To improve his photography studio

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente is a very hard-working person who does agricultural work in Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. The cirumstances he has gone through since several years ago have made him work very hard to put bread on the table every day in his humble home. Committed to his family to improve their quality of life and due to the fact that their community is very remote, he doesn't have electricity, and he has requested the implementation of a solar panel to obtain it.

For this reason, he has come to Ceprodel to obtain a credit to pay for the solar panel. In this way, he can continue working and provide better conditions for his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El caballero Clemente es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Las circunstancias por las cuales ha atravesado desde hace varios años han hecho que se esfuerce mas para llevar el pan de cada día a su humilde hogar. Comprometido con su familia por mejorar las condiciones de vida y debido a que en su comunidad por estar muy alejada no se cuenta con energía eléctrica, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para obtener energía eléctrica.

Por esta razón acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para el pago del panel solar para que de esta manera pueda continuar en su trabajo y con mejores condiciones de vida para su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a solar panel for his home

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon C. and her husband, Mr. Nhong Heak, are grocers in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because sometimes their customers buy on credit, Mrs. Yon C. does not have enough money to purchase inventory for her store. Thus, Mrs. Yon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more goods for the grocery store.

Mrs. Yon C. is 53 and the mother of three children. One child is employed in a garment factory, another is a firewood seller. The youngest child is attending school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the grocery store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth was, at first, selling foods; later, she and her husband were selling both whole chickens and kilograms of chicken. Then, their clients asked Elizabeth and her husband to also sell meat by the kilo, so they supplied beef and pork. Up until the present, they have been a good income. At present, they no longer sell chickens and meat.

Elizabeth needs a loan for US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy merchandise. The loan will also allow her shop to be well stocked for all her clients. She has confidence that with the help of Kiva she will receive her loan.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth inicio primero con la venta de comidas, posteriormente con la ayuda de su esposo fueron vendiendo pollos en kilos y enteros, posteriormente sus clientes les pedían que también vendieran carnes por kilos, el cual pues surtieron carne de res y de puerco. Hasta hoy en día les ha generado buenos ingresos. Actualmente nada más se dedica a la venta de pollos y carnes.

Ella necesita de un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía, y para tener bien surtido para todos sus clientes, tiene la confianza que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is 31 years old. He is married and expecting his first-born child any moment. He has been sewing for seven years. He is a specialist in women's and men's wear. His skills and designs are in a class by themselves. He sews various kinds of styles that give his customers new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, men's short sleeved shirts, kids' wear, etc. He also sews children's school uniforms for most of the schools in Obuasi as subsidiary to give him extra income to support his family.

Michael wants to use the loan to buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase his output and efficiency. He hopes to increase his savings to provide for his family, including his unborn child. He is a member of the community group called 'Judah Abusua Kuo' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Pelagia L. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with one child five years old. Pelagia has been running a poultry business since 2005. Raising kuku or poultry is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for four hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Pelagia currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 850 USD in order to purchase more chicks. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Pelagia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
This will be the second loan cycle for this group of five women.  With this loan, they will be trying to expand their small businesses. Leonie is the representative of this group, and with her first loan she started a small beauty salon in her house. She experienced a lot of success with her first loan, but her business is still very small. With this loan she hopes to increase the size of her salon and the variety of products she sells. She really feels that with this loan she can start to grow the business. Leonie is the young mother of three children, and dreams of education for all of them. She hopes to improve her business so she can provide a good life for her loved ones. She is a very hard-working woman and is on the path to a better life.

On behalf of Leonie, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Equipment for a small beauty salon

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea Y., a 33-year-old mother of three children in Chouksach Commune, Kompong Tom Province, has been growing rice since 1999. She is married to Mr. Eung Him, 29, a horse taxi driver who earns a daily income of about $3.

To earn additional profits and better provide for her family, Sophea is applying for a $300 loan to buy piglets to raise and to replace an old horse.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Isokhoja

texts.en:
Isokhoja happily works on his farm growing vegetables and wheat, crops that, when in season, help him pay their household expenses and necessities for his three children. His children are studying at school and need various supplies to keep studying. He wishes as a father that he can give his children what they need so they can progress through school and later work at jobs other than those in the agricultural sector. In this way, he thinks that many people consider him a hard-working and selfless father. Nonetheless, he now needs help in order to continue working. He needs to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, which are very important for growing products according to market demands. With your help, Isokhoja will be able to support his children's success.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est un regroupement de quatre femmes du quartier Dar-Salam 2 de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui se sont connues depuis des années. Mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et vivent toutes dans de grandes familles. 
Elles mènent presque une seule  activité qui est  la vente de céréales  (la vente de mil, maïs    soja, haricot, etc..). Elles ont de l’expérience dans la vente de céréales
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis six mois. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de mil, maïs et soja pour les revendre.
Elles s’approvisionnent avec les paysans dans les foires des villages environnants et les revendent à leur tour sur place dans les marchés de la ville de Koutiala.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 70 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir chacun un prêt élevé pour l’ouverture d’un magasin de stockage de céréales et  élargir leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four women from the Dar-Salam 2 neighbourhood of the city of Koutiala in Mali. These women have known each other for many years. They are married and have at least four children each; they average 45 years of age and all live in large families. They have one main activity: the sale of cereals such as millet, corn, soya beans, beans, and so on. They are experienced at selling cereals. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join the loans program of Soro Yiriwaso six months ago. This loan will be used to buy bags of millet, corn and soya beans for resale. They buy their cereals from farmers at the markets of neighbouring villages and retail locally in the markets of Koutiala. They expect to make an average profit of 70,000 FCFA each thanks to this loan. This profit will be used to repay the interest on the loan and to contribute to the household expenses of their respective families. In the future, this group plans to borrow a greater amount in order to open a warehouse to store their cereals and expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Bertha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Elizabeth J. S. tiene 29 años es fiscal de su  Banco Comunal, vive en el sector Víctor Raúl del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que salio embarazada y se caso, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Bertha tiene un Internet y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, empezó vendiendo ropa, con el tiempo se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza, con las ganancias obtenidas a logrado abrir un Internet; su negocio se desarrolla en su propia casa. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para la venta.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos de belleza para su stock. 
Bertha sueña con tener un stand de ropa en un centro comercial
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Elizabeth J. S. is a 29-year-old woman who is the fiscal officer at her local bank. She lives in Víctor Raúl, district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed three years of high school and then left school due to pregnancy and marriage. She has two children who are both economically dependent on her. Bertha has an Internet store and also sells beauty products. She began by selling clothing and then started to sell beauty products. With the money she has earned, she was able to open an Internet shop, which is located in her own home. She invested the first loan of 300.00, received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium,” in the purchase of clothing to sell. She will invest this 300.00 loan, which will be paid back in 4 months, in the purchase of beauty products for her stock. Bertha’s dream is to have a clothing stand in a mall.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más productos de belleza para su stock, para así poder obtener mas ganancias.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 48 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa que adquirieron después de su matrimonio. Hace 20 años logró abrir una tienda en su casa, actividad que le permitió crecer económicamente  y le sirvió de apoyo para los gastos del hogar, mas ahora está iniciando un nuevo negocio de venta de comida, alquiló un puesto a lado de su casa y todas las noches atiende a las personas salen a consumir después del arduo trabajo del día. Es así que después de atender todo el día su tienda sale a vender comida junto a su hija, quien la apoya en la atención de su local y juntas trabajan hasta la media noche, quedando exhaustas por su trabajo y con deseos de descansar, sabiendo que el próximo día tendrán el mismo ritmo o quizás mayor. Pero aun así siguen adelante, con la finalidad de lograr la meta de acondicionar los pisos de su casa, ya que desean  alquilar departamentos, pues lo consideran un negocio muy rentable por la zona donde habitan. Ella es cliente hace 5 años y este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, oportunidad que le ayudó a crecer como comerciante y como persona social. Julia invertirá 3700 en la compra de una congeladora, ya que por esta temporada (verano) es necesario ofrecer a sus clientes bebidas heladas que alivien su sed.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in the house that they bought after their wedding. For twenty years she has run a store in her house, which has allowed her to improve her economic situation and help cover her household expenses. But now she has started a new business selling food, renting out a stall next to her house. Every night she serves food to people coming to eat after a long day at work. So after working all day in her store she goes to sell this food with the help of her son. Together they work until midnight, exhausted by the work and wanting to sleep, knowing that the next day they will have to work at the same speed, or possibly faster. However, they continue on with the goal of being able to equip their house with air-conditioning, since they want to rent out apartments, which is considered a very profitable business in the area where they live. Julia has been a client for five years and this is her eighth loan with MFP. Loans help Julia to prosper as a shopkeeper and a member of society. Julia will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a freezer because in the summer it is necessary to offer cold drinks to her thirsty customers.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer for drinks

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson sells spiritual items such as candles, olive oil, incense, and Bibles.  She has been in this trade for years. Samson needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She is 35 years old and married with five children. She lives in Baale Street, Chemist Bus Stop, Igbo-elerin Lagos State, Nigeria. Samson says thanks to Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more spirituals items to sell

loans.name: Sohibchon

texts.ru: Сохибчон работает в комбинате строительных материалов города Исфары разнорабочим. Это основная его работа и за его счет он содержит свою семью. Сохибчону 27 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Несколько месяцев назад его матери поставили диагноз заболевания глаз. Для лечения необходима операция. Сохибчон имеет некоторую сумму но чтобы завершить лечение в полном объеме ему необходимо 1000 сомони. Придя в МикроИнвест он получил консультацию и решил получить займ.
texts.en:
Sohibchon works as a handyman at a building materials establishment in the city of Isfary. This is his primary job and the way he supports his family. Sohibchon is 27 years old, married and has two children. They live with his parents. Several months ago his mother was diagnosed with an eye illness, and needs an operation. Sohibchon has saved a small amount of money, but needs 1000 somoni to complete the full treatment. After consulting with MicroInvest, he decided to take out a loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: His mother's eye surgery

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
Comité Jazmín, así se denomina el comité integrado por 16 mujeres del Bº Anahí de la ciudad de Capiatá. Este grupo se conformó gracias a que la actual presidenta Valentina A.. Ella se acercó a la asesora en una reunión que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  La misma quedó muy entusiamada y logró conformar su grupo en fecha 12 de setiembre del 2008 con 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con este programa.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropas artesanales, venta de frutas y verduras, venta comidas, venta de remedios refrescantes, venta de golosinas, venta de ropas de propia confección, etc.

Todas las integrantes del grupo demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Valentina A. - 	Confección y venta de ropas artesanales - 
Silvina M.	 - Venta de comidas. - 
Rosa A.	 - Venta de ropas y lencerias - 
Marina Pérez	 - Venta de comidas -  
Celia González	 - Venta de comidas - 
Milda R.	 - Venta de  golosinas - 
Gladys González	 - Costurera - 
Nilva P.	 - Venta de remedios refrescantes - 
Ida E.	 - Venta de lencerias - 
Evangelista A.	 - Venta de comidas y bebidas - 
Limpia P. 	 - Venta de comidas - 
Andresa Benítez	 - Venta de comidas - 
Gladys López	 - Venta de bebidas - 
Gloria P.	 - Venta de bebidas - 
Adriana I.	- Venta de verduras -
texts.en:
The Jazmín group is comprised of 16 women from Bº Anahí, in Capiatá city. The group was formed thanks to its current president, Valentina A.. She approached one of Fundacion Paraguaya's administrators at a neighbourhood meeting held to promote female entrepreneurs and communal banking, and was so enthusiastic about the program that she founded the Jazmín group, along with 15 other women, on September 12th, 2008. They are all very happy to be working with the program. The group's members will use this loan for their businesses: Silvina M., Marina Pérez, Celia González, Limpia P. , Andresa Benítez, and Evangelista A. sell meals; Milda R. sells sweets; Rosa A. and Ida E. sell clothing and lingerie; Valentina A. makes and sells traditional clothing; Gladys González is a tailor; Adriana I. sells vegetables; and Nilva P., Gladys López, and Gloria P. sell drinks. All the group's members work in solidarity with one another. They attend weekly meetings and always work with the well being of the entire group in mind.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals, material for clothing production, ect.

loans.name: Margine Raquel

texts.es:
Margine Raquel R. M. tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Margine tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Margine es la venta de bisutería.
Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Margine inicio este negocio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su casa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera en la que puede ofrecer sus productos. Doña Margine dice tener los propósitos de incrementar su inventario para competir fuertemente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo efectuara la compra de collares, pulseras, cadenas aretes de plata y oro laminado. Los sueños de Margine son de establecerse en una tienda y así  proporcionarle este negocio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Margine Raquel R. M. is 35, single, and has 2 children. She makes a living by selling imitation jewelry. She has done this for more than 4 years. She started this business to cover her home's expenses. She works as a street vendor since this is the only way she has of offering her products. Doña Margine's goal is to increase her inventory to be able to compete strongly. The financing requested will go towards working capital so she can purchase necklaces, bracelets, chains, and earrings of silver and gold laminate. Her dreams are to establish a store and to leave her business to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma E., 52 and married with one adult-aged child, is from the city of Ramonal, Cagayan de Oro where she owns and operates a mini-restaurant (carenderia). The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over seven years, earning approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, Wilma is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to invest in further expansion of the business. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Ramonal, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Adekanbi

texts.en: M. sells drinks and bags; she started this business over five years ago and she hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags to sell.M. is 41 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel M. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 30 years old and is married. To make a living, Ariel owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services with his motorcycle in their community. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In October 2008, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcycle. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair motorcycle used in his business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth B. has a small grocery shop where she sells items such as fruit juice, tinned fish and the like at Beposo near Shama. Ruth has received junior high school education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Ruth has been running the grocery shop since 2006. She is responsible for supporting her family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for resale to increase sales and expand the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more provisions for resale to increase sales and expand the business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O., 39 years old and married with one child, lives in Warri with her family. She sells sarongs and is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Esther Wairimu

texts.en:
Esther Wairimu M. is fifty two years old and married to  fifty-seven year old Jonathan M.. They have  a twenty five year old daughter named Mary Wambui M..

Esther has been selling African attire for five years now. She has no loans from othe MFIs and was introduced to KADET by existing members. She intends to use the loan to buy more stock to sell.
The client's area of business is densely populated and she relies on foreign customers to buy her clothes. With the extra profits generated from the increase in stock, Esther intends to open a big shop so that she can make the clothes she sells instead of purchasing them from wholesalers.

Esther believes she is hardworking and determined and her hopes and dreams are to be supplying in East African Market.

 ABOUT KADET LTD. 

Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The client intends to use the whole amount of loan to increase the stock of African Attire as the demand is high.

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Sr. SATURNINO P. R.,a quien apreciamos en la fotografía sentado; tiene 43 años de edad, está felizmente casado y tiene un hijo que está cursando la secundaria. Actualmente el Sr. Saturnino, es el Secretario de la ALCOM “Mujeres Fuertes y Unidas”, reside en la zona de Comas al igual que los 10 socios que la integran.

El Sr. Saturnino hace cinco años se dedica a atender su negocio de nombre Nino’s Burguer, ofreciendo a su clientela comida rápida como sanguches, salchipapas y pollos broaster.

El nos cuenta que luego de seis años prestando servicios como vendedor en una empresa privada, con el dinero que recibió de su liquidación, adquirió un carrito sanguchero, con el que inicia su negocio, ubicándose en la acera de su casa.

Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo pudo adquirir poco a poco mesas, sillas y ha equipado un espacio de su casa especialmente para atender a mas clientes y estos consuman su comida en un ambiente cómodo.

Gracias a su trabajo, él ha logrado tener una estabilidad y tranquilidad económica, no pasan por necesidades graves, y se pueden darse gustos como paseos en familia ya que para él ellos don lo más importante y son quienes los motivan a trabajar más y progresar.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, modernizarlo y abrir otros locales.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Mr. Saturnino P. R. (the man sitting in the picture) is 43 years old, happily married, and has a son in high school. Mr. Saturnino is the current secretary for ALCOM “Mujeres Fuertes and Unidad.” He, and the other ten members of the group, all live in the Comas area. Mr. Saturnino has worked at his business, Nino’s Burger, selling fast food like sandwiches, fries, and broasted chicken for five years. He tells us that after working as a vendor in a private company for 6 years, he bought a sandwich cart with his severance pay. He parks his cart on the sidewalk in front of his home. Bit by bit and after a lot of hard work, he was able to get some tables and chairs and has turned part of his house into a place where his customers can eat comfortably. Thanks to his job, he has been able to reach some economic stability and tranquility. They don’t lack for basic necessities and can enjoy a few family activities like trips. The most important thing for them is to want to work and to get ahead. He hopes to grow his business by modernizing it and opening other locations. He plans to buy supplies with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking up on lengths of African "waxcloth"

loans.name: Nkere 4 Nampumba Molly Group

texts.en: N. Molly is 42 years old.  She is a single mother of two children who are all in school and four dependents she also manages to send to school. She will use this loan to purchase electrical devices like televisions, radios, cables, etc to sell. She has been in her business for two years so far. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase electrical devices like televisions, radios, and cables

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of  Tambo, Ilian City. She is 50 years old. Ruth is married and has one child. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ruth has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: C 8869 Abakundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Odette is 41 years old and is married with two children with ages of 5 and 25 years. She lives in the Western Province of Rwanda, which is approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here Odette is the president of a group called “Abakundumurimo”.

This group has operated a business of selling a variety of drinks and food supplies for many years; in fact, this is the twelfth successful year of business for them! This bustling enterprise employs people who work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

After paying back their first loan in full and on time, this group is now requesting its second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business. They will use the loan to purchase additional and larger quantities of food supplies and drinks needed by a number of their customers.

With this loan, and assuming the members of this group are successful, they hope to earn enough profit to allow them to buy their own warehouse for their business. They dream of providing a much better standard of living for their families

loans.use: To purchase more sorgham and supplies

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Señor R. es casado propietario de una carpinteria ubicada a dos cuadras de la agencia de la Fundación de Lambare, cuenta con 30 años de antiguedad en la zona,  con una clientela formada.

Este credito fue otorgado con rl fin de comprar insumos por el aumento de demanda de sus mercaderias y para la compra de algunos instrumento que se requieren en la carpinteria, con el objetivo de fabricar mubles mas finos y sofisticados como los consumidores desean.

El señor R. expreso que la ayuda crediticia brindada por la Fundación fue de mucha utilidad para el progreso de la actividad  que el mismo realiza y por ello esta muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Mr. R. is married and owns a carpentry shop located two blocks from the Lambaré offices of Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya. He's been in the area for 30 years and has a solid clientele. The loan he is requesting will serve to buy materials so that he can satisfy the high demand of some of his products, as well as to buy woodworking tools that will allow him to build the much finer and sophisticated furniture his customers demand. Mr. R. has said that the financial help he received from the Fundación was very useful to his commercial activities and, therefore, he is grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying woodworking materials and tools

loans.name: Yadira Patricia

texts.es:
En el popular barrio  Nueva Esperanza, habitado por gente alegre y solidaria,    vive Yadira Y., con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella, es propietaria  de una peluquería denominada “Sala de belleza Mente y Arte”. Allí, ofrece los servicios de manicure, pedicure, Blower, tratamiento capilar y corte de cabello, principalmente. Su idea de negocio empezó a funcionar hace ocho años, cuando aun  no tenía un establecimiento abierto al público, porque ofrecía sus servicios a domicilio. 
En Diciembre del año 2008 hizo su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por un valor de $1.200.000 que lo invirtió en la adecuación de su salón de belleza en su propia vivienda, dándole forma a su negocio. En esta oportunidad espera invertir su crédito por el mismo valor en la compra de un multimueble, para mejorar el lava cabeza, comprar productos que utiliza para sus clientes e invertir en publicidad y estimular a un mayor mercado.

El gran propósito de Yadira es modernizar su salón de belleza, por eso planea a mediano plazo adquirir tecnología que le facilite asesorar a sus clientes y contratar personal para generar mayores ingresos y fuente de empleo.  Ella conoce muy bien su trabajo, por eso extiende sus jornadas laborales en épocas de máxima productividad y realiza promociones especiales en los días menos concurridos. La excelente calidad de sus servicios le ha facilitado su posicionamiento en el mercado objetivo, impacto que se ha visto reflejado  principalmente en la estabilidad personal y familiar porque se han incrementado los ingresos en su hogar .

Durante el siguiente año está programada en el proceso formativo empresarial de la Fundación, ella cada día se preocupa por aprender a controlar sus operaciones administrativas, evaluar su capacidad de endeudamiento y construir herramientas mercadológicas, por eso su negocio se proyecta  como una unidad sólida y es que Yadira es una mujer organizada y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Yadira Y. lives with her husband and two small children in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood, a popular area inhabited by cheerful and mutually supportive people. She has a beauty salon called “Sala de Belleza Mente y Arte.” She offers manicure, pedicure, hair drying, hair treatment, and hair cutting services, primarily. She started her business 8 years ago when she didn’t have a shop open to the public; she would go to her customers’ homes to provide services. In December, 2008, she took out her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It was for $1.200.000, which she used to equip a salon in her home. This time she hopes to use this loan, for the same amount, to buy a beautician’s station, to improve the shampooing station, to buy products she uses with her customers, and to invest in publicity to reach a wider market. Yadira’s main goal is to modernize her beauty salon. In the immediate future she wants to acquire the technology that will help her to better assess her customers’ needs and to hire personnel to generate higher income and to be a source of employment. She knows her work very well; that’s why she extends her working days during periods of maximum productivity and she has special promotions on the less busy days. The excellent quality of her services has situated her well in the marketplace, a reality that is reflected in her personal and family stability because household income has increased. During the next year she is scheduled to participate in the Fundación’s business development program. Thanks to the fact that Yadira is an organized and responsible woman, she attempts daily to learn how to manage her administrative operations, to evaluate her debt capacity, and to design marketing strategies to make her business a solid enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a beautician station, improve the shampoo station, buy products she uses with her customers, and invest in publicity to widen her market's area.

loans.name: Mrs. Pheon Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pheon C. is 61 years old. She is the village bank president of 15 members who all live in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pheon C. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Orel Loem, is a farmer. They own two hectares of land for growing rice to support their family. This family now faces a big problem because their rice field has interfile soil. Thus, Mrs. Pheon C. decided to apply for a second loan to bU. fertilizer to increase their rice yield. This couple has three children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory; one helps selling groceries and the other is studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto A., es casado y con su esposa y vive en el barrio la Francia su esposa se dedica a las actividades domésticas, ellos son mayores de edad y se dedican desde hace 25 años a la agricultura e iniciaron su actividad en este rubro gracias al apoyo de sus padres, dentro de las limitantes que se les ha presentado a lo largo de los años ha sido la poca financiacion que tiene esta actividad en Nicaragua, para esto el solicita se le beneficie con este credito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la cosecha, esto ayudara a la rapida venta de la producción, generandole a corto tiempo la recuperanción y las utilidades de lo invertido.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Alberto A. and his wife live in the neighborhood of La Francia. His wife takes care of the household activities. All of their children are grown. Julio has been engaged in agriculture for 25 years and started in this trade with the help and support of his parents. One of the limitations he has had to deal with over the years is the scarce availability of funding available to farmers in Nicaragua. He will greatly benefit from this loan request and will use the funds to purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops. This will help him speed up the sale of his harvest so that he can recoup his investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khaled owns an aluminum manufacturing workshop where he produces doors, windows, and other aluminium products. He has been running the workshop, with the help of his brothers, for eight years.

Khaled is a young man from the Aida Refugee Camp in Bethlehem in the southern part of Palestine. He is one of seven brothers who work together to support the family.

Khaled is taking a loan from FATEN to expand his business and bring more customers to the workshop. He will use the loan funds to purchase more raw aluminium and a device to manufacture aluminum products. His workshop is one of the successful ones, as well as being the only source of income for the entire family, beside the simple salaries of his brothers.

The sustainability of the business will help Khaled getting married and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: To buy a device for manufacturing aluminum products

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí. Ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. El nos comenta que adquirió su vehículo gracias al dinero que logró ahorrar de su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. El trabaja en su vehículo durante todo el dia y cubre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Cayaltí y sus caseríos.

Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de embutidos en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí. Estas actividades le sirven para solventar los gastos familiares y sacar adelante a los suyos.

El contínuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su mototaxi.

Rolando es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rolando, 38, is married and lives with his four children in Cayaltí district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He provides passenger and cargo transportation services as a mototaxi driver. He tells us that he got his vehicle thanks to money he was able to save up from raising and selling animals.
