He works in his vehicle all day and covers routes within the city of Cayaltí and its surrounding settlements. Occasionally he sells cured meats in Cayaltí's market. These activities make it possible for him to meet family expenses and to move his family ahead in life. The constant use of his vehicle has caused it to begin to need service and repair. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to invest in service and repair of his mototaxi. Rolando is quite a responsible and hard-working person. He has collaborated previously with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi service and repair.

loans.name: Germilina

texts.en:
Germilina P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 41 years old. Germilina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Germilina owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Germilina has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $158 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Germilina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germilina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Germilina is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield and to buy fertilizers as well. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Kmor

texts.en:
Kmor T., 19, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She produces cow ties and sells her products for an income of about $0.70 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver from the province to Phnom Penh, earning an income of $5 per day.  

T. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to fix the house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El Sr. J. M. Jorge luis, vive en Prolongación Catalina Buendia de Pecho perteneciente al Distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene dos hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. J.  Trabaja como obrero de campo en la empresa agricola Drokasa desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con casa propia la cual esta construyendo. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda. Su sueño es poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El Sr. J.  agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis J. M. lives in Prolongación Catalina Buendia de Pecho, in the district of Pachacutec. He has two children. His wife is a homemaker. Mr. J. has been working as a field laborer for the agricultural company Drokasa for 10 years. He has his own house, which he is building. He is requesting a loan to finish his house. His dream is to finish building his house so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children. Mr. J. is grateful for the support we are able to provide him though this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvments

loans.name: Anvarali

texts.en:
J. Anvarali is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. For 5 years Anvarali has been running a farming business and also providing the service of a tractor driver to local farmers. He is planning to sow potatoes and onions on his land. He wants to borrow the loan for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. Therefore, Anvarali is asking for a loan of 5500 Somoni. You could become an important part in Anvarali family's life, and he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fuel and lubricants, and supplies to redo the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin in Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Vivian is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 24900 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle to provide better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Vivian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Enayat

texts.en:
Enayat K. is a married woman from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. She is 28 years old and has 3 sons and one daughter. Enayat's husband, Ziyad, is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority. His salary barely covers their household expenses, so Enayat started another business to help her husband afford the expenses of their large family.

Enayat and her husband rented a small store and started a mini-market where she sells the basics to people in the neighborhood. To increase the benefits of her business, Enayat came to FATEN to take a $2,000 loan to purchase goods. Enayat works in the mini-market as does her husband when he comes back from his work in the evenings.

Ziyad appears in the picture in front of the goods they sell in the mini-market because his wife is conservative.

loans.use: Purchase Goods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine was born in 1973 and is married with five children who are aged between 2 and 12. No one in her family works, only Josephine herself, and this situation requires her to work hard so that she provides her children with all their needs.

Josephine owns a small business selling charcoal and has an experience of sixteen years in her business. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except Sunday.

Now, Josephine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more sacks of charcoal. This purchasing of more sacks will allow her to satisfy her customers which will make her more efficient and effective and more successful.

loans.use: To expand her business through purchasing more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mrs. Vanndy Ael Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 villagers from Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The group members will use their portions of the loan in various ways to earn money to support their families.
Mrs. Vanndy A. is 29 years old and has been selected as the village bank president by the other members. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school while the other is two years old. Vanndy is a fruit seller at her local marK. where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Naren Theng, is a famer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. The couple has a problem because their field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Vanndy A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm in order to increase yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoen S. and her husband, Mr. Sun Sam, have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married, the son is a garment factory worker, and the other daughter attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Yoen is a rice farmer. Her husband raises cows at home and also assists his wife in the farming business. She asked for a Kiva loan once already, and she now is requesting her second loan of $1,000 to bury a drainage pipe, and buy fertilizer to put on her rice farm.

loans.use: To bury a drainage pipe and buy fertilizer to put on her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber repairing toilets, faucets, etc., since 2000. In addition, he works on gypsum board decoration. He works on a freelance basis and he also works on private home projects. His father is taking care of the household but the borrower also helps him with the family expenses, home rental, food expenses, etc. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to add to his work tools because his business is getting bigger and he must be prepared for any new projects. He intends that, with the help of the loan and the new tools, his profit will automatically be increased. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in micro-finance. At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to its micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To add to his work tools

loans.name: Nuulu

texts.en:
Nuulu is married with eight children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  She owns a charcoal store at her home in Bwaise. She has been in this charcoal business for eight years.   

She plans to use this loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more bags of charcoal. She has no additional income and sells to all people in the area but on a retail basis. She buys bags of charcoal from delivery vans, which get them from villages, so she doesn’t incur any transport costs for her business. She aspires to go to the producers directly. 

She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. Nuulu decided to join MCDT because of low interest rate charged. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her  monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is 35 years old and is married with four children. He owns a piece of land where he grows tomatoes and he has been in this business for about five years. He starts working on his land early in the morning and finishes late in the evening hours.

Alexis needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a machine to be used in fertilizing his tomatoes. With this machine, he hopes that his harvest will increase which, in turn, will increase his sales as well as his profits.

If successful, Alexis will be able to continue taking care of his family and, in addition to that, he will keep finding out how to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a machine to fertilize his tomatoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of San Pedro San Pablo. She is 23 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and school fees for her children.  

For over fifteen years she has operated her retail shop selling sugar, tea leaves, and maize flour. Asha's potential customers are her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition as many retail shops sell similar products. She hopes to buy a plot of land in the future to construct rental houses.

Her major reason for working with Yehu is its good reputation. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase ten bags of charcoal, five bags of beans and maize for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of charcoal, five bags of beans and maize for her shop

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 55 years old, married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Flaviana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and selling assorted crops. She has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flaviana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to redeem her pawned land. This will be Flaviana’s 4th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Peace Kaconco has a retail shop in the Bwashwa trading center where she sells salt, sugar and soft drinks to the local people. She has been in business for five years and makes 60,000 UGX in monthly profits. She also grows food to sell.

Peace is a new Pearl Microfinance client and belongs to Bwashwa Tukore Group B. She needs a loan to buy more stock for resale. Being a hard worker has enabled her to grow, as well as allowed her children to study. She hopes for the best.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more merchandise

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth, D. 40 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive en compañía D. su mamá Uldea, D. 50 años y sus hermanos; con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en Palca. Hace más D. 20 años que se dedica a L. agricultura, donD. junto a su mamá siembra alverja, papa y maíz. Su producción es D. buena calidad, por ello en cada cosecha los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado central D. su localidad, le ofrecen buen pago por su producción. Pero como buen trabajador del campo; también trabaja como peón en los terrenos agrícolas D. los pobladores D. su localidad. Pero las ambiciones D. Roberth, es sembrar en mayores cantidades, y con las ganancias que obtiene comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Esta el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socio antiguo D. su banco comunal, asegura que seguirá trabajando por el bien D. sus integrantes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa D. alverja y 4 sacos D. abono, que le servirá para sembrar en su terreno agrícoL..
texts.en: Roberth is 40 years old and is a single and hardworking man.  He lives with his mother, Uldea, who is 50 years old and his siblings in a home he owns in Palca.  He has dedicated himself to agriculture for more than 20 years, planting peas, potatoes and corn along with his mother.  His production is of high quality, and for this reason, after each harvest, the wholesale buyers from his town’s central market offer him a good price for his crops.  But because he is a good farmer, he also works the lands of the settlers in his town.  Roberth’s goal is to grow greater quantities of his crops and buy more land with his earnings.  This is his second credit with MFP and as a long-standing member of his community bank, he assures that he will continue working for the well-being of its members.  He will purchase a bag of peas and four sacks of fertilizer with the loan that he is requesting.  This will allow him to plant more crops in his plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a bag of seeds to plant peas and 4 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El Señor Mario Jose M. F. tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilan, es un hombre soltero sin hijos, agricultor desde hace 15 años, fue con el apoyo de su padre que logro, aprender y emprenderse en esta actividad, siendo ahora el sustento económico de su vida, es para sus terrenos que solicitó un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas, que permitan un optimo mantenimiento Fito Sanitario, espera le apoyen y a futuro le favorezcan a diversificar sus cultivos, por otros que tengan un buen consumo, y que beneficien a su bienestar económico y social.
texts.en:
Mario Jose M. F. is 34 years old.  He lives in the Lomas del Gavilan neighborhood.  He is a single man, and he has no children.  He has been a farmer for 15 years.  It was with his father’s support that he undertook this activity, learned it, and succeeded.  It is now his financial support.

He requested the loan for his fields.  He will buy vegetative supplies, fertilizers, and fungicides.  These will allow for optimum maintenance, health, and sanitation.  He hopes he will be supported.  In the future he would like to diversify his crops with others that are much consumed.  That will benefit his financial and social well-being.

loans.use: Maintenance, health, and sanitation of his crops

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca C. G. de 40 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como jornalero, y así mismo vive junto a su hijo y un nieto. Juana trabaja muy duro de lunes a domingo elaborando tortillas, las cuales son un alimento muy típico el cual forma parte de la alimentación básica de las personas, ya que los salvadoreños las consumen a diario hasta tres veces al día, por lo que es un negocio bastante estable, en el cual se cuenta con muchos clientes a pesar de poseer diferente competencia. Juana y su familia depende en gran manera de las ganancias de este negocio por lo que es de mucha importancia poder mejorar sus ventas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar tambos de gas propano, esto lo hace con el deseo de contar con la materia prima de su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en: Juana Francisca C. G. is 40 years old and lives in the department of Usulután, along with her husband, who works as a day laborer, and her son and grandson.  From Monday to Sunday, Juana works very hard making tortillas, which are a very common food that is part of people's basic diet.  People in El Salvador often eat them every day, three times a day.  Therefore, her business is rather stable and she can count on many customers despite the various competition.  Juana and her family rely in great part on the profits from this business so it is very important for her to be able to improve her sales.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral.  She hopes to buy wholesale corn, as well as to buy propane gas tanks.  In this way, she will have the necessary materials for her business and will be able to bring in more income, which would be of great benefit to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas

loans.name: Sarath's Group

texts.en: In Prey Snuol village, Takeo province, fourteen people make up a village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan to support their family's living situation. Mrs. Sarath C. has been selected by the other members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice for sale. Her husband, Mr. Srung Sroeun, is a motorcycle taxi driver who helps support the family, too. They try to work hard, yet they only earn a small income. She wants to buy a cow for a new income stream, but her current savings is not enough to buy one. She is seeking a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow. She is a mother of two children who are not enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito, de 59 años, es un hombre maduro y muy serio. Su familia consta de su esposa Sara y sus 4 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora él vive solo con su esposa  y su nieto Jesús, en su casa propia, ubicada la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). A pesar de su avanzada edad, esté hombre trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su nieto, ya que su papá murió, y él, es el único que se dedica de su educación y sus cuidados. El principal sustento de Tito, es la agricultura, ahí siembra café y plátanos, desde hace 20 años. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es embolsar las plantitas de café, esperando con ansias poder transplantarlos a los terrenos agrícolas. Asimismo, le gusta negociar sus granos de café, ya que recibirá la recompensa de muchos meses de trabajo y sacrificio. En adelante planea ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder pagar los estudios de su nieto. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está seguro podrá obtener muchos logros. Tito, dentro de muy poco comenzará la cosecha de café, por ello con el crédito que solicita,  invertirá en la compra de materiales necesarios para levantar un pequeño campamento entre sus cultivos, y de esa manera acelerar el proceso de recolección.
texts.en: Tito, age 59 years, is a mature and very serious man.  His family is comprised of his wife, Sara, and their 4 children, all of legal age.  Now he lives alone with his wife and his grandson, Jesus, in his own house, located the Unión Palomar community (Peruvian central forest).  In spite of his advanced age, this man works arduously to help his grandson get ahead, since his grandson's father died, and Tito is the only one who is dedicated to caring for him and his education.  Tito's main occupation is agriculture.  He has grown coffee and bananas for 20 years. What he likes most about his work is to pot the young coffee plants, hoping with anxiety to be able to transplant them to the agricultural lands.  Likewise, he likes to negotiate for the sales of the coffee beans, since then he will receive the reward of many months of work and sacrifice.  In the future he plans to save sufficient money to be able to pay for his grandson's education.  He belongs to the "Borrowers of the Union" communal bank, and this is his first loan that he has had with MFP, where he is sure will be able to obtain many achievements.  Tito, will soon begin a new coffee crop.  Because of this with the credit that he requests, he will invest in the purchase of the necessary materials to raise a small camp among his cultivations, and in that way to accelerate the process of harvesting.

loans.use: To buy materials to raise a camp inside his agricultural fields.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is an 18-year old single man who has worked as a barber for four years. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from al Majmoua, in order to buy extra chairs for cutting hair, in addition to an extra shower chair.   As he stated, "More chairs, less time, more income!"   Mouhamad is liked by most of his neighbors, and all of them wish him the best.   He hopes to succeed in his business since he couldn't succeed in education.

loans.use: To buy new chairs for cutting hair, in addition to a shower chair

loans.name: Unidas Para El Exito Group

texts.ru:
Alcancía Comunal "UNIDAS PARA EL EXITO"

Pelagia es madre D. 2 hijos, uno D. 14 años y el otro D. 11 años, quienes estudian y por las tardes ayudan a su madre en el negocio que elL. posee, Pelagia ofrece el servicio D. alquiler D. cabinas D. internet, elL. comenzó 5 años atras en L. busqueda D. un trabajo o negocio en el cual no tenga que alejarse D. casa ya que sus hijos eran pequeños, luego junto con su esposo decidieron usar el dinero D. sus ahorros en L. compra D. 8 computadoras, y asi fue como comenzó, en L. actualidad posee 11 computadoras las cuales pone en alquiler para que el usuario haga uso del internet, elL. sueña con comprar un auto para ofrecer servicio D. taxi, en su hogar elL. asume los gastos familiares, mientras que su esposo solo paga lo que falta y el resto lo destinan al ahorro.
Pelagia es parte D. L. Alcancía Comunal "UNIDAS PARA EL EXITO", grupo llamado asi porque se sintieron identificadas con dicho título, ellas se unieron para ser parte D. su exito propio y grupal, afrontar con decicion el presente y quieren crecer en lo que se propongan, ellas nos dicen "Cuando existe union, hay amistad; por lo que nos lleva al exito seguro"
texts.en:
Alcancía Comunal "UNIDAS PARA EL EXITO"

Pelagia is the mother of two children, one aged 14 and the other aged 11 years, who study and in the afternoons help their mother in her business. Pelagia offers the service of renting internet cabins, five years ago she started looking for a job or a business in which she wouldn't have to be far away from home since her children were small, then together with her husband they decided to use the money they had saved to buy 8 computers and that is how it started. Right now she has 11 computers which she rents so that the user can use the internet, she dreams of buying a car to be able to offer a taxi service, in her home she pays for all the family expenses while her husband only pays what's missing and the rest goes into savings.  

Pelagia is part of the Communal Moneybox "United for success", the group is called that because they felt identified with that title, the women united to be part of their own and of the group's success to face the present with dedication, and they want to grow in what they propose. They tell us that "When a union exists, there is friendship; that is what will take us to sure success".

loans.use: compra de nueva computadora para su cabina de internet

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Martha, reside en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután, vive con su madre quien tiene 70 años de edad; su esposo y dos hijos de 10 y 16 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de pan dulce,  este negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santiago de María, lo atiende de 6:00am a 5:00pm, el cual inicio por sus propios medios.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pan, ya que su negocio es adquirir el pan a bajo costo para venderlo con un margen de ganancia, con este préstamo pretende comprar el producto y continuar en la tarea de comercializarlo buscándole siempre ganar.
Las aspiraciones de doña Martha es algún día poseer su propia panadería y distribuir a los negocios de la ciudad donde reside.
texts.en:
Martha lives in Santiago de María, in Usulután department, with her 70 year-old mother, her husband and two children aged 10 and 16.  Martha buys and sells 'pan dulce' (sweet bread).  Her business is located in Santiago de María town market, and she works there from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  She started her business with her own resources.

Martha is currently requesting a loan to buy bread since her business consists of buying bread at a low cost and then selling it with a profit margin.  She plans to use this loan to buy her product and continue in her business of selling it, always looking to make a profit.  Her goal is to one day own her own bakery and distribute her products to the businesses in her city.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alecia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Alecia has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Ma. Elma works hard to support her family.   She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling herbal medicine.  Ma. Elma is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of breads for her food vending business.

Ma. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17th loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of bread to sell

loans.name: Jauna

texts.es:
Juana A. Fernández, tiene la edad de 37 años, está casado  y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos que son sus prioridades. Ella lo que pretende es comprar una moto para su trasporte al trabajo. Ella tiene un trabajo largo de donde vive y su trasporte es muy difícil por lo cual opto con la compra del vehículo para ser más puntual con la hora de llegada y ser más eficiente. Ella lo0 que quiere es seguir adelante con su trabajo y seguir generando ganancias para el sustento diario.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juana A. Fernández is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and 2 children who are her priorities. She would like to buy a motorcycle to travel to work, Juana’s job is far from where she lives and transportation is difficult which is why she decided it would be best to buy a vehicle to be more punctual and efficient. Juana wants to keep going with her job and to keep earning her wages for her daily expenses.

This is Juana’s first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with ease and low interest rates.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad, vive en su casa con su 2 hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio de  luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Leonor se dedica desde algún tiempo a la venta de comidas y bebidas, en un puesto que tiene en la plaza central de este distrito, la atención es de lunes a sábado, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que adquiere puede solventar todas sus necesidades.

Al observar que su clientela aumenta a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la preparación de sus distintas comidas y bebidas y utensilios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el aumento de sus ganancias permitira cubrir su préstamo y mejorar su niveldevida.  Leonor es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa,con la finalidad de que su negocio cada vez crezca más y sea el mejor de la zona en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Leonor is the mother of a family, 45 years old, and she lives at home with her two children. Their home is equipped only with electricity and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, at about 40 minutes of the department of Piura. This is an agricultural, farming, and artisan district.

For some time Leonor has been selling prepared foods and drinks from a stand she has in the central plaza of the district. She is open from Monday to Saturday and she has her own clientele. With the income she earns she is able to provide for all other needs.

When she saw an increase in clients she requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase ingredients to prepare the different foods and drinks, and to purchase utensils to provide her clients with a better level of service. The increase in her profits will help her repay her loan and to improve the quality of her life. Leonor is a very hardworking and earnest woman. Her goal for the near future is to make her business progressively increase until it is the best in the region.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils with which to prepare her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en: Rozina is 40 years old and has given birth to four sons. Her eldest son operates a grocery store and the others are studying in a local school. Rozina supports her family by sewing clothes. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. Due to her work, she receives a good number of orders every month from her community clients. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries like sugar, spices, rice etc to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and to increase his profits. Rozina is expecting that her son’s business will improve and her family will be able to make their life better as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries like sugar, spices, rice etc for her son to sell

loans.name: Sain

texts.en:
Sain, 50 years old, is a farmer who raises pigs at home. Her husband is also a farmer and a motor taxi driver. Their income is $25 per day. They have six children. Two are studying and four are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $10 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to open a small grocery shop at home. She still will raise pigs but she wants to have another career to get more income. 

Before, she sold only paddies, and then she started raising pigs to get baby pigs to sell, but the income is still up and down, so she wants to have a steady career. That’s why she wants to sell groceries at home. Her long-term goal is to support her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To open a small grocery shop at home.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old. She is married and has three children between 10 and 4 years old. Two of the children go to school. Her husband is a lawyer.

Rose sells clothes. She has been doing this business since 2007. From this business, she has been able to buy a piece of land. 

She needs a loan to increase her capital by buying more clothes. She plans to buy more clothes from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella vende perfumes, cremas, lápiz labiales y esmaltes de uñas, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women") communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  

The member is 29 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling beauty products.  She sells perfumes, creams, lipsticks, and nail polish independently from 9:00am until 7:00pm.  She wants to expand and improve the business.  She is asking for a loan to purchase wholesale beauty products.

The member is happy to have the loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale beauty products.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a business selling fish at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the future. 

With the 60,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish to resell

loans.name: Ronni

texts.es: Ronnie de 20 años vive con su cónyuge en Soledad, municipio de Colombia con el mayor crecimiento poblacional del país. Allí tiene su negocio llamado “Puesto de Minuto Yayi”, iniciado hace dos años vendiendo servicios de telefonía celular por minutos y posteriormente aprovechando su mercado doméstico compró una vitrina vertical y una horizontal, la surtió de mercancía, comprada en la Isla de San Adres y adicionó más planes de celulares, los cuales hoy completan  10 de diversos operadores.  En la actualidad Ronnie planea comprar una fotocopiadora y adicionar más planes de telefonía e invertir en dulcería, así como también comprará accesorios femeninos, perfumería y cremas para manos y cuerpo en general.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su inversión   proyecta ser una  exitosa, pues conoce perfectamente su clientela en el barrio y planea conquistar aún más su mercado de jóvenes, quienes son sus principales clientes.
texts.en: Ronnie is 20 years old and lives with his spouse in Soledad, the Colombian town with the most population growth in the country. There he has his business called  “Puesto de Minuto Yayi”. He opened  it two years ago selling cell phone services by the minute and later, to take advantage of the store he has in his house, he bought one vertical and one horizontal display case and filles them with merchandise bought on the island of Andres. He added more cell phone plans, and now there are 10 from different companies. At present, Ronnie plans on buying a copier and adding more telephone plans and investing in candies. He will also buy women's accessories, perfume and hand and body creams. This Kiva loan is the first that he has received from the  Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He thinks the investment will be successful since he really knows his customers in the neighborhood and he plans on getting even more of the youth market, who are his main customers.

loans.use: to buy a copier and add more telephone plans, as well as to invest in candies.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 31 years old and the single mother of a 7-year-old child. She has been a rice grower for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her child’s needs.
 
Fridah is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. Fridah will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her daughter. Her hopes and dreams are to own her farm and educate her daughter up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Sauni

texts.en:
Sauni is 43 years old and married to Kakeni. They are blessed with children. He is a livestock trader in the busy area of Bissil Kajiando, Kenya, where most of his clients are males. He has been doing this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.

Sauni was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff. He has a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock with the whole amount.

He will use the extra profit to start a dairy farm. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Josina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  provincia  de mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e maé de 3 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua maé enviando dinheiro. 

 Nunca saiu da sua terra natal sempre viveu em Maputo, é negociante  ha mais de 21 anos e tem uma mini ferragem onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (ferro, arame, pedra, chapas, pregos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do material na sua ferragem. 
No futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio abrindo outra ferragem, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Josina was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique; she is single and the mother of 3 children who all attend school. She completed 8th grade and didn’t continue her education due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother by sending her money.

She has never left her birthplace and has always lived in Maputo where she has been a businesswoman for 21 years. She has a small hardware store where she manages a monthly income of around 5,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenses and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans with other banks and heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and will be for the value of 25,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase goods (iron, wire, stone, sheets, nails and others) to increase the quantity of material in her hardware store.

In future she intends to grow her business by opening another hardware store and as such she will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase stock (iron, wire, stone, sheets, nails and others)

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina had been selling dressed chicken for almost six years. She usually sells it to the people in the village where she lives together with her parents. She is 42 years old and still single. She is generating income to provide sustenance for her family.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy chickens to dress and sell. 

She would like to diversify her business and earn enough income to save for future emergencies, especially since her parents are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy chickens to dress and sell

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: 50-year-old Ophelia earns a living through farming. She is married and has four children. Ophelia primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has been in this business for five years now. Ophelia requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have another source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz elena tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a sus hijos quienes desde hace 4 años tras quedar viuda ha tenido que sacar adelante sola, mediante su micro empresa, vende productos por catalogo. Este es el sustento de su familia y en ocasiones se apoya en el lavado de ropa a terceros.

Luz elena es una luchadora incansable que espera tener mas clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtido y con mas variedad de productos. Actualmente luz elena necesita un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz Elena, 48 years old, is an enterprising woman dedicated to her children. After she was widowed 4 years ago, she and to get ahead on her own through her micro-business selling products by catalog. This work sustains her family and occasionally she also supports herself by providing third party laundry services.

Luz Elena is a tireless fighter who hopes to have more customers and more economic possibilities to stock her business with a greater variety of products. Currently she needs a loan to buy merchandise, increase her marketing capacity and thereby improve her sales

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 32 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 9. He owns a business selling various goods such as soap, toothpaste, eggs, and biscuits. He has 2 years' experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 11 pm every day, and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Marc has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional goods to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save and he will reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy wants a loan to buy materials to construct rental houses. 

He is a Ugandan male civil servant, age 34, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

He dreams of educating his four children and setting up rental houses from which he can earn an extra income to supplement his salary.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct rental houses

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Ilyn sells grown & matured pigs from her pigpen. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Eléphant Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Eléphant sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques,avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 3 enfants et habitant le quartier Darsalam  de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Médine Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits pour femmes, de la friperie (yougou yougou), de produits cosmétiques (encens) et d’habits  pour enfants. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce afin de faire leurs achats au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotimi  (femme au beau milieu sur la photo) est connue à Darsalam pour sa vente d’encens de qualité surtout pendant les périodes de mariage.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1kg de magnonkissèni, six tubes de parfums de qualité et un carton d’eaux de Cologne. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant une semaine au moins puis on l’assaisonne avec le parfum.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché Médine et en ambulant dans la ville de Ségou  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Korotimi espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les besoins du foyer et soins de santé des enfants. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif de réinvestir l’épargne dans leur petit commerce afin de la pérenniser.
texts.en:
The five women of the Elephant group are all married mostly in polygamist families.  They are on average 31 years old and have on average three children. They live in the Darsalam area of Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali)

They met each other through neighborhood ties, kinship, and through their income generating activities at the Medine Segou Market. The group members sell women’s clothing, used clothing (yougou yougou), cosmetic products (incense) and children clothing.

The group members joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital to be able to make their purchases in cash. This is their fourth group loan.
 
Mrs. Korotimi (the woman in the middle of the photo) is known in Darsalam for the sale of her quality incense especially during wedding seasons. She is planning on using her loan to buy 1 kg of magnonkissèni, six tubes of quality perfume and a box of eau de Cologne. To make incense the magnonkissèni is soaked in “eau de Cologne” for at least a week then it is scented with perfume.  Thesales are made in cash or on credit from home or at the Medine market or as an itinerant saleswoman in the town of Segou. She sells to customers who are generally women.

With this loan, Mrs. Korotomi hopes to make a monthly average profit of 25, 000 Francs CFA. She will use it to meet the needs of the family and provide for the children’s health expenses. Like all the other members of the group, her goal is to reinvest her savings in her small business in order to perpetuate it.

loans.use: to purchase basic products to make incense.

loans.name: Essodjolo

texts.fr:
Essodjolo est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un  policier. Elle a 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 24ans et le dernier  08ans.
Essodjolo travaille comme revendeuse de maïs et sorgho depuis 1991. Elle vend seule à ses clients et achète les produits à Lomé. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Essodjolo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Essodjolo voudrait agrandir l’activité  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Essodjolo is a 39 year old woman. She is married to a policeman. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. The eldest is 24 and the youngest 8 years old. Essodjolo has worked as a reseller of corn and sorghum since 1991. She sells alone to her customers and buys the products in Lomé. She has no specific difficulty. Essodjolo needs her second loan with WAGES in order to buy more stock. She wants to re-invest in her business. In the years to come, Essodjolo would like to grow her business. She states that with her profits, she intends to ensure her childrens' education and to build a home.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and sorghum

loans.name: Hatun Warmie - Huancayo Group

texts.es:
La señora YVONE de 30 años de edad madre soltera con 01 hijo   menor de edad  en etapa escolar. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Hatun Warmie - Huancayo”.
Se dedica a la venta de Prendas de vestir  para niños y adultos como chompas polos etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de Prendas de vestir que las vende ofreciendo y repartiendo de casa en casa, realiza pedidos al por mayor y menor. 
Desea en el futuro desea comprarse su automóvil para trasladar sus mercaderías, ella viste de polo color turquesa ubicada lado derecha  segunda persona.
texts.en:
Yvone is 30 years old and she is a single mother of a child of school age. She is a member of the “Hatun Warmie – Huancayo” Community Bank.
She engages in selling clothes for children and grownups such as sweaters and polo shirts. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes that she sells door to door. She also gets orders at wholesale and retail prices.
In the future she wants to buy a car to transport her products. In the picture she is the one dressed in the blue polo shirt, the second person on the right side.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell such as sweaters and polo shirts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 52 year old business man. He is married to Dorcas who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children aged 15, 11, 8 and 5 years. He has been in the livestock trading business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup vehicle for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for trading.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía, está conformado por dos emprendedoras que cada una de ellas tiene sus negocios son emprendedoras que han luchado por sacar a su familia adelante. Este grupo ya son clientes de Fundación León 2000, ya tiene un ciclo trabajando con créditos y han demostrado ser personas responsable y con deseos de superación. Maria Concepción es parte de este grupo su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general está solicitando financiamiento para comprar producto como pantalones, camisas, faldas, sandalias, camisas, blúmer, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dios Nos Guía, is made up of two entrepreneurs, each of which owns her own business and has struggled to get her family ahead.This group is a client of Fundación León 2000.  They have been working with loans for one cycle and have proven to be responsible people who strive for self-improvement. 

Maria Concepción belongs to this group. Her business sells merchandise in general and she is requesting financing in order to purchase products such as pants, shirts, skirts, sandals, underpants, etc.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, sandals, underpants, and other products

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: Mrs.Dulamsuren is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her children in small house in Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband name is Gombosuren, he works for a private company as a civil assistant. But Mrs.Dulamsuren and her husband are invalid. Her daughter goes to the secondary school and her son goes to the kindergarten. She started her own grocery retail trade business in 2007. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase goods for her grocery retail trade business. She goal is expand her grocery retail trade business the profit and to save the money for build a grocery house. She is hardworking and tidy woman.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her grocery retail trade business

loans.name: Dia's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe est inauguré le 28 septembre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes qui sont issues de la même localité et ont comme principales activités le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage; le groupe est constitué de trente trois femmes.


L'emprunteur vedette Madame Tacko est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans, elle est mère de 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 15ans. Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de légumes et capitalise une bonne expérience de plusieurs années;elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine.Debout à droite de la photo, elle est vêtue en robe jaune-bleu et a levé la main droite.


Elle s’approvisionne en légumes (carottes,aubergines,choux,navets,oignons.....)à Potou et Louga pour revendre au marché de Ouarack.


Avec son prêt Tacko compte acheter 2 sacs de manioc, 2 sacs de patates douces pour maximiser ses revenus.  

Les bénéfices attendus vont servir à l'achat d'un mouton pour embouche ovine. Elle participe un peu aux dépenses familiales qui sont à la charge de son mari.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois (Village Lending Group) that houses this group was founded on September 28, 2012. It brings together women from the same area who work mainly in sales, agriculture and livestock farming; the group PC 2 is made up of 33 women.
The featured borrower Madame Tacko is a 42 year old married women. She is the mother of six children, the oldest of whom is fifteen. She works selling vegetables and has several years of experience. Concurrently, she fattens sheep. Standing up at the right of the photo, she is dressed in a yellow and blue dress and is raising her right hand. 
She stocks up on vegetables (carrots, eggplants, cabbages, turnips, onions) in Potou and Louga to resell in the Ouarack Market. With her loan, Tacko counts on buying two bags of manioc and two bags of sweet potatoes to maximize her profits. The anticipated profits will be used to buy a sheep to fatten. She participates a little bit in the family's spending, which is handled by her husband.

loans.use: ACHAT DE LEGUMES

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 51 years old and married with eight children. Elenita works very hard to provide for them.

Elenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods.

Elenita has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Elenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Délali Virginie

texts.en:
A. Délali Virginie A. is 34 years old. After she completed her masters degree in sociology at the University of Lomé, she served in a local NGO earning a pitiful and intermittent salary. Now then, she is responsible for her elderly parents and her two children still in school. So, she decided to use her small savings to start a business in order to pay her bills. Starting with $550, which includes a $350 loan she repaid on time, she began her grocery business, which she calls «Virginia». With a high level of intellect, she keep good accounting records, and there is transparency in her management. With her work experience, she has come to make business another specialization of hers. Today, the development of her business requires precise financing. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to add to her capital in order to grow her grocery business, thus allowing her to augment her income. This will serve to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mlle A. A. Délali Virginie est aujourd’hui âgée de 34 ans. Après sa maîtrise en sociologue à l’université de Lomé, elle a servi dans une ONG de la place avec un salaire dérisoire et irrégulier. Or, elle a à charge ses parents aujourd’hui très âgés et ses deux petits encore étudiants. Elle décida alors d’initier une activité génératrice de revenu avec sa petite économie réalisée afin de faire face à ses charges. Elle commença alors le commerce d’alimentation générale avec $550 dont un crédit de $350 parfaitement remboursé. Son niveau intellectuel lui permet de tenir une bonne comptabilité et il y a une clarté dans sa gestion. Avec cette expérience, elle se fait une autre spécialisation de commerçante. Le développement de son commerce nécessite aujourd’hui, un financement d’appoint. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $1000 pour renforcer son capital pour accroître son commerce d’alimentation générale. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus qui serviront à l’amélioration du niveau de vie de ma famille.

loans.use: Add to her capital and improve her food store.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio has lived in Santa Lucia for about 50 years. As most of the other people in the sector, he has gone through life thanks to the fertile lands that produce rice. He has raised 5 children thanks to the help of his rice farming. He is now hoping that he can receive a loan in order to improve his farm and leave his children with more productive lands. He has had 5 children in total and he is happy that they have grown up but still help him on the family's farm.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Dionicio is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 50 years old and a widow. She has three children, two in secondary school and one self-employed. She runs a shop selling different types of building materials.The shop is located in a very strategic place and customers usually favor her shop because it easy to reach. Most building materials are bulky, therefore a shop must be located near the main road for easy carriage.

Mariam has attended business and entrepreneurship training from Akiba Commercial Bank. She knows well how to market her items. She sells iron sheets, nails, hammers, woods, cement and many other items. The main item which has high turnover in her shop is cement. The stock of cement need replenishment regularly. She obtains cement from wholesalers who purchase direct from the industries. She buys the cement in packs of 50 kilograms, but due to high demand of the materials she has to re-pack the materials in packs of 5-10 kilograms to enable those who cannot buy the whole 50 kg pack. She requests a loan of USD 1200 to add stock of cement and other items in her shop.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia has a small dairy and grows vegetables, which she sells in the city of La Paz. Her husband has a minibus, which he drives for the interprovincial public transportation system. These are the primary sources of income with which they support their two school-age children, fifteen and sixteen years old.

They live in the region of Palomar– Rió Abajo, to the sourth of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

She would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that she could increase production and raise the family's income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan, with which she hopes to improve her family's living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Lidia, es productora de leche de vaca y es agricultora de hortalizas, las mismas que comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo tiene su minibús que trabaja de transporte público interprovincial; estos son los ingresos principales que les permite la manutención de sus dos hijos de 16, 15 y 12 de edad que estan en la edad escolar. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar – Rió Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida su familia.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia, 31 years old, lives in the city of Baalback in the Bekaa. She runs, from home, a small business of cosmetics and perfumes retail.
Samia already borrowed twice from A. Majmoua and has a very clean record of repayment. Since the first time we met her, we knew she is very ambitious.
A couple of months ago, Samia made her mind: she thinks she is ready to open a small shop and she needs the amount of USD 1,000 to prepare for the shop opening. She has to install shelves and stands, do a little bit of decoration and buy some inventory. We wish you could be with us for her grand opening.

loans.use: Opening of a perfumes and cosmetics products shop

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is 35 years old and runs a beauty parlor. The parlor opened 5 months ago, after Jamilah received her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Prior to running the salon, she had moved from house to house for the previous 4½ years as a traveling hairdresser. Jamilah's salon now allows her to earn US$18 a day on weekdays and US$60-70 a day on weekends and during festive seasons. The rent for the salon space costs about US$640 a year. Jamilah also employs a full-time assistant hairdresser.

Jamilah lives with her husband, 2 children (ages 12 and 4), 3 orphans (20, 15, and 10 years old), and the beauty salon assistant. Her husband works for an NGO that focuses on promoting HIV/AIDS prevention.

With the profits from her business and with a new loan of US$900, Jamilah hopes to open a tailoring business and begin selling sarongs. She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchases for a tailoring business

loans.name: Utuloa

texts.en: Utuloa is the mother of 5 children. She is a hard-working woman who has been putting a lot of effort into our program. She is always trying to improve her small business. With previous loans she was able to manage the hard problems better and to increase the farm's productivity and profitability. With this requested loan, she plans to buy pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her small farm

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: Mukarram I. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 2 children. She has been A client of MicroInvest since 2003 because she heard so many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. She started her business from scratch but with the time she opened her candy own shop in the food bazaar. She sells a wide-side assortment (candies, biscuits etc) that she purchases directly from suppliers. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more sweets.

loans.use: for the business development and assortment wideness

loans.name: Fatmah

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Fatmah R.. In 2007, Fatmah established a clothing and cosmetics boutique. Working five to eight hours a day, five days a week, and assisted by two employees, she earns about $155 per month from this business. Fatmah now requires a loan in order to expand her range of clothes and bags. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $85. In the future, Fatmah also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing and bags for her boutique

loans.name: Sairam

texts.en:
Sairam V.. age 24, and her brother, who is her business partner, have been selling children clothes for seven years in the big market in Dushanbe. Sairam brings goods from Bishkek and her brother sells them in the market. (Unfortunally,she was in Bishkek when we took the photo, so the photo shows her brother with their credit expert, Nargiza, at their trading place ).

Sairam said that she has constant clients in the wholesale market, to whom she also sells her goods. Often, they pay her in advance and she purchases according their orders. They trust her because, in spite of her age, she is a very clever dealer, and she can choose goods that generate demand among her customers. Her brother says that, from childhood, she was clever baby, and always she could find solutions to problems by herself.

Today, Sairam and her brother want to request a Kiva loan to buy new modern shoes and clothes for spring season.

loans.use: Purchase of spring clothes.

loans.name: Yabo Faouziath

texts.fr:
Born on June 7, 1972 in POBE in the PLATEAU area, Mrs. I. Yabo Faouziath is married and a mother of 2 children. She currently takes care of one of her children. 5 years ago, she settled in COTONOU where she has been selling various cosmetic products and hair strands. At the beginning, she sold her products from house to house and from district to disctrict. Today, she has her own shop where she sells her products. A very moral and honest woman, this is her second loan with this institution and she has shown to refund her loan in a timely manner.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Née le 07 juin 1972 à POBE dans la région du PLATEAU, dame I. Yabo Faouziath est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 à sa charge. Elle s'est installée depuis 05 ans à COTONOU où elle vend divers produits cosmétiques et mèches. Au départ elle exerçait son activité en passant de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier afin de distribuer ses produits. Aujourd’hui, elle dispose d’une boutique dans laquelle elle expose ses produits. D'une très bonne moralité, elle est à son deuxième prêt au niveau de l'institution et se montre très correcte dans ses remboursements.

loans.use: Purchase of 25 body lotions, of 20 packages of hair strands and other hair products

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José is a dentist and has a clinic in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto, which aims to help customers with limited resources; his wife works in another office as a dentist and they have a three month old son. His home is located in the Tembladerani hillside area in the western part of the city of La Paz. This is the first time he applies for a loan with Impro; the loan will be used to furnish his office with dental materials and equipment. His work, desire to succeed and most of all his focus on his work with clients will allow him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

José es dentista y tiene un consultorio en la zona de Alto lima de la ciudad de El Alto, con el objetivo de atender a clientes con recursos bajos; su esposa trabaja en otro consultorio como dentista y tiene un hijo de tres meses. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el crédito será destinado para el equipamiento de su consultorio con materiales de odontología.
