Su trabajo, las ganas de superación y mas que todo el sentido social que tiene con la atención de sus clientes le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his dental clinic

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is forty-two year old business woman. She is married with eight children. She is very industrious woman and her biggest wish is to provide quality education for her children in order to give them better life opportunities.

Akosua is a food vendor and sells ice kenkey. Ice kenkey is a mashed kenkey with milk and sugar, refrigerated, and then taken with bread or meat pie. Operating for the past seven years, she has supported two of her children to complete senior high school. The rest are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to add other food products to her inventory, like eggs and groundnut. This will allow her to raise more income to support the children’s education, which is her life's dream.

She belongs to the community group called Timothy Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory with new food products, like eggs and groundnuts.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Safarmo Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 48 years old and has seven children. She lives alone with her children and works long hours in order to feed them - she sells bread at the local market. Safarmo purchases bread wholesale from the local bakers and sells it at the market for a higher price. This business provides her with an income but it is barely sufficient to feed her family. In order to increase the amount of goods she sells and so increase the earnings from her business Safarmo would like to take out this loan. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зоитова Сафармо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет и имеет семерых детей. Живет одна , вместе с детьми. Поэтому ей приходится много работать для того , чтобы прокормить свою семью и своих детей. Работает на базаре. Торгует лепешками. Покупает у производителей и продает по более прибыльной цене. Этот бизнес дает ей доход позволяющий ей еле прокормить свою семью. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase of goods turnover

loans.name: Erika Isaura

texts.es:
Erika is a 27-year-old single mother with two children. She belongs to the communal bank ““Señor de Ramos” in Catac. She gets up early every morning to go by burro to mountain tops of the region of Catac in order to exchange products such as sugar and rice for milk and cheese with the people who live in these high areas. She later sells the milk and cheese to women who sell to people traveling through Catac on their way to Huaraz

“I consider my independence to be the best thing I have. I don’t need a husband to help me make my decisions although my children (claim/want/need their father reclaman a su padres”) explains Erika who we find in the Plaza de Armas (the main square) in Catac. She tells us that these days she typically does not make cheese, but rather collects and exchanges it with other vendors. With the loan of 500 Soles ($175 USD), which she will replay in four installments, she will purchase a sack of rice and make a payment to the milk producers in the high region of Catac so that they can supply her with milk that she at times uses to make into cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Erika de 27 años, madre soltera con dos hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos”de Catac, se levanta en las madrugadas para ir con burro a las punas de Catac y de esa manera intercambiar los productos que compra por mayor, como azúcar ,arroz y otros, con leche y queso con las personas que viven en las partes altas de Catac, para luego venderlo por mayor a las señoras minoristas que venden el queso a los pasajeros que van hacia el sur de Huaraz ya que todos ellos pasan por Catac. “Considero que mi independencia es lo mejor que ahora tengo no necesito del esposo para tomar mis decisiones aunque a veces mis hijos reclaman a su padres” nos manifiesta Erika que la encontramos en la plaza de armas de Catac, ya que esta época, dice no preparar el queso y que solo lo recoge o intercambia. Con el préstamo de 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el mismo que será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella comprará un saco de arroz y dejara pagado a los ganaderos de la parte alta de Catac para que le abastezcan de leche ya que a veces ella misma lo prepara.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of rice and milk

loans.name: Hilda Milda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Milda, tiene 54 años, está casada, estudió la carrera de auxiliar de Enfermería en el Instituto San Hilario en la ciudad de Trujillo, no ejerce su profesión porque se casó y después se dedicó a cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en  el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
La empresaria trabajaba en el centro de salud en la Provincia de Julcan, pero después decidió venir a la ciudad de Trujillo para que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales. Después tuvo la iniciativa de empezar a trabajar, y por este motivo viajaba a la Provincia de Julcan los días domingos para comprar verduras. Tiene 02 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, por una amiga decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO II” además   la socia  tenía poco capital y a veces no le alcanzaba para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró harina, trigo, haba, papa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de papa, porque es lo que se vende más rápido.
La socia sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Trujillo, para no viajar a la Provincia de Julcan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda MIlda is 54 years old and married. She studied nursing at the Institute San HIlario in the city of Trujillo, but does not currently work in nursing because she decided to get married and dedicated herself to raising her children. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Hilda lives in the Trujillo District in the province of the same name in the department of La Libertad. She used to work in the health center in the Julcan Province, but decided to move to the city of Trujillo so that her children could study and become professionals. She later decided to start to work, and began traveling to Julcan Province each Sunday to buy vegetables (which she then resells in Trujillo). She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years; she first started by participating in the "Women Towards Success II" Communal Bank (a group loan), thanks to a friend. She had little money at the time, and sometimes did not have enough to keep investing in her business. With her first loan of 300 soles (a little more than US $100), HIlda bought flour, wheat, broad beans and potatoes. With this loan of 600 soles (slightly more than US $200), which she will repay in four months, she is considering buying potatoes, because that is what sells the fastest. Hilda dreams of having a store in Trujillo to buy vegetables from so that she does not have to travel to Julcan Province any more.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia T. N. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Felicia is very resourceful when it comes to providing for her family. She is a food vendor who sells cooked yam and stew as well plastic bowls. She sells yam in the mornings and switch over to the sale of plastic bowls in the afternoon. Yam is peeled and cooked and is eaten with hot pepper and fried fish or gravy stew. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy cooked yam for breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like tubers of yam, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called The Good Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of loans for each other.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Mercedes Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Graciela A. O., tiene 28 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía nuestros Pasos  II y vive  en el Pasaje Peatonal Mz. 9 lote 37 del distrito de Florencia de mora, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La libertad Perú.
Estudio Primaria completa, pero por razones económicas no pudo continuar estudiando la secundaria. Se casó a los 21 años de edad y tiene dos hijas mujeres de 9 y 6 años respectivamente.
Mercedes Graciela vende gaseosa y cerveza, helada y sin helar, lo hace en su propia casa.  Los clientes van a la casa y compran la cerveza para llevarla a tomar a sus domicilios o en otros lugares.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró insumos para su negocio e incremento con más cerveza.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas incrementará la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Mercedes sueña con tener la distribución mayorista de cerveza y gaseosa.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes Graciela A. O. is 28 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II (God Guides our Steps II) and she lives in Pasaje Peatonal Mz. 9 lote 37 of the district of Florencia de Mora, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad Perú. She finished primary school entirely, but for economic reasons she was not able to continue studying through secondary school. She was married at 21 years of age and she has two daughters, who are 9 and 6 years of age. Mercedes Graciela sells soda pop and beer, cold and warm. She does this from her own home. The clients come to her house and buy the beer to carry away and drink in their own homes or other places. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought ingredients she needed for her business and also bought more beer. With this loan of 300 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy more beer and soda pop. Mercedes dreams of having the best distribution network of beer and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more soda pop and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more children’s clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Mrs. Prim L., 50, is married with seven children and lives in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She and her husband work in their farm growing rice and cabbage and raising pigs. This couple started their farming activity in 1998. By now they have enough experience in their work and are willing to expand more.

Four of their children work at a local factory and the other three are enrolled in school. Prim L. and her husband need more capital to expand their crops and their livestock. She has recently requested a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and more piglets.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seed and more piglets

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana R. G. vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 30 años viviendo en su hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista y la señora Juana R. tiene un negocio de venta de botanas llamado “Mini Snack Juany”, que es atendido por ella, este negocio lleva 5 años de estarlo operando.
La señora Juana R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo para su negocio para así poder atender a sus clientes más eficientemente y ofrecerles productos de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Juana R. G. lives with her husband and her two children. They have lived in their home for 30 years. Her husband works as a taxi driver and Juana R. owns a business selling snacks called "Mini Snack Juany" that she attends. This business has been operated for five years. Juana R. is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her business so she may attend to her customers more efficiently and offer them better quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal J. is a married woman who lives with her husband and two children. Both her children go to school. She runs a wholesale stall at the Narantuul market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Narantuul is the largest outdoor market in Mongolia -- it runs year-round despite winter temperatures far below freezing. Her husband helps her to buy her stock.

Since they've run a wholesale business for the last eight years, they've acquired a lot of experience and their business capital has increased to MNT 8 million (about USD 5,000). Average daily gross income from sales is MNT 400,000-500,000 (250-320 USD). She sells all sorts of items wholesale, from tea to soap to biscuits. She controls the family finances, and she is actively saving money in a fund for her children's future university tuition. Her goal is to one day own her own big wholesale store.

loans.use: To buy several types of wholesale items: tea, soap, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик мужчина 28 лет женат имеет двоих детей.Бизнесмен по продаже в розницу мужской обуви.Он продаёт на рынке города Костакоза.Товар привозит с Бишкека сам ,во время его отсутствия торгует его отец.Абдумалик кредитуется уже пятый год, его оборот увеличился в несколько раз.Во время мониторинга Абдумалик был в отъезде за товаром , на снимке его отец.Для увеличения весеннего ассортимента обуви Абдумалик подал текущую заявку на кредит.Абдумалик благодарен инвесторам за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a 28 year old man, he is married and has two children. He is a retail businessman and sells men's shoes. He sells on the market of the Kostakoza town. He brings the merchandise from Bishkek and his father replaces him when he is away. Abdumalik has been taking out loans for five years and his turnaround has increased a lot. During the loan approval Abudmalik was away, his father is pictured instead. To increase his spring inventory of shoes he has applied for a loan. Abdumalik is very grateful to all the investors for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's shoes

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia Banessa G. de 27 años de edad reside en el barrio San Antonio, ella vive en union libre con el señor Romel Ferrufino Umazor, con el cual han procreado dos hijos, los dos estan en el kinder, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 17 años, ella vive con su madre. ahora necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y sus hijos ya que la situacion en este pais es muy critica y como esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene, pues necesita poder inyectarle capital para poder hacer que funcione.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Banessa G. is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio, she lives with Mr.Romel Ferrufino Umazor, her common law husband, with whom she has had two children both of which are in nursery school. She has been making a living for the last 17 years selling tortillas. She lives with her mother. She now needs the loan to be able to move her business and her children ahead, since the situation in the country is very serious. This is her only source of income and therefore she needs to inject capital into the business to make it work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood,

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Kuburat C. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothing. She requests a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Okechi

texts.en: Okechi sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop. She is an active LAPO client. Okechi is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. Okechi lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50, 000 naira ($350US) to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 31 años de edad, viven en concubinato con la señora María, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su domicilio está situado en una compañía muy concurrida de la ciudad de Itá.
Se dedica a la confección de trajes para particulares y para agentes policiales hace más de 10 años.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una maquina recta, la cual le servirá para agilizar la confección de sus trajes, actualmente su actividad origina fuentes de trabajo a un empleado fijo y a otras personas fuera de su empresa que realizan la terminación de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 years old and lives with a woman named María. They have 2 children who attend school. Their home is located in a very crowded part of the city of Ita. He has been working as a suit tailor for individuals and for policemen for over 10 years. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a sewing machine, which he will use to speed up the production of the suits. Actually, his work is creating job opportunities for another employee and for others outside his company who can carry out the completion of his garments.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
M. Bakhtiyor is a very courageous man who is characterized as one who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Bakhtiyor has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Bakhtiyor comes to IMON International for a loan for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 42 years old. Adelfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Adelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Юлдашев Дилшод проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 23 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Дилшод по проффесии "электрик". По проффесии он работал более 1 года, т.к. заработная плата не устраивала, он решил начать свой бизнес. Он более 3 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить рис. Собрав его, он продаст на рынке.
texts.en:
Dilshod Y. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 23 years old. He is married and does not have children. Dilshod is an electrician by profession. He has worked in his profession for more than a year and because his salary did not satisfy him he decided to start his own business. He has been doing farming for more than three years. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow rice. He will sell the harvest on the market.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
El señor Isidoro tiene 56 años de edad, vive acompañado de la señora Irma, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ellos, los demás ya son independientes y ya tienen su propia familia formada. 

Esta pareja tiene una despensa hace más de 24 años en su domicilio particular ubicada a escasa distancia del centro de la ciudad de Itá, allí surten a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad como ser carne, panificados, verduras, lácteos, bebidas en general y otros productos.
 En muchas ocasiones compran tales mercaderías con la ayuda de los préstamos que adquieren de la Fundación Paraguaya. La señora Irma manifiesta que se siente muy en deuda con la institución ya que gracias al apoyo económico que recibió de la misma logró aumentar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar de esa manera su nivel de vida.
En esta oportunidad recurre nuevamente a la institución para solicitar un préstamo con el cual surtir su despensa con mercaderías tales como: carne, leche, panificados, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Sr. Isidoro is 56 years old and lives with Sra. Irma. They have five children, of whom only one lives with them. The others are independent and have families of their own.

The couple operates a 24 hour grocery store from their home, which is located a short distance from the city of Itá. They supply their neighbors and the occasional one-time customers with all types of basic necessities such as meat, baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, beverages, and other products.

As they have done many times before, they buy their merchandise with the help of loans from Fundación Paraguaya. Sra. Irma says she is indebted to the institution and is thankful for the financial support they have received. They have managed to increase their family income and thereby improve their standard of living. They have approached the institution again with a new loan request to purchase goods such as meat, milk, baked goods, beverages, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, milk, baked goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Denny

texts.es:
La señora Denny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 5,000.00, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus ladrillos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y lleva 20 años dedicándose a la venta de ladrillos, ubicada en un fundo que tienen lejos de la ciudad y sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones y clientes fijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del trabajo que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Denny belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children, of whom 3 are still dependent on her.

Since she needed a way to contribute to the household income, Sra. Denny was encouraged by her husband to start a business selling bricks. With startup capital of 5000 soles, she gradually started seeing good results from the beginning because of the quality of the bricks and her excellent customer service. Sra. Denny has been in business now for 20 years. She sells the bricks from her farm located far from the city. Her main clients are neighbors, institutions, and her repeat customers.

With her loan of 3000 soles, Sra. Denny will buy tin molds for baking bricks. Part of the money will also be used to pay her staff’s monthly salary.

She is very happy with the work of Manuela Ramos. She thanks the Institution for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase molds for baking bricks & pay for labor

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
44-year-old Helen A. and her husband live with their five children in a village close to the seashore of San Jose in the Province where mountains meet the sea - Antique. The livelihood of most people in this village is made by fishing and selling fish. Though Helen’s husband is not one of those, she supports the sources of income of other families by financing a fisherman’s needs for fishing. In return for the financial assistance she extends to a fisherman, she receives half of the profit he earns from his fishing.

It was seven years ago that Helen started this kind of business. She started with a very small amount of money from the savings she was able to set aside from her husband’s daily income from being a driver. In 2004, considering the growing needs of her children, especially in education, Helen wanted to grow her business to further augment her husband’s income. Her oldest child and second child will soon go to college, while the next two children will be in high school, and the youngest in elementary. Helen knew she had to have more income.

Since Helen was able to have access to credit by joining the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2004, she has been able to finance many fishermen in their village. Now she is requesting a larger loan to finance the fishing business of her brother-in-law. Once fish are sold wholesale to a market fish vendor, profit will be shared with her depending on how much has been agreed upon. She also sells some of her share of fish for more income and profit.

loans.use: To financing a fishing business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Antonio Z. está muy agradecido por su cooperación y ayudad en el anterior crédito anterior, el cual pudo comprar un carrito para la venta de elotes.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder acondicionar y remodelar los carritos ya que viene la temporada de lluvias y quiere ponerle un techo mas seguro para el y su trabajador. 
Planea pagar el nuevo crédito con las ganancias de la venta de elotes de uno de los carritos, ya que el otro será para los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Comparar mercancía y remodelar, acondicionar

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a bread distributer and retailer who lives and works in the Mukuru slum of Nairobi. Evans is 30 years old and supports his parents and brother through his business. He has been in this business for seven years and has requested a loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add stock and offer his customers a greater variety of products. Evans has struggled with a lack of access to capital in the past and is, therefore, happy to receive his first loan. In the future, Evans would like to diversify his business to own and rent out homes. He describes himself as friendly and hard-working.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Nabisalu V Nansumba Christine Group

texts.en: N. Christine is fifty years old and is representing her loan group. She is widowed with four children, all in schooling, and she also has four dependants in schooling too. She has been operating a clinic business for over eight years. She is using the loan to stock medicines in her clinic to meet her customers’ needs. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To stock medicines in her clinic to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita S., 52 years of age, is a woman who aspires to develop her relationships with other people by running a business. Aside from improving herself, she also wishes to improve her family’s standard of living. She requested a loan, and is willing to bear the responsibility of paying back weekly, in order to sustain her businesses selling vegetables and banig (a native mat made of woven palm tree leaves).

Carmelita has learned to let go of her fears and insecurities, especially in getting her loan and facing the challenges to fulfill her dreams, which anchor on the success of her business. She makes herself strong to face the challenge of dealing with the different personalities of her customers in her everyday business transactions.

Being the sole provider for her family of five children – no matter how hard it may seem sometimes – Carmelita has learned how to be patient and manage to be calm for the sake of good relationships.

loans.use: To purchase large volumes of vegetables and "banig" (native mats)  to sell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio SERGIO pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  La ciudad de Calca esta a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
El socio es conviviente tiene cuatro hijos tres mujeres y un varón. Los hijos mayores estudian en el colegio nivel secundario y el menor primaria.  

El trabaja como chofer hace servicio de transporte en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y tiene un negocio familiar de venta frutas al por mayor y menor en el mercado modelo de Calca. La fruta lo trae de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado.     

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas como papayas, plátanos, naranjas mandarinas, mangos, piñas etc.    
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Serio is a member of the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. He is from the Calca province in the Cusco department. The city of Calca is one hour from the province of Cusco. He is in a common law marriage, and he has four children, three girls and a boy. The older children are in high school, and the youngest is in primary school. He works as a driver providing transportation service in the city of Puerto Maldonando. He also has a family business of selling fruit wholesale and retail in the Modelo Market of Calca. He brings the fruit from the city of Puerto Maldonado. He needs a loan to increase capital in his business of selling fruits like papayas, bananas, oranges, tangerines, mangoes, and pineapples, etc. He is grateful for this opportunity, and he promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit to distribute in more cities in Cusco

loans.name: Flor Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Flor, es madre soltera de dos hijos es de profesión maestra en colegio nocturno de la ciudad de Portoviejo, durante el día se dedica a la venta de  ropa y electrodomésticos, como planchas, licuadoras y mas, con este negocio ya tiene 5 años, cuando perteneció a la fundación su negocio creció mas, por que con los prestamos ha podido ir incrementando.

La señora Flor es socia del Banco desde hace 8 ciclos y no ha tenido inconveniente con sus pagos, siempre le ha gustado trabajar, se inició en las ventas gracias a una hermana, le vendía la mercadería pero se dio cuenta que podría empezar sola ya que lo que la hermana le pagaba no le alcanzaba entonces opto por ponerse su propio negocio de ventas, durante la mañana y parte de la tarde sale a recorrer le deja  acredito a sus clientes fijos.

Para poder encontrar mercadería  a buen precio con el que podría estar obteniendo buenas ganancias tiene que viajar para comprar a los importadores, los prestamos que ha recibido de la Fundación le han ayudado para poder crecer con sus ventas, ella invierte desde 500 dólares en los pedidos que le hacen, con las ganancias que esta obteniendo piensa ahorrar y terminar de hacer su casa ese es un gran sueño de la señora  Flor.

Para este mes de Diciembre Flor tendrá que entregar varios pedidos por ello el préstamo que va a recibir lo invertirá todo en comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Flor is a single mother of two children who works as a teacher at a night school in the city of Portoviejo. During the day, she sells clothes and home appliances such as irons, blenders, and more. She has had this business for five years, and since joining Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR she has grown her business thanks to the loans she's taken out. Flor has had eight loans so far and has never had difficulty making the payments. She has always loved to work and started in sales thanks to her sister, for whom she would sell products. However, she realized she could go into sales for herself since what her sister paid her was not enough to survive. That's when she started her own business, which operates during the day and part of the afternoon, when she goes around her clients' homes, letting her regulars pay her later. To find products at good prices that would yield more revenue, Flor must travel to buy from the direct importers. The loans she has received from Fundación ESPOIR have helped her grow her business. She invests about $500 in the orders her customers put in and saves the profit to finish building her house, Flora's big dream. In December, Flor will have to deliver several orders so she will invest this loan entirely in purchasing products.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying appliances and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica la venta de granos, tanto de los que produce ella misma en sus tierras y los que compra de otras personas. Mary siempre está al pendiente de las épocas de mayor comercio, para ello viaja a la zona urbana aledaña a su comunidad para vender sus producto en las ferias comerciales. Mary vende al por mayor y menor, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda con el transporte de la mercadería. 
Para el futuro, le gustaría establecerse en un local comercial, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Esta es la oportunidad número 11 en que tiene un crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mery is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three daughters.

She has been selling grain for five years, some of which she produces on her own land with the remainder acquired from other growers. Mery is always looking for the best times to make large sales. She travels to commercial fairs in the urban areas surrounding her community in order to sell her products. Her husband helps her with the business by transporting her merchandise. Mery sells both in bulk and in small amounts. In the future, she would like to establish a commercial location where she can sell more comfortably.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Mery promises to remain responsible with her payments. The money she requested will be used to purchase additional inventory in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of grain

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Mrs. Khen C., 44, and her husband, Mr. Prach Prak, 50, live on an island on the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their children is a garment factory worker, one attends school, and another stays at home.
Khen and her husband are farmers. They grow cucumbers, tomatoes and corn on their farmland in the village. In addition, Khen wants to create a new business raising cows, and hopes to earn extra income from selling the cows when they have grown big enough. She is therefore requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Denis Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Denis Dionisio Rodríguez Avilés, tiene una propiedad de 40 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz) y Hortaliza , 2 manzanas sembradas de café y 44 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz y a cultivos de hortaliza tecnificado, también a la caficultura,(cultivo de café) las cuales también cultivan y cosecha cada año  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar insumos agrícolas los que utilizara en una manzana del cultivo de la papa. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 3 hijos 2 de ellos ya son mayores  de edad estos le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos ,  este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, y con la siembra del cultivo de la papa  el obtendrá más ingresos en el momento que el saque la cosecha, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Denis Rodríguez, ha tenido 10 créditos  desde el año 2001 lleva 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Denis Dionisio Rodríguez Avilés has a property of 40 manzanas [about 68 acres] with different areas for various crops. Four manzanas are used to grow basic grains (beans and corn) and vegetables. Two manzanas are planted in coffee, and 44 manzanas are appropriate for cattle. Denis takes care of the grain, vegetable, and coffee crops, including annual planting and harvesting. The purpose of this loan is for supplies necessary for growing one manzana of potatoes. Denis began by growing crops only in the wintertime and with the help of his family. He is married and has three children. Two of the children are grown and help out in the fields. Denis dedicates all of his time to this business, and with the addition of the potato crop, he will increase his earnings. Denis has had ten loans with Ceprodel over the last nine years. These have been important in allowing him to improve his business activities. The result has been higher income and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed potatoes, fertilizer, and wages for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, and flour that will be used for the business

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison V. is a businessman who sells general goods such as soft drinks, hairstyling kits, toothpaste, body cream, beverages, and children's clothing.  He buys his goods wholesale from the Red Light Market on the outskirts of Liberia's capital Monrovia and sells from a retail shop in the Kpelle Town community of nearby Paynesville.

Harrison is 28 years old and is married with a 7 year-old-child who is attending kindergarten.  Harrison himself is a high school graduate.  He is preparing to go to college because he is seeking a higher education.

Harrison has been running his business for 5 years and hopes to grow his business into a larger store in the near future.  He started selling on a table in front of his house, and then moved into a little booth.  His business has now grown into a small shop.

Harrison credits his success in business to maintaining good relationships with residents of Kpelle Town in Paynesville, his customers.  He needs this loan in order purchase more hairstyling kits, tooth paste, body cream, tissue, and other goods.  He plans to invest any extra money into his cement and call center businesses.

Harrison dreams of becoming more successful in the future, and hopes to educate his son well.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more more products such as hairstyling kits, toothpaste, body cream, tissue, clothing, and beverages.

loans.name: Malima's Group

texts.en: Ricky M. is from the village of Matugas Bajo. He is 30 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ricky is married and has one school-aged child. He owns and operates a hog-raising business. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ricky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ahouassi

texts.fr: K. Ahouassi est née à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et vit à Fiégnon, un quartier de Cotonou. Ahouassi n’a jamais été à l’école mais exerce une activité depuis 10 ans. En effet, Ahouassi vend du « Manwè » (fait à base de maïs, servant à la préparation de l’akassa, aliment local) de façon ambulante. Ahouassi s’approvisionne en maïs à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Ahouassi voudrait renforcer son activité et produire davantage de « Manwè », en vue de satisfaire plus sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C’est la raison pour laquelle Ahouassi sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Ahouassi K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and lives in Fiégnon, a borough in Cotonou. Ahouassi has never attended school but has been active for the past ten years. In fact, Ahouassi is an itinerant vendor of “Manwè” (a corn-based product, used to prepare akassa, a local food preparation). She gets her corn supply from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She would like to strengthen her activity and produce more “Manwè”, thereby increasing customer satisfaction and generating more revenue. This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn to prepare "Manwè"

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Hulantahi, is 21 years old and attends a university.

Oyungerel operates a food products trading business from a shipping container which she owns at a local food market. She has been operating this business with her husband since 2005 and they have built a stable operation. She started her business with a working capital of 800,000 tugrugs (approximately 580 USD). After years of successful operation she has managed to increase her working capital to more than 2,100,000 tugrugs (approximately 1510 USD).

Oyungerel has been putting her earnings towards her family's expenses and her family's quality of life has been improving. She is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. She says, “I would like to grow my business and provide a good education for my child.” She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 38 years old, married, and a father of three. He sells suitcases in a very competitive environment. He uses part of his income to pay wages to his employee and saves some in a group in Faulu Kenya called Forty In One. He was previously guaranteed a loan by the group members and used the loan to improve his business. He started the business ten years ago and hopes to venture into a van transport business in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy more suitcases for sale.

loans.use: To buy suitcases to sell.

loans.name: Geethani

texts.en:
Geethani is a 38-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children in Telijjawila, Matara.

Geethani is a hardworking woman. With the help of her husband, she farms a small plot of land where she grows bananas. She began this work five months ago. The land where she farms is good for banana cultivation.

Geethani has requested a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to improve her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this Sri Lankan loan.

loans.use: To improve her banana-farming business

loans.name: Edward M.s.'s Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are members of the R.C. Primary School Junior. These are diligent and hard working teachers who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 11,400,000 in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in a business, buy pieces of furniture, or buy a plot of land, etc. R.C Primary school was founded in 1954 in Kabala town. It is a government-assisted school with 13 teachers, twelve of whom have applied for a loan of SLL 11,400,000.

With the help of this loan, the leader of this group, Edward M.S. M. will use his share (SLL 1,000,000) to purchase house equipment/furniture. Edward is a 54-year-old man who is married to a petty businesswoman. They have three children. 

(Attached at the sides of the photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house equipment/furniture

loans.name: Aleciana

texts.en:
Aleciana A. is a married woman who lives in Sto. Niño, Brgy. San Pedro, Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, pump boat and pedicab.  Her husband, Nelson, who is 39 years old, works as a pedicab driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are 9 and 10 years old. 

Aleciana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aleciana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,500 — increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Aleciana A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin K. is a middle-aged woman whose husband is shown in the photo. Sin K. is a good homemaker who stays at home to do a daily routine as well as take care of the children. The family is supported by Sin K.’s husband, who is a professional chef. Also, he is hired by people to cook for their wedding parties. 

Sin K. also relies on the income from her children’s jobs: one son is a fisherman and two daughters work sewing clothes in the garment factory. The river is full of fish, which means the situation is good for fishing; however, Sin K.’s son lacks some implements to use on his fishing activities. So, Sin K. has decided to take out a Kiva loan to buy nets, traps, and a boat for her son to use to fish.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps, and a boat.

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sou H. is a group leader who was born in 1960, selected by six members whom all are made a group loan located in Ou village, Takeo province. Each member will use portion of their loan for varied ways to increase their businesses. Mrs. Sou H. and her husband, Mr. Chen Dou, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family moreover they all are farming laborers. Although they have a lot of works to do, they still have done a lot of free time. So to improve condition family living, Mrs. Sou H. is seeking for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending in local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan S., currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (gelabia) at the market, is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to make more bread to sell.  Juan, 40 years old, is married to a peasant and they have three children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business by stocking dried fish, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng K., 56, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband (who is pictured here) are farmers who typically make about $2 each day and are also supported by three of their working children. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Heng K. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Put Together Group

texts.en:
Ruth D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Put Together. She is 48 years old and is widowed with four children between the ages of 21 and 30 years. She was only able to attend school through fifth grade due to financial difficulties.

For twenty years, Ruth has been selling dried fish in the "12th Street community" market in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish to sell.

Ruth describes herself as a God-fearing woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Iv I., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Iv is employed at a brick factory and as a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5.3 per day. One of her children is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 1.7 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 12.5 on the children’s education every month.

Iv is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en:
J. Abdullo is 49 years old, married and has three children. For the past six years, he has been a welder. In the cold season he takes orders for small stoves. He is also sells them at the market. Now it is the beginning of the cold season and many people are coming to Abdullo to order stoves. In Tajikistan in winter, electricity and gas are limited, so stoves are needed. Abdullo has applied for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase the necessary materials to make his stoves. With your help, he will be able to make his business succeed and provide his children with an education. Your generosity can change their lives. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase necessary materials to make small stoves.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married with one child who is not currently in school. Janet runs a pharmacy, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicine.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business into wholesale. 

Janet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Sandra Johana

texts.es:
Sandra es madre de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 31 años, casada, siendo su esposo cocinero de un hotel.
Se dedica al comercio de elaboración de nacatamales en donde los vende en el mismo barrio. En donde trabaja con su propio dinero que su esposo dio.
Es de poco recursos económicos, aun no han logrado hacer su casa de concreto lo que es su objetivo como madre para dar un bienestar común a sus hijos.
Lo que desea comprar es materiales de construcción como. Piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar a construir la parte de enfrente de su casa de concreto. Contenta porque gracias a este financiamiento en Afodenic podrá levantar las paredes lo que es para ella de gran progreso.
texts.en:
Sandra is the mother of three children.  She is 31 years old and married.  Her husband is a cook in a hotel.

Sandra's business is making 'nacatamales' (Nicaraguan 'tamales' - steamed corn dumplings with a savoury filling, wrapped in a plantain leaf).  She sells these in her neighborhood.  She works with her own money which her husband gave her.  Sandra's is a family with few means of support.  They still haven't managed to convert their house to concrete yet.  This is her goal because as a mother she needs to look after her children's welfare.

Sandra would like to buy building materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron, and to begin building the front part of her house from concrete.  She is happy because thanks to this loan from Afodenic she will be able to raise the walls of the house which for her is great progess.

loans.use: To buy building materials and build the walls of her house from concrete

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ladies' underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mrs. Iem Chroeb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fiften people from Spueu village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan. Mrs. Iem C. is the leader who has been selected by the other members for this loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Iem C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  She also sells noodles to earn more income to support her family. Although she tries to work a lot, she earns only a little income. So to improve her family's living, Mrs. Iem C. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a widow with a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Christoper Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Christoper M.  tiene 30 años se encuentra casado con la señora Marcela Tellez Cavero,  tienen una hija pequeña la cual se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de su zona. Christoper vive en  la zona de Villa Granado al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Él trabaja brindando servicios de transporte con su taxi.

Christoper es una persona joven trabajadora, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y de esa manera lograr un futuro mejor para su pequeña familia. Él quiere este préstamo para refaccionar y equipar su automóvil y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela y por consiguiente lograr incrementar sus ingresos; agradece mucho a la gente que por medio de Kiva le pueda dar la oportunidad de superarse equipando su única herramienta de trabajo.

Christoper entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprarse una segunda herramienta de trabajo y así poder contar con un respaldo económico más fuerte para su pequeña familia.
texts.en: Christoper M. is 30 years old and is married to Marcela Tellez Cavero. They have a small daughter who is currently in school. Christopher lives in Vila Granado to the west of the city of Cochabamba. He makes a living providing taxi services. Christopher is a hard-working young man who gets up very early every day to work and in this way provide a better future for his small family. He wants to use this loan to renovate and equip his vehicle and in this way provide a better service to his customers and increase his income. He is very grateful to Kiva for giving him the opportunity to improve his only means of work. Christopher plans in the future to take out a new loan so he purchase another taxi and have even stronger financial support for his family.

loans.use: Repairs and tools

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en: Asha Kabunge, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a little monthly profit. This will be Asha's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous Motisha loan to increase her food stock. She has successfully paid back her loan. She hopes for a new Motisha loan to increase her capital. Asha's dream is to be able to educate her children. In the picture, Asha is in front, wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Saor's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Chreae village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saor K. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family to be living better than now. She owns a general store in the local village where she can sell some groceries to earn some money to support her family. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Saor K. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Morm, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is a bicycle repairer too. Through these activities, they support seven children. Five of the children are students and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Suos Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people from Thnoas village in Takeo province. Mrs. Suos T., born in 1979, was selected to be the president of this group.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Suos T. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband is a construction worker and a fisherman. At the present, she wants to breed a cow, but her savings are not enough to buy one. To achieve her purpose, Mrs. Suos T. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

Mrs. Suos T. is a mother of two children, who are both enrolled in the local public school.   Pha Nget is a group guarantor, so she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” se formó con la unión de vA. vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas y preparación de comidas rápidas.
Pero como las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido fueron capaces de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Bonifacia es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de productos  varios y mini carga (crédito para teléfonos celulares muy común en las despensas del barrio) para la comunidad. Y necesita del crédito para aumentar el tamaño de su tienda de comestibles.
En fin, es un señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos.
texts.en:
The Tenacious Women Communal Bank was formed by the union of various neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of the bank’s members carry out different business activities like sales and preparing fast food.

However, as the members formed a very united group, they were capable of jointly carrying out their activities. This strengthens their camaraderie.

Bonifacia is one of the members of the bank.  She sells various products and “mini cargas” (credit for cell phones, which is very common in the neighborhood general stores) for the community.  She needs the loan to increase the size of her grocery store.

In closing, she is a very creative woman, and her customers greatly admire her work.

loans.use: Expand her grocery store

loans.name: Mujeres Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE porque ellas consideran que tienen que ir creciendo hacia delante, tanto personal como en su trabajo, este grupo esta ubicado en la ciudad de Tula de Allende, Hidalgo. La Señora Elizabeth M. Z. es integrante del grupo, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y de articulos de temporada desde hace ya 5 años, ella quiere este crédito para la compra de zapatos ya que tiene pedidos de zapatos de sus clientas, así como ella espera que con este crédito y con sus ventas ella les puede ofrecer un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos y una calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called "MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE" ["Women always moving forward"], because they think that they have to continue moving ahead, as much personally as in their work. This group is located in the city of Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, Mexico. Mrs. Elizabeth M. Z. is a member of the group, is 27 years old, is married, and has 2 children. She has been selling shoes and seasonal products for five years. She wants this loan to buy shoes since she has requests for shoes from her customers. She also hopes that with this loan and with her sales she can offer more wealth to her children and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería ella trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja realizando muebles, camas, roperos entre otros trabajos que son vendidos en las ferias dominicales de la plaza de Túpac Amaru del Cusco, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le a traído muchas satisfacciones y es de esta forma que ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la realización de sus trabajos hechos en  madera.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “El Amancer” (The Dawn) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Doris divides her time between her daily activities and managing her carpentry business. She and her partner work together to make furniture pieces such as beds, wardrobes, and other items to sell at the Sunday fairs in the Túpac Amaru Plaza in Cusco. Doris has been in this business for several years. It has given her great satisfaction and enables her family to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase materials for producing her creations made of wood. Doris is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Ms. Sophorn C. (pictured here), 30, is single and lives with her three brothers and widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away. 

Sophorn is a garment factory worker. She is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to school.

loans.name: Parsinante  Ole

texts.en:
Parsinante Ole P. is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  He has been a potato farmer for the past five years.

He learned about KADET, LTD.,  through an advertisement done by KADET staff. He has applied for his third loan of KES.60,000 from KADET, LTD., with which he plans to buy potatoes for planting and also chemicals for spraying. 

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who will be able to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting and also chemicals for spraying

loans.name: Enlazando Group

texts.es:
El grupo Enlazando está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarios de Nindiri, Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María de la Concepción S. quien desde joven se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, frijoles y yuca. Ella con el crédito comprara abono para preparar la tierra para la siembra.
Las otras integrantes son Ana María A. Matus quien tiene un nintendo y una pulpería en los cuales invertirá el crédito y Alejandra Guzmán S. desde hace 4 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Enlazando” (Linking Together) group has three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women from Nindiri, Masaya.  The group Coordinator is Mrs. María de la Concepción S. who has been a corn, bean and manioc farmer since she was young.  She will use the loan to buy manure to prepare the soil for planting.

The other group members are Ana María A. Matus who has a Nintendo and a grocery store where she will invest the loan and Alejandra Guzmán S. who has had a grocery store for the last 4 years.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Elmer Xavier

texts.es:
El cliente Elmer Xavier . Vive en el municipio de Achuapa del departamento de león Enitel 2 C sur 1 ½ C Este Achuapa, Es Casado tiene 2 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente Instituto San Sebastian desempeña  el cargo como Maestro tiene 12 años de estar laborando, tiene su propio vehículo de trasporte.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación la cual le quiere dar mejores condiciones para el bien estar de su familia. 
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de sin, sementó, madera y arena  para el mejoramiento de su casa, ya que esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su vivienda, donde este es el primer crédito financiado con nuestra institución
texts.en:
Elmer Xavier lives in the town of Achuapa, in León department.  He is married and has two children in his care.  He has been working as a teacher in San Sebastián School for 12 years.  He owns his own vehicle.

Elmer owns his own home and would like to improve its condition for the well-being of his family.  He will use his loan to buy metal sheets, cement, wood and sand to improve his home and keep it in better condition.  This is the first loan that he has received from our institution.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, wood and sand

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is 39 years old and single mother of four children ages 4 to 18 years old. She has no dependents and she is the soul bread winner. She has to go the extra mile to fend for her family of five people. She lives in a rented home in Hoima Uganda. For seven years she has been running a retail shop and she got her initial capital from the sale of farm produce but she faces a challenge of inadequate capital. Gertrude needs a loan to purchase general merchandise like sugar,salt, books, and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for her shop like sugar, rice, and salt.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 58 years old and married with seven children. Paterna works very hard to provide for them.

Paterna runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Paterna has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, shampoo, noodles etc. 

In the future Paterna would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy has been running a retail shop for three years selling maize, rice, spices, sugar and cooking fat.   She is 33 years old, married, and a proud mother of two children ages 8 and 3 years old.  

She hopes to grow her business into a mini-supermarket within five years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving her finances to inject into her business and thus able to provide for her family.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cereals such as rice, peas and beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, peas and beans

loans.name: Nedy

texts.es: Nedy es natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 23 años, convive con Fredy de 25 años y fruto de esa unión concibieron 03 hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una buena comodidad. Nedy, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su puesto de ventas trata de sobresalir adelante. Ella es comerciante y tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes situado en la avenida principal de su ciudad. Es así que su tienda es muy frecuentado por sus clientes, ya que ella les brinda buen trato, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de encontrar los productos indicados para sus necesidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 02años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias ampliando su tienda. Este será su tercer crédito, por ello espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para poder comprar los víveres, a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus aportes. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con el monto solicitado comprará víveres como sacos de arroz, fideos, azúcar y conservas.
texts.en:
Nedy is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is 23 years old and lives with 25 year-old Fredy.  The couple have three children who they would like to provide with more comfort in life.

Nedy is a very hard-working woman who is trying to make progress with her sales business.  She is a saleswoman and has a business selling groceries which is located on the main avenue of her city.  Her store is very busy with customers as she treats them well.  She opens her doors very early each morning and is ready greet her first customers of the day.  As they are aware of the variety of merchandise that she has in her store, they don't hesitate to buy from her.  They can be certain that they will find the products they need.

What Nedy most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  This is one of the skills that she uses to gain more customers.  She has been in this business for two years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet nearly all day long.  

Nedy will use the loan she has requested to buy more food products for her business, so that she can stock it with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to increase her profits by expanding her store.  This will be her third loan and she hopes to receive the cooperation of each and every one of you so that she can buy the food products she needs.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Nedy is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy food products such as bags of rice, noodles, sugar and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Mola

texts.en:
Mola is a divorced man with two school-going children. They live in a house that they own; it has no electricity nor piped water. Mola's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Mola has operated a business selling maize from home to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is competition from other maize sellers in his area of operation. Mola's major dream is to establish a maize selling stall in the future.
