Mola plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de dos hijos a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para la buena educación de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda con buenas condiciones, la que ha mejorado gracias a su salario y a los distintos créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y cerámica para seguir mejorando su vivienda, por tal razón decidió solicitar su quinto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Mrs Virginia is from the El Sauce municipality. She has tried to give her 2 children the best she can in life and a good education. She has worked as a primary school teacher in a local school for over 20 years providing the children there with a good education. 

She owns her own house which is in good condition. She has used her salary and loans from Ceprodel to make home improvements. What she really has a need of now is a loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand and tiles to further improve her house. This is why she decided to apply to Ceprodel for her 5th loan so that she could carry out the home improvements.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: 37-year-old Richard lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and four children. He has operated a retail and electronics shop for the last 8 years and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He wants a loan to purchase electronics equipment to sell.

loans.use: Purchase electronics equipment to sell.

loans.name: Salama Group A

texts.en:
Dorothy is a facilitator for the Salama A group, in Chwele.  She and her co-group members have been members of One Acre Fund since 2009.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Dorothy and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Salama A Group is comprised of six women and one man.  Dorothy joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices, grow enough to feed her family, have access to quality seed and fertilizer, have more harvest profits to invest in education, and be able to plant early thanks to on-time input delivery. 

In last year’s maize harvest, Dorothy reports harvesting seven bags of maize on ½ acre, an excellent harvest by her measure, and a much larger yield than the 2 2/3 bag yield that she harvested before investing in an input loan from One Acre Fund. 

Dorothy plans on spending her income from the upcoming harvests on school fees for her children, saving for the future, buying clothing for the family, taking care of her parents, and livestock investments.  

In the upcoming 2012 season, Salama Group A members will plant a total of seven acres of land, each farmer planting between ½ and 5 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 28-year-old college student who decided to help her mother, who is supporting Sanaa and her younger brother since their father passed away. Her mom, Shieha, has been running a small snack and food products store in the neighborhood to support her family, especially their education, for more than 5 years. 

Now that Sanaa is a college student, she decided to give a hand to her mother. She's applied for a loan so she can buy more products for expansion of the store into a wholesale store. Part of the loan will be used for school tuition so she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy more products for her mother's store and for school tuition fees.

loans.name: Elicha

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Frequenta a Univercidade Pedagógica e está no 1º ano de psicologia. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus irmãos que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é professor ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 5.050.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de de construcao de uma casa (barrotes, ferro, areia, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade sua obra.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir os seus estudos para melhorar as condições de vida da sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Elicha was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is single and has no children and is in his first year studying psychology at the Universidade Pedagógica. He has never left his hometown and he lives at home with his family and supports his brothers and sisters who also live with him. 

He is a teacher and has earned a monthly salary of 5,050 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for two years, which goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials (bricks, steel, cement, etc.) so she can continue working on his house. 

He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku in the future to finish his studies and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, steel, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en: Jurenda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Jurenda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jurenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jurenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 28 years old and married to Anne. They are blessed with two children six years and two years old. He has a business rearing pigs and he has been in business for six years and right now his monthly income is KES 14,000.

He is taking out a loan of KES. 20,000 which he intends to use to buy piglets for resale. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to repay the loan and to expand his business. 

This is his first loan. His hopes and dreams are to have a permanent home and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Don Rubén es un hombre incansable. Diariamente trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche en su ebanistería.  Desde hace 10 años está dedicado a esta actividad con la que se ha sostenido. Cuenta que cuando comenzó no tenía mucha clientela en el lugar donde estaba ubicado pero luego se mudó y ahora ha mejorado un poco, ya tiene más clientes y es reconocido por su excelente trabajo.
 
Este hombre de 49 años sueña con tener su propio negocio de muebles donde él  sea quien los diseñe y los elabore en grandes cantidades. Para ir en búsqueda de este sueño necesita comprar nuevas herramientas de trabajo como cortadoras, taladro, calador, entre otras, ya que las que tiene están muy desgastadas.
texts.en:
Rubén is a tireless man.  He works every day from 7am until 7pm in his cabinet shop.  He’s been supporting himself in this line of work for ten years.  He relates that when he started out he didn’t have many customers where he was located but then he moved and now has improved a bit; he has more customers and is well-known because of his excellent work.

This 49-year-old man dreams with having his own furniture manufacturing business where he would design and make them in large quantities.  To follow this dream he needs to buy new work tools like saws, drill and borer, among others, since the ones he owns are very worn out.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en: Masrah is 48 years old and lives in Paynesville, Liberia. She is married and has nine children aged between 9 and 29 years old who all attend school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling charcoal in her community and now she is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her main challenges are transporting her goods and the rainy season. Masrah says she started her business with money given to her by her husband and she learned the business from her mother. What she really likes about her business is that it helps her to meet her needs and always have some money. She hope to build a house for her children in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Nyabukara Banywani Group

texts.en:
Michael is a 37-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He owns a business of used shoes, which he started three years ago with capital worth 390,000 UGX but now it is worth 2 million UGX.

His challenges include high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations, seasonal weather and taxes levied on him.

His business goal is to expand his business into new markets. 

Michael needs the loan to buy 60 pairs of shoes for sale this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru: Умринисо проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Умринисо занимается скотоводством. У нее имеется коровник, где она разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Umriniso lives in Khujand. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. Umriniso raises cattle for a living. She has a big cow barn where she keeps her herd. She has had her cow herd for the last five years and is taking out this loan to purchase a few more calves.

loans.use: to purchase a few more calves

loans.name: Mario Mauricio

texts.es:
Mario, se dedica al transporte de carga, vive en casa propia con su madre y los hermanos, este oficio lo realiza en camión pesado como un furgón, aprendió por un amigo a manejar este tipo de transporte y hoy en día trabaja por medio de contratos de viaje.
El está solicitando préstamo para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de su Furgón, lubricantes, pago de mecánico esto le permitirá contar con el vehículo en mejores condiciones, dándole más seguridad en sus viajes ya que en ocasiones son largos y requiere de un buen vehículo.
El quiere para en un futuro conocer más gente del negocio del transporte, que le dé la oportunidad de viajar tanto fuera como dentro del país.
texts.en:
Mario works in cargo transportation.  He lives in his own home with his mother and brothers.  He does this work in a heavy truck like a van.  He learned from a friend how to drive this type of vehicle and now he works by means of travel contracts.

He is requesting a loan to invest in truck maintenance, lubricants, and pay for a mechanic.  This will allow him to have a vehicle in better condition, giving him more security on his trips, since occasionally his trips are long and he requires a good vehicle.

In the future he wants to meet more people from the transportation business, to give him the opportunity to travel both abroad and in his country.

loans.use: to pay for a mechanic and buy lubricants.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a conservative woman, so her husband, Ra'ed, is photographed instead. 

Marwa is a 21-year-old  woman. She is married with no children yet. She is an employee with a decent salary; also her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Marwa wants to purchase necessary home appliances such as a stove, refrigerator, washing machine, etc., so she can live in better conditions. She needs to take out a loan from FATEN to pay for them. Getting this loan will offer Marwa the necessary home appliances which will make her daily life go easier and create better living conditions for the family. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Serigne Bara Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été créé le 17 mai 2010.IL est composé de 17 femmes issues du même village.Elles ont pour responsable Awa. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et s'occupe de 04 enfants dont une soeur. Elle fait du commerce de légumes. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plus de 02 ans et demi. Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (légumes) Son objectif est de participer à ma prise en charge de la famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The group was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 17 women, all from the same village. Awa is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married, and takes care of four children, one of whom is her sister.

She has been selling vegetables for over two and a half years now. The loan will allow her to buy vegetables.

Her goal is to be able to contribute to supporting her family, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is married and has five children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Crisologa sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and had this business for six years. She has requested a loan to use as additional capital in her fruits and vegetables business.
Crisologa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Crisologa hopes to have a larger vegetable and fruits store business and to sell a different variety of products.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her existing business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is 63 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn for living she plants and harvest vegetable and has corn fields to monitor, She plant vegetables and sell them to the community. She wants to increase her income that's why she decided to borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden and corn fileds, so that it can produce a good quality of vegetables and able to have a lot of vegetables to be sell in the market. Estela plan for the future to expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Madam Patience O. lives in the Dodowa community of the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She sells mainly yams and other agricultural produce, including groundnuts and beans. The demand for her goods increases daily. Madam Patience is a very hardworking woman who wishes to sell more than she is doing now but lacks capital. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva to help expand her business. She is also very good in keeping records and loan management, all of which was learned from KSFs TEACH product.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
"Between my wife and myself, with much effort and sacrifice, we have succeded in making one room for our three children. Now we have already constructed two more rooms, but I have not yet put the roof on or the windows in, to make them habitable. I am asking for $1200 to finish the construction of the two rooms."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Entre mi esposa y yo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logramos hacer 1 cuarto para vivir con nuestros 3 hijos, ahora ya construimos 2 cuartos más pero me falta ponerles el techo y las ventanas para poder habitarlos”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la construcción D. 2 cuartos.

loans.use: To finish the construction of two rooms

loans.name: Luzanie

texts.en:
Luzanie S. is a dressmaker in the town of Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. Through her home-based business, Luzanie is able to supplement her husband’s income and provide for their three children. With this first loan, she will purchase supplies and materials to expand her dressmaking operations. She hopes that this will improve their current standard of living.

Note: Luzanie is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more medicines straight from wholesalers

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz Quliyeva is a refugee from Zengilan region, a territory of Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict situated in the west part of Azerbaijan. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children. She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling children's clothing and earning little money. She had difficulty covering her family's consumption needs.

Firangiz wants to improve her business and increase the number of her clients. She needs $500 to open an area of private trade to sell her goods in the central market, to expand her business. She hopes that expanding her business will help her improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To open an area of private trade to sell her goods in the central market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase five bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Donojon

texts.en: Donojon M. lives in the Nausky region, is married and has 3 children. She has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams of a happy future for her children. She is engaged in the home business of raising livestock and selling the milk produced. She is experienced in the livestock business because she has been working in it since she was a young girl while helping her mother in the farm. She also works as a hospital nurse.  She is currently requesting a loan for purchasing a milk-producing cow.

loans.use: For the purchase of a cow

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana has run a charcoal business for six years. Her suppliers get the charcoal from Bagamoyo and Morogoro regions, which are respectively north and west of Dar es Salaam. Due to the high rate of local deforestation, she wants to diversify her business and begin selling wood as well. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand into wood sales.

loans.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara is a mother of one child. She was born in 1986. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Absheron region. She has run this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy the more food for her store, and grow her profits.

loans.use: to buy more food for her general store

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Ángel is a self-sacrificing and hard-working single father. He has worked from his home, in his small carpentry workshop, with the same dedication and love that he has always given to his beloved children. His children have now become his main business partners; they hope to turn their small workshop into the best in the city. They currently do various jobs in their workshop and they also do work in individual’s homes, with the help of costly and numerous tools. They would like to obtain a loan so as to replace their most deteriorated tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ÁNGEL, es un abnegado y trabajador padre soltero, se ha desempeñado dentro de su hogar en su pequeño taller de carpintería con la misma dedicación y amor que les otorgaba a sus queridos hijos, ahora éstos se han convertido en sus principales socios y tienen el deseo de convertir su pequeño taller en el mejor de su ciudad, actualmente prestan diversos servicios en este espacio y a domicilio con la ayuda de costosas e innumerables herramientas.Desean obtener un préstamo para poner en marcha su anhelado proyecto y para renovar sus útiles más deteriorados.

loans.use: An injection of capital for the replacement of tools, with the goal of making their small workshop into the best in the city.

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
In the “Five Pines” district of Chinandega, Blanca P. has spent the last six years working in her General Store, where she serves her loyal customers, offering all sorts of plastic products such as buckets, spoons, baskets, bathtubs etc. She is the mother of two children: this has made her redouble her efforts, together with those of her partner, in order to give them the necessary conditions to ensure their development as students.

As with all businesses, the business of selling plastic products requires an immediate investment in merchandise and it is for this reason that she approached Ceprodel in order to be a beneficiary of a credit which would allow her to buy materials for sale. Currently she is client who has been able to repay all her loans on time and in the manner agreed between both parties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Blanca P. se ha dedicado desde hace seis años al negocio de pulpería donde atiende a sus fieles clientes ofreciendo todo tipo de productos de plástico tales como baldes, panas, cucharas, bañeras, etc. Es madre de dos hijos el cual junto con su cónyuge se esfuerzan para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo como estudiantes.

Como todo negocio, el negocio de la venta de productos plásticos requiere de una pronta inversión en mercadería y es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le de lugar a la compra de los materiales para la venta. Actualmente ella es un cliente que ha sabido cancelar todos sus prestamos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo pactado entre ambas partes.

loans.use: Purchase products to stock her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with six children, all of whom are currently in school. There is a big market in Ghana for selling grocery products, such as vegetable oils, margarine, washing powder, peanut butter, assorted biscuits, candies, and toiletries. And Rose has been delighted to sell groceries for four years now.

With her previous loan, Rose was able to open a store on her own and no longer needs to sell in the hot sun. She wants to use this loan to buy more products to both increase her inventory and to avoid future price hikes. She is a member of the group called Friends. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon Y., 39, is a construction worker in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and typically makes $2 USD each day. Her husband, Ly Sokva, and their son also work in construction and make around $2.50 USD each day. They have four children and the other three are still in the local schools.

Rising inflation has affected many Cambodian families over this past year and this family has been figuring out ways to decrease their expenses and save more money. Yuon Y. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family to commute to work each day. This will cut down on the family’s public transportation costs and will allow them to save money to be used for other needs.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Chela

texts.es:
Chela is 29 years old and helps her mother-in-law prepare ice cream treats and lollipops to sell wholesale to various schools to be sold on. She has two children and with the help of her husband she hopes to have her own business and not depend on her mother-in-law. For the moment she is selling ice cream and lollipops outside a school for a very low price and generates about 100 Soles (less than $40) each week.

Chela, a member of the communal bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz city will use the loan of 1,200 Soles, to be provided by the Manuela Ramos Movement and repaid in six installments, to purchase two sacks of sugar, milk, bags for packaging the lollipops and other materials that she is out of. At the same time, Chela has a dream of bidding on municipal projects involving brickwork and for this reason she is saving her money to purchase a concrete mixer and be able to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Chela de 29 años, ayuda a su suegra a preparar helados y chupetes, quien distribuye por mayor a los diferentes colegios para su venta. Ella tiene 2 hijos y con la ayuda de su esposo espera tener un negocio propio y no depender de su suegra, por el momento ella vende en la puerta de un colegio, helados y Chupetes a muy bajo precio, con la cual le genera un ingreso semanal de 100 soles. Chela, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”de la ciudad de Huaraz, con el préstamo de S/. 1,200 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar 2 sacos de azúcar, leche, bolsas para embolsar los chupetes y algunos materiales que ya se le han desgastado, pero a la vez tiene un sueño, el de licitar con las municipalidades para ofrecer servicios de albañilería, por esta razón esta ahorrando para comprar una mezcladora de concreto y poder alquilarla.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is made up of twelve women and two men who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. The group members are involved in different businesses: Marcela and Elizabeth sell baked goods, Norka Jasmine has a hair salon, Neidy, Tania, and Nery sell clothing (both used clothing and new, trendy clothing). Primitiva sells prepared meals, Virginia sells groceries, Ingrid sells cosmetics, Norka sells meats, and Walter has a hardware store. The group members have a range of experience levels with their respective businesses, anywhere from three to eighteen years. The group meets every other Friday at the group president's house in the Pedro Ferrari neighborhood at 2:30 in the afternoon.

Most of the group members plan to use their loan to purchase more goods or merchandise to sell. In the photo, each group member is holding their check.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El grupo San Cayetano esta compuesto de 14 personas dentro las cuales existen dos varones y 12 mujeres de las cuales en su mayoría las señoras se dedican a la repostería y en otros casos a la venta de diferentes artículos y las reuniones de recuperación se realizan en casa de la presidenta ubicada en la urbanización pedro Ferrari los días viernes a las 14:30 Hrs.

loans.use: Purchase bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of one child. Her child is currently in school. To support her child, she has been operating a hair dressing salon and selling maize in the neighborhood. She says that selling maize is very lucrative.  Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to earn a good income to sponsor her childs' education. Esther is a member of a group named Action Faith.  Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize, hair creams etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel de Ayacucho.
Teodora es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Teodora en la comunidad de Maizondo, que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Teodora se dedica a la agricultura de verduras variadas, dependiendo de la época y demanda del mercado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semillas.
Los sueños de Teodora son tener casa propia en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the communal bank San Miguel de Ayacucho. Teodora lives with her partner. She is 44 years old and has five children. Teodora lives in the Maizondo community which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Teodora dedicates herself to growing a variety of vegetables, depending on the season and the market demand. She makes her sales at the market in the city of Ayacucho. Teodora needs a loan in the amount of $500 which she will invest in purchasing fertilizer and seeds. Teodora's dreams are to have her own home in the city of Ayacucho and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Siguidia (Fait Bon De Vivre) Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du  groupe Siguidia (deux mariées, une veuve et une célibataire) avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants, vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs maris ou leurs  enfants dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Se connaissant mutuellement depuis de longues dates et monitrices au jardin d’enfants communal de Koutiala, elles font également la teinture,  la vente de bazins et de parures. Elles font des expositions à plusieurs foires artistiques et culturelles de la région de Sikasso, d’autres localités du Mali et quelques fois à l’extérieur du pays. 
Compte tenu de l’évolution de leurs activités, la nécessité d’une assistance financière s’imposa, alors elles rejoignirent l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, depuis maintenant six ans.
Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier à 150.000 FCFA  par personne pour ce onzième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter un stock important d’indigos de bois de chauffe et des balles de bazin  pour la teinture. Elles se procurent de leurs marchandises à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les produits finis sont vendus à la maison et au lieu de travail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 150 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui servira en plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt, à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires.  Dans les jours à venir les membres du groupe comptent ouvrir une boutique de vente d’indigo à Koutiala.
texts.en:
The four women of the Siguidia group (two married, one widowed, and one still single) have an average age of 40 and 3 children. They live in nuclear families with their families, spouses, or children in the Koko neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having known each other for a long time and as teachers in the communal kindergarten of Koutiala, they have businesses in dyeing, sale of "bazin" (damask cloth), and costume jewelry. They have displayed their wares in several artistic and cultural fairs in the Sikasso region, in other localities in Mali, and sometimes outside the country.

Taking into consideration the evolution of their businesses, they felt the necessity of financial aid, so they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, 6 years ago.

The amount they are allowed to borrow has grown from 50,000 F CFA for their first loan to 150,000 F CFA per person for this 11th loan which will be used to buy large quantities of indigo, firewood, and bales of "bazin" cloth for dyeing. They buy their supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The finished products are sold from their homes and in workplaces for cash or on credit to a clientele essentially composed of women.

They expect to make an average of 150,000 F CFA in profit per cycle which will be used to reimburse the loan and to cover family expenses, with any remainder invested in their businesses. In the coming days, the members of the group intend to open a boutique to sell indigo in Koutiala.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Nasreen Amanuwail Masih Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a 37 year old lady and resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is A. M. and he works in a factory. She is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheel motor vehicle). The others are getting education in a local school located near to the community. Nasreen baji’s husband’s income is insufficient to meet the financial expenses. She helps him by sewing and embroidered clothes. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She is very happy that she is fulfilling her duties very devotedly. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son.

She is the leader of a group with some more women of her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy chairs for her barber shop. Rebecca baji wants a loan to buy a handset for her PCO (which people use to make calls and pay by the minute) public call office. Sardaran baji and Majeedan baji each want a loan to buy wheat on wholesale to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, que sobre todo le brindan apoyo. La casa donde ella habita es propia. Es propietaria de un mocarro y a la vez vende ropa (recientemente) por las diferentes zonas de su región. La moto que tiene cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y brinda servicio de taxi, ganancias con las cuales puede sustentar sus gastos diarios. Este motocarro lo maneja uno de sus hijos, el mismo que se encarga de cuidarlo y mantenerlo. Doris está contenta porque tanto el motocarro como la venta de ropa le generan buenos ingresos, por lo que le va muy bien, y ahora tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su moto para que trabaje al 100 %, así como también construirá un kiosco para poner posteriormente una bodega.
texts.en:
Doris is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children, who are grown up and have families but support her above all. She is the owner of a motorcoach and at times recently has sold clothing in the different areas of the region. She has had her motorcoach for a year, providing taxi services so she can afford her daily expenses. One of her children drives the vehicle, and he also cares for and maintains it. Doris is content because just like the motorcoach, her clothing sales have gone well and generate good income, and now she is planning to start a new business selling grocery items. This is her eighth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she plans to use the money she is requesting to repair her motorcoach so it works 100 percent. She also plans to build a kiosk where she can later install her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcoach

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
14 people living in Phum Ty 8 village in Kampong Chhnang province and comprise this village bank loan. They hope to use the loan for a variety of purposes. 

Mrs. Mao P. is a 37 year-old village bank president. She breeds chickens and pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wishes to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan that will allow her to buy more chickens and piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Mono, is a farmer who owns a plot of land of which he uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a laborer. Mrs. Mao P. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and piglets to breed and thereby earn more income.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian A. is a 29 year old mother of three children and is pursuing her first loan. Currently she is working in a salon but is hoping to use the loan to start her own business. Her three children are all in school and she is raising them on her own. She says the grestest challenge in starting her business is access to capital. She is fortunate as her children are in government schools and she does not have to pay their fees.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and blowdryers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 26, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers 3 days per week. This is Maria's first loan with SPBD, and she will use it to purchase a water hose, pesticides, herbicides, and bush knives for use on the plantation.

SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala ($145 USD).

loans.use: Purchase water hose, gromozones, pesticides, weedkiller, and bushknives.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Danaya avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. .
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente pagnes wax, d’orange,  de savon et  de bois de chauffe.  
Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles l’ont sollicité afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges ,10 cartons de savons et 15 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et au Burkina faso, pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Comprising six married women, the members of the Danaya group are on average 35 years old with 3 children and live in monogamous households in Médine, one of the areas of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses, which include among others the sale of pagnes wax (a type of highly-values West African cloth), oranges, soap, and firewood. They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They turned to this institution in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, which is constantly increasing. With this loan, they intend to buy 15 sets of pagnes wax, 20 100-kg sacks of oranges, 10 boxes of soap, and 15 cartloads of firewood. They supply themselves at the grand market of the city of Sikasso and in Burkina Faso, a country bordering Mali. Their merchandise is sold at the Sikasso grand market and often door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, with most of the sales in cash. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 17,000 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for their families' needs and the remaining portion invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Vicenta es viuda, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Vicenta vende golosinas, bebidas, de manera ambulatoria cerca de un colegio particular, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, actividad que raliza de lunes a sábado.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Vicenta sueña con tener un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales,
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Maria Celeste community bank. Vincenta, 42, is a widow, and she has 2 children. Vicenta is a street vendor who sells sweets and drinks near a private school. She uses a tricycle and sells from Monday through Saturday. Vicenta needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy sweets and soft drinks. Vicenta dreams of having a stable location and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Mukhtayaran Aslam Masih Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran baji is a very sensible and hardworking lady. She runs a business sewing clothes, which she handles and manages very successfully. Due to the economic conditions in Pakistan, she sews clothes so that she can save income for a rainy day. Mukhtayaran baji's husband runs a business selling bed sheets. For the past three years, he has bough sheets from Lahore and sold them in his native city of Vehari. Mukhtayaran baji is applying for a loan to buy bed sheets for her husband’s business.

Mukhtayaran baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Nasreen akhtar baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naziran baji wants a loan to buy items (such as creams, cosmetics and a hairdryer machine) for her parlor. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her dressmaking business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.en:
Mirsaid M. is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. For 14 years Mirsaid has been developing agricultural production on his land with the help of his wife and children. Now planning to sow potatoes on his land, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. You could play an important part in Mirsaid’s family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ribbim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, O. Ribbim now lives with his wife and their 4 children. They are also responsible for caring for his elderly parents. Ribbim is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Ribbim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 8000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. The income from the sale of this crop will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and to educate all his children to a higher level of education. Ribbim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. has been a member of ASHI since 2007. She and her husband Antonio are 41 years old and have three children. Their eldest two children are in high school, while the third one is an elementary student. Education of these three incurs a lot of expenses for Josephine and her husband to deal with. Her husband is a bus "conductor" (someone who is in charge of collecting passengers' fares and will command the driver to stop when passenger wants to ride or step off the bus), while Josephine has been making and selling "nipa" shingles. 

"Nipa" shingles is the most affordable roofing material in the province. This material is good for two to three years before it gets rotten. Poor people all over the province of Antique and those who live in very remote areas like the place where Josephine and her family live, can only afford this kind of roofing material. Therefore, Josephine thought of starting such a business. She will also be maximizing the resources which her village and community offers, because the "Nipa" plant is everywhere and a lot of people make "Nipa" shingles, however, they don't have access to marketing their product outside their village.

Josephine wanted to address the issue faced by most poor people in their community. She started to grow her own business through loans she received from ASHI and she will still be expanding further by purchasing the products of people in her community to market in places outside their own village. Her loan will make this happen and will contribute to the improvement of the lives of poor people.

loans.use: To purchase nipa (kind of palm used in making shingles for rooves) leaf, and nipa shingles to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa Jeny y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de mascotas en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Lima, donde ofrece lindos perritos, hámster, gatos, tortugas, etc. Ella optó por este negocio porque siempre le gustaron mucho los animales y lo que más disfruta es pasar tiempo con ellos, es por eso que su trabajo no se le hace muy pesado; aunque la parte difícil radica en que algunas veces las mascotas adquieren alguna enfermedad y debe poner sumo cuidado en su atención. A Ricardo le hubiera gustado ser veterinario, pero ve en su trabajo lo que más se asemeja a ese sueño. Felizmente su esposa y su hijo comparten ese mismo amor por los animales, así que siempre trabajan juntos para de salir adelante. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará perros de raza Shitzú para criar y luego los venderá a un precio mayor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and lives with his wife Jeny and their young son in their own house. For 4 years, he has sold animals in the Central Market in the city of Lima, where he offers beautiful puppies, hamsters, cats, turtles, etc. He decided to pursue this business because he always liked animals. What he enjoys most is spending time with them. Because of this, his work doesn’t make him very tired. The difficult part of his business is that sometimes the animals become ill and he must take care of them. Ricardo would have liked to be a veterinarian, but his work is the most similar to this dream. Happily, his wife and son share his love for animals, so they always work together to go forward. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he has been very punctual in all of his repayments. With the money that he is now requesting, he will buy Shitzu dogs to raise and, later, sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B., from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin, is 43 years old and the married mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business in the manufacturing sector, its main source of income coming from making house furniture for sale in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase materials for furniture making. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik T. is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in Sevan. Gagik has a secondary education. For the last 4 years he has worked as a foreman and 4 months ago Gagik and his wife began their own business that brings in 90,000 Armenian dram (about $239 US) per month. They have a rented shop, where they sell a mix of products. Gagik and his wife want to receive a 200,000 AMD loan to buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil to expand their start-up business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad (comestibles), la cual atiende esmeradamente todos los días. Ocasionalmente, sus pequeños hijos la apoyan en la atención, ya que su tienda está en su misma casa, pues aprovechó se que encuentra ubicada en una carretera muy transitada de su localidad. Es así que Domitila se preocupa por tener productos novedosos que atraigan a mayor cantidad de público y con la buena atención que brinda a su clientela ha logrado aumentar sus ventas, las cuales se traducen en el crecimiento de su negocio. Uno de los proyectos a futuro de Domitila es tener un minimarket que abastezca de diversos productos a sus clientes.
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y se compromete a seguir adelante con el mismo ánimo. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la ampliación del espacio de su tienda, para ello comprará pintura y contratará al personal que hará las remodelaciones. Así también, usará otra parte de dinero en la compra de mercadería en arroz y azúcar.

loans.use: Ampliación de su tienda e incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elvio

texts.en: Elvio Barrios is a storekeeper and dedicates himself to selling direct billing merchandise. He started in the area with his father and and earned enough savings to open his own business. Elvio’s dream is to open a commercial shop where he can exhibit his merchandise to sell. He will use this loan to buy merchandise such as electronics, power saws and other things. Elvio is 28 years old, single and lives with his brothers and mother.

loans.use: To buy electronics and tools

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer activa y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 72 años, madre D. ocho hijos, todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso en el mercado D. Bellavista, en este negocio también participa su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosa y golosinas para vender.
Ahora Isabel necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar ropa D. segunda por fardos. La meta D. Isabel es tener una tienda D. artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Isabel is an active woman who works well with others. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 72 years old and the mother of eight children, all of whom are adults. Isabel sells second hand clothing in the Bellavista market together with her husband. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Innovadoras” for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in soft drinks and sweets to sell. Now Isabel needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy bundles of second hand clothing. Her goal is to have a home goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. is 23 years old and resides with her husband and one young child in Takeo province. She and her husband make and sell piggy banks to earn a living and are able to make about US$2 profit each day. To earn additional income, Seng S. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to raise pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Pay for servicing and maintanance charge of the machines.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma de 37 años de edad, cuenta con una frutería y verdulería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de independencia, nediante la miama le ayuda a su cónyuge quien es el señor José Ortiz de 34 años de edad. Se dedican al rubro desde hace mas de 1 año, el negocio comenzó siendo muy precaria, actualmente cuenta con una casita, frente a la ruta principal de la colonia Independencia, cuenta con variedades de frutas y verduras, (locote, tomate, cebolla, naranja, pera, sandia, etc.).

Solicita dicho monto para la compra de mercaderías ya que cada día acuden al local clientes exigentes de toda la zona, alemanes y paraguayos por el buen servicio prestado y la calidad de las mercaderías.
texts.en:
Zulma, 37, sells fruits and vegetables in downtown Independencia. Her husband, José Ortiz, 34, helps her. They have been in this line of work for more than a year. The business had a very precarious beginning but now, she has a small shed, on the main street of Independencia neighborhood. She has a variety of fruits and vegetables such as: "locote" (pepper), tomato, onion, oranges, pears, watermelon, etc. She seeks funding to buy merchandise because local customers from the area, both german and paraguayan, come to her for the good customer service and high quality of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (fruits & vegetables).

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro M. G. tiene 58 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Ellos tienen 20 y 17 respectivamente y los dos viven en la casa con su esposa.  El crédito lo quiere para comprar de terneras para que sirvan de cría. El puede obtener mejor ganancias con la venta de las crías. Hace muchos años que el ha dedicado a  la ganadería y quiere crecer. Es la trecer  vez don Ramiro se financia con FUDECOSUR, en el pasado obteniendo montos de 100000 y 200000 colones. Estos prestamos le han ayudado a permiten salir adelante por la forma de trabajo en que operan. El es el presidente del comite de credito de Platanares.  El espera que tenga un buen bienestar economico que le permita ayudar a la familia y el estudio de los hijos. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramiro M. G. is 58 years old, married, and has two children who are his highest priority. They are 20 and 17 years old respectively, and both live at home with him and his wife. This loan will be used to buy calves for breeding. He hopes to obtain better earnings upon selling the offspring. Ramiro has been raising livestock for several years and wants his business to grow. This is the third time he has received financing from FUDECOSUR. His previous loans were in the amounts of 100,000 and 200,000 colones, and have allowed him to stay ahead and keep his business in operation.

Ramiro currently serves as president of the Platanares Communal Bank. He hopes his family will be in a good financial situation to enable his children to continue their studies.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for breeding

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 33 years old and married with two children, both in primary school. Her husband works with an electricity company in Benin City, Edo State.

Kate sells colorful sarongs and she also makes lovely designs for her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. She loves her tailoring skills because it enables her make more profits to support her home.

Kate is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to own a fashion shop in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Woly

texts.fr: Woly D. est âgée de 49 ans, elle mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et été 4 fois bénéficiaire de prêts. Elle fait de l'élevage de moutons, d'arachide, et de haricots. Elle participe aux charges collectives de sa famille.
texts.en:
Woly D. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has been a recipient of loans four times. She raises sheep, and she grows peanuts and beans. She takes part in covering the collective expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial businesses

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married and has 7 children. She is 48 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She sells Nigerian and Ghanaian cooked food. She has been in this business for a long time. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Big Five Marketer Group

texts.en:
Big Five Marketer is a group of 5 borrowers led by Daniel S.. He is 48 years old and is married with a big family.  Daniel is a high school graduate but could not continue with school due to a lack of financial support.

For more than 10 years, Daniel has been selling general goods and palm oil at the Joe Bar Market near Liberia's capital Monrovia. Daniel encourages customers to buy from him by selling high quality goods and palm oil. Daniel will use this loan to purchase more palm oil.  He dreams of giving his children a good future by sending them to school and building a house for his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Daniel is the one holding the sign.  Mamie P. is inset at the lower right of the photo.   This is the second time that Daniel's group has been listed on Kiva -- see the first listing here: http://www.kiva.org/lend/141616. 

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil.

loans.name: Mehanbidi

texts.ru: Адинаев Механбиди проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает в России. Сам Механбиди занимается живоноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mehanbidi A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Their son works in Russia. Mehanbidi is involved in animal husbandry and has a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. He has over 20 years of experience in this field. Mehanbidi is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
For a hospitable woman like Elena C., gaining a lot of customers for their blacksmith business isn’t hard. It is meeting their increasing demands and the need to expand plus the increasing financial needs of her family that worries her.

For this reason, Elena and her husband decided to request a much larger loan through ASHI. Once their blacksmith shop becomes stable, in addition to her hog-breeding business, Elena believes that they will also be able to sustain the education of their children who are in college and will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for manufacturing bolos (large single-edged knives) and other knives

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Two of his children, aged 21 and 18, are university students. His third son, Munhsaihan, is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school. Batsaihan operates an auto repair service which he started in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 362 USD). After ten years he has managed to increase his working capital to more than 4,500,000 tugrugs (~ 3252 USD). He has built a loyal customer base because of the good quality of his work and service. After saving his profits for many years he was able to build his own auto garage and repair center. Batsaihan is an honest person and has good communication skills. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1445 USD) loan to increase the working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta Irene tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues siempre se ha preocupado por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene a su cargo a sus hijos, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle lo más necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido caminar largas distancias para ofrecer la variedad de productos que ofrece, ya que solo así puede obtener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para trajes, cosméticos, calzado y vestidos. Siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda en donde sus clientes se encuentren mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Marta Irene has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and she has always made sure she makes her payments in time. Marta has her children in her care, and always worries about providing them with all the necessary things. Her economic activity is the sale of general groceries. One of her biggest challenges has been walking the long distances to offer the variety of products that she offers, as this is the only way she can get new clients. The loan she is seeking is for working capital and to purchase suits, cosmetics, shoes and clothes. Marta has always dreamt of having a shop where her clients can be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita A., from the village of Sulipat Calamba Misamis Occidental, is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lelita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane Dramé est un célibataire résidant dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est très vite initié à l’activité d’achat et vente de téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur,etc.) il y a environ dix ans. 
Son activité est menée dans une boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et surtout de transporteurs. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Il est à son premier prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, à Bamako, 15 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façades, 20 chargeurs, 18 paquets de carte mémoire, 4 cartons de batterie, 2 douzaines d’écouteurs etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Ousmane Dramé was born on October 19, 1988 in Zégoua (at the Mali - Ivory Coast border). He is single and lives in a traditional extended family in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Hamidou Ousmane did not have the opportunity to pursue his schooling. Ten years ago he very rapidly initiated himself to the purchase and sell of mobile phones and their accessories (front covers, batteries, charger, headphones etc…). Hi activity takes place in a shop at the bus station in Sikasso. His customer base is mostly travelers and transporters. He is very much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products. In order to better meet his ever increasing customers’ demand, he decided, a few months ago, to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan and he plans on using it to buy, in Bamako, 15 mobile phones of different brands, 2 boxes of front covers, 20 chargers, 18 packs of memory card, 4 boxes of batteries, 2 dozen headphones etc… With this loan, he is planning to make a monthly profit of 180 000 Francs CFA. It will be used mostly to increase his working capital, to contribute to the family’s expenses and to pay his loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly N. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Jelly owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Jelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock to raise. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Gilma T. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Gilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector buying & selling of dried foods. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of dried squid and fish in the local community. Gilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gilma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & increased working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a business providing general transportation services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and 3 siblings and contributes with her brothers to the household expenses. She started her business selling lingerie from her home. Today, she is the proud owner of a lingerie shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past four years. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to further diversify her merchandise selection. She hopes that her varied selection of lingerie will continue to generate good profits and enable her to expand her business even further. She expects her productivity and income to increase in the coming year. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers.
