She decided to improve her daily earnings. But the only problem is the capital to expand her food vending business. That is why she join CEVI to access loans. 
Mulfora wants  to purchase additional ingredients like flour, coconut milk, glutinous rice,sugar and edible oil. In that way, she will be able to prepare more variety of snack foods to sell.

In the future, Mulfora is looking forward to improve her food vending business and to save for emergency use.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, coconut milk, glutinous rice,sugar and edible oil

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Madam Mavis A. sells soap. She markets her goods by moving from home to home. She lacks capital to increase or expand and is more often than not idled when her goods get finished in good time. This poses a problem to her since she loves to be working all the time. Madam Mavis believes that when she gains more capital to work with, her soap business will grow and improve her living condition. She is therefore seeking a loan of $700.00 from kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 20 years. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Angelita can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses.

Angelita started off as a clothes saleswoman in a business venture with a family member. Due to her lack of capital she could not make the business succeed. She does not want the same thing to happen to her in this operation. She is married and has two kids, one who is still in school and the other who works but still lives at home.

She is seeking a second loan in order to buy the chemicals necessary to make her products. Angelita’s first loan went very well. She is very satisfied with the results and she hopes to continue growing. As she expected, she invested in the necessary ingredients to maker her products and also bought some better plastics to sell them in. Her children recently have started helping their mother, but she prefers to keep them somewhat out of the business so they may concentrate on school. She hopes that with the profits of this loan she will also be able to invest in cosmetics as a secondary source of income.

loans.use: Invest in materials necessary to make products

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y. is a 37 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child and her mother (both pictured here).  She sells fruit at the local market and earns about $4/day of profit.  With a loan of $1,000, she will be able to purchase more fruit for selling, a business that she knows to be profitable.  In the future, she hopes to continue accessing credit in order to start a small grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is 36 years old, mother of a child aged 19. She has been running her business by selling household goods such as milk, rice, kerosene, cooking oil, etc.  She has to work hard to supplement her family's needs since her husband has passed away. She opens her shop from 7.30 to 19.00. Since she has joined as a member of MBK, her income increased gradually.  She expects to have $50 loan to have her shop bigger. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make her shop bigger

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is 42 years old, married with 6 children, and she lives in Benin City. She sells akara and akamu to people living in her community and at the market. She has 8 years of experience in this business and 4 years in LAPO as a secretary of her union. She needs a $625 loan for the purchase of a grinding machine, oil, bags of beans, and maize. She says that this will assist her to buy in large quantities, and therefore serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to produce akara and akamu

loans.name: Manzuma

texts.en:
Manzuma I. has been engaged in trade for over 7 years. Her business is located in Panjshanbe market, Khujand, Tajikisatan, in the passage of the market, as you can see in the photo. She says that her business trade is profitable and she does not want to change her location. While doing her business she has attracted many constant clients and her place is convenient for them as it is located near the transport road. Every day she sells the majority of her goods. She goes to Istaravshan wholesale market weekly to purchase more goods.

To the KIVA program she has directed an urgent request of a loan to increase the volume of her goods. She recently married her daughter off and she currently needs additional capital to stabilize her working capital. And in the nearest future she wants to make a wedding present - she wants to give furniture to her daughter.

loans.use: Manzuma would like to Increase the volume of goods for her children's clothing store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a reputable mechanic who lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. Ali is working full-time to support his three children.

This is the fourth time Ali is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Ali is planning to supplement his business with car sales. Ali is working hard in order to achieve his goA..

loans.use: To expand business in car sales

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya operates a profitable second-hand clothing sales business in the area around Stryi, western Ukraine. She started her business nineteen years ago when she didn’t have any work, and it has grown into a sizeable, successful business. Nataliya has several sales locations, one in the Central market in Stryi and several in nearby cities. Her husband also helps her with the business. They have two daughters, ages seventeen and four. 

Nataliya has requested a loan to help purchase inventory for a new sales location. She would also like to remodel the van that she uses with her business. This loan will give her the necessary capital to continue improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nyamizi

texts.en:
Nyamizi K. is married with two children, ages 3 1/2 and 2 years. Nyamizi owns a small beauty salon, which she opened in 2005. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her clients.

Nyamizi is applying for a loan of $175 to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bike implements and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Senora Elizabeth belongs to the Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Paraiso, located at 536 Apurimac Street, in the District of Calleri, part of the Department of Ucayali. She is 38 and the mother of 6 children, her husband is a taxi driver for a moto-car, but their income is not enough to support their family. With Elizabeth’s first loan from Manuel Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the purchase of a moto-taxi. At present they have 2 moto-taxis and she must get up at 6am in order to hand over the moto-taxis to their drivers. She then prepares breakfast for her children and her husband and then does work around the house. With this loan of S /. 900, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy parts for the mechanical maintenance of the moto-taxis. Elizabeth is very happy with her family which is always filled with encouragement allowing her to get ahead in life; she is also very happy with the support offered by Manuela Ramos for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 536, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad ella cuenta con 2 motocarros, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para entregar sus motocarros a sus choferes, de allí prepara el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y luego se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 900 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: piezas para realizar el mantenimiento mecánico de sus motocarros. Elizabeth esta muy contenta por tener una familia como la que tiene pues siempre la llenan de aliento para que pueda salir adelante en la vida, y esta muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will be able to perform maintenance on the moto-taxi

loans.name: Tutindaga L.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Tutindaga L. L. is 41 years old, is married, and has two children, ages 18 and 15. In 2004, Tutindaga started her clothing business.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers. The retailers then re-wash and re-iron the clothing and sell it on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because the clothes are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment, the growing market in used clothing is an important source of income for many micro-entrepreneurs.

Tutindaga has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a loan in order to buy more used clothing. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M., age 27, is married with one daughter of 9 months. He has had a cosmetics business since 2003. He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $154.

In the past Charles has taken out 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve his cosmetics business. He hopes for a new loan to increase his capital.

loans.use: to increase on capital

loans.name: Esmirna

texts.es:
Esmirna, 57, is a single mother with 8 children, one of whom has died. The others are independent now but still live with her. She has a vehicle repair shop in a small space at her house. One of her sons is a mechanic and works with her. Esmirna is not only a mechanic; she sells car parts. She tends the sales side of the business but still helps her son with the repairs and it's she who is responsible for oil changes. She's made a living with the business for 4 years and it's now generating a good income. She used to sell clothing before but it didn't go well. What she wants from work is to be able to feel active and useful. She will use the loan that she's applying for to expand her business and remodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Esmirna tiene 57 años, es madre soltera, tuvo 8 hijos, uno de ellos murió y los demás ya son independientes, pero viven junto con ella. Tiene un taller de mecánica en un pequeño local dentro de su vivienda, donde uno de sus hijos que es mecánico y trabaja junto con ella. Esmirna no solo tiene su mecánica, sino también vende repuestos, ella atiende la venta, pero no deja de darle la mano a su hijo, ya que es ella quien se encarga de hacer los cambios de aceite. En esta actividad tiene ya 4 años, le es muy rentable, anteriormente vendía ropa y no le fue bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente activa y útil a la sociedad. Ahora, el dinero solicitado lo usará para ampliar su negocio y remodelar para de la infraestructura.

loans.use: Remodel vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Emma Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Emma, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr Aguaytia Mz m Lt 22 AA.HH Roberto Ruiz Vargas, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es madre soltera y lucha constantemente por el bienestar de sus hijos. Emma con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de frutas.
 
Emma continúa con la venta de frutas y para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su señorita hija, quien se levantan muy temprano para ir a vender en el mercado Nº 2. Gracias al esfuerzo puesto por parte de ellas cada día está creciendo en la venta de frutas. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá  en la compra de frutas y verduras regionales como 1 saco de Camú  Camú , 1 saco de naranja, ½ saco de toronjas, culantros, ají dulce y otros.

Emma se siente feliz de poder pertenecer al Banco Comunal porque gracias a ello pudo hacer crecer la venta de frutas. En sí Emma es una mujer muy luchadora y  exitosa, ya que todo ello es para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emma, a member of the Young Women's Community Bank, located in Aguaytia Mz Jr m 22 AA.HH Lt. Roberto Ruiz Vargas, Yarinacocha district, department of Ucayali, is 49 years old and the mother of 3 children who still depend on her. She is a single mother and constantly fights for the welfare of her children. With the first loan that Emma received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of fruit. Emma continues with the sale of fruit and is assisted by her daughter, who gets up very early to go to sell in the market No. 2. Thanks to their efforts, their fruit sales are growing every day. With a loan of $675, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of local fruits and vegetables: 1 bag of camu camu, 1 bag of oranges, ½ bag of grapefruits, coriander, sweet pepper and others. Emma is happy to belong to the Communal Bank because as a result she was able to grow her fruit sales. Emma is a fighting woman and is very successful, as this is for her children’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of local fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita T. is 35 years old, single, and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently studying.  For four years, Rita has primarily been a trader of charcoal, which is a lucrative business in Ghana because charcoal is the most popular source of energy for cooking.  While she is able to acquire most of her charcoal from villages in her area, Rita is hoping to expand her business in order to increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children.  Therefore, she has joined the Mawulehand Trust Group, which supports its members, and has requested a loan of $525, which will be used to purchase greater quantities of charcoal at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of charcoal at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal T., a resident of Tboung Kdey Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice for a living. Currently facing the problems of infertile land and low working capital, he is requesting a loan to purchase both fertilizers and rice seed.

Kosal is 43 years old and the father of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another four are attending the local school; the remaining two children are yet too young to study. His wife, Mrs. Mech Kam, presented on the right in the photo, is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema I. is a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a grocery shop in Buza just outside Kariakoo business center. She has been in business for 5 years. She purchases commodities from wholesale shops and sells them to her customers. The income generated helps her to meet her daily family needs and also has enabled her to buy a building site. She requests a loan of Tshs1,480,000 to purchase more items to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea N. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while another one is attending the local school, and the last is 5 years old and too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Dy Chheang, helps her on the farm. He is shown on the right of the photo. Mrs. Khea N. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 2 hectacre field. It is now harvesting season, but she does not have ways to transport her rice yield. Thus, she asks for a loan to buy a cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart to transport her rice yield.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula pertenece al banco comunal “Las Fronterizas”,  del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, de 36 años de edad, con tres hijos, con estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercer grado de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años de los cuales e inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas con 300 soles como capital inicial.
En la actualidad su negocio viene superando la demanda proyectada, por ello requiere un capital adicional de 1500 soles para aumentar su mercadería (golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, enlatados frescos, etc), con la mira de convertirse en distribuidora al por mayor y con ello obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia, asimismo ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta de acuerdo con los acuerdos tomados por su grupo.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula belongs to the community bank "Las Fronterizas", from the Desaguadero district. She is 36 years old and has 3 kids, and never finished high school. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years when she started her candy shop business with 300 soles as initial capital. Currently her business is going very well and demand for her products have exceeded her projections, therefore she needs additional capital for 1500 soles to increase her merchandise (candy, sodas, cookies, fresh cans, etc) she is looking to turn into a large distributor so she can get better income for her family. She will pay her quotes on time and agrees with the contracts accepted by her group.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (candy, sodas, cookies, fresh cans, etc.) to improve her business

loans.name: Kieu's Group

texts.vi:
Kiều Thị Vĩnh sinh năm 1958,( Mã số: 010103080006) là công nhân đã về hưu, có lương ổn định. Vợ chồng chị có hai con trai đã trưởng thành, đi làm có thu nhập. Hiện tại, gia đình chị chăn nuôi gà. Nhưng vợ chồng chị vẫn đi làm thuê như phu hồ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.  Bên cạnh đó chị vẫn nhiệt tình tham gia ccong tác nhóm cụm vay vốn và là cụm trưởng cụm vay vốn. Cùng vay với chị còn có: 
 Nguyễn Thị Lượng sinh năm 1952 ,( Mã số: 010103080008 )chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Gia đình có thu nhập ổn định khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. 
 Nguiyễn Thị Trọng sinh năm 1977,( Mã số: 010103080009) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để nấu rượu, nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. 
 Nguyễn Thị Lụt sinh năm 1945,( Mã số: 010103080010), chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.270.000 vnđ để nuôi cá. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Ngọc L. sinh năm 1971,( Mã số: 010103080011). Gia đình chị có cửa hàng bán đồ điện dân dụng . Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng
texts.en:
Mrs. Kieu T. V. (born in 1958 and ID: 010103080006) is a retired worker with a stable income. She has two grown-up children, both of whom have been working for a while. Even though she and her husband are currently raising chickens at home, they still have to go work at the construction sites. The family’s income is about 3500000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 4142000 VND to raise poultry. Her group includes: Mrs. Nguyen T. L. (born in 1952, ID: 010103080008) would like to borrow 4142000 VND to raise chickens and pigs. Her family’s monthly income is 2500000 VND. Mrs. Nguyen T. T. (born in 1977, ID: 010103080009) would like to borrow 4142000 VND to make wine and raise pigs. Her family’s monthly income is about 3000000 VND. Mrs. Nguyen T. L. (born in 1945, ID: 010103080010) would like to borrow 3270000 VND to raise fishes. Her family’s monthly income is 3000000 VND. Mrs. Nguyen Ngoc L. (born in 1971, ID: 010103080011) would like to borrow 4142000 VND to invest in her small shop selling electricity appliances.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat U., 35, and her husband, Mr. Ty Soung, 37, were married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. Besides her children, she also has her mother is living with her.

Sophat has been selling boiled corn and Cambodian cake for over four years. Her husband has been driving a taxi for one year. He carries people from Kampong Thom Province to Kampong Cham Province. Sophat used her first loan to repair her husband’s taxi. Now she needs another loan to replace the taxi’s wheels and to level the land around her house, so she is applying for her second loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for her husband’s taxi and to fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Marcela T. V. es originaria de la ciudad de León donde a diario se dedica a su actividad de venta de alimentos siendo este su único sustento con el cual mantiene su hogar.

Ella hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir la material prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y debido a que el precio de tales productos se ha elevado, ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y así adquirir la materia prima para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcela T. V. is a resident of the city of Leon, where she dedicates her time daily to the sale of food, this being her only way to support her home. She is currently needing to obtain the raw materials for the making of the food. Since the the prices have risen, she is looking for the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan and thus being able to get the raw materials and being able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta.
Haydee es casada tiene 32 años, dos hijos de 9 y 4 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Desde joven Haydee ha estado en el negocio de  venta de pescado, por que toda su familia vende, es allí donde conoció a su esposo vendiendo pescado, no tiene un puesto propio, ella es ambulante  en el pesquero.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cajas de 30 kilos de pescados,
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir para su negocio, esta aprendiendo en las charlas de negocio que se da en el Bancomunal.  
El sueño de Haydee es comprar un terreno para construir su casa, por que vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Teresa de Calcuta Community Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children (ages nine and four) who attend public school.

From a young age, Haydee has been in the business of selling fish, as it is her family business. This is how she met her husband, as he also sells fish. Haydee does not have her own stand, rather, she is a street vendor at the fishing docks.

Haydee is requesting a loan for 1,200 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase 30 kilogram (66 pound) cases of fish. Since joining FINCA, she has been able to invest in her business and she has learned a lot from the trainings provided by her community bank.

Haydee's dream is to purchase a plot of land to build a home, as she currently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 30 kilogram (66 pound) cases of fish

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married with two children that are currently in school. Her husband is a crop farmer in the village where they live together with the children. Margaret lives in the family house at Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a food vendor, and she serves food like rice and stew. She sells in a community school to the school children. Margeret says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. Margaret also sells grocery products like milk, sugar, and drinks. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help her expand her business so she can earn more income to support her husband, provide support for her family, and finance her children’s education. Margaret belongs to the village bank called Nkwagyedom which literary means “savior of the multitude or many.” She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es: Edwing es un joven soltero de 28 años, vive en compañía de sus hermanas en la casa de sus padres, desde muy joven apoya en los trabajos agrícolas a sus progenitores, puesto que es el único varón. Cuando cumplió 18 años, se dio cuenta que el dinero en su casa era insuficiente, por ello decidió sembrar en chacras alquiladas, cultivando mayormente zanahorias y espinacas, y en esta actividad lleva cerca de los 8 años. Desde entonces ha ido incrementando sus cultivos, y su anhelo es de sembrar muchas hectáreas de zanahorias, espinacas y lechugas, para que en los  años próximos se convierta en un proveedor importante del mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. A Edwing le gusta su trabajo, puesto que gracias a este, recauda el dinero para cubrir sus necesidades urgentes, y aunque a veces ha visto truncarse sus sembríos por la falta de dinero para los fertilizantes, no desmaya en su esfuerzo. En estos años ha ganado la experiencia suficiente para saber cómo prevenir y curar sus plantas ante el acecho de las diversas plagas, por ello que siempre está en constante observación de sus cultivos. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, y ha sido muy puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, con este crédito hace compromisos de seguir pagando responsablemente, asimismo su cargo como secretario de su banco comunal lo cumple eficientemente, por lo que todos los integrantes lo estiman mucho. Edwin ha decidido invertir los 1500 soles que solicita para el abonado de sus chacras de hortalizas, para de ese modo llevar productos de primera calidad al mercado de Tarma.
texts.en:
Edwing is a young bachelor of 28 years. He lives in the company of his sisters in the home of his parents. From a very young age he has helped with the agricultural work of his family, since he is the only boy. When he turned 18, he realised that the money in the home was insufficient. Because of this he decided to sow in rented fields, growing more carrots and spinach, and in this activity he has spent about 8 years. Since then he has increased his cultivation, and his greatest wish is to grow more hectares of carrots, spinach, and lettuce, so that in the coming years she can convert himself into an important merchant in the market of the city of Tarma. Edwing likes his work, as he is grateful to it for providing the money to cover urgent needs, and although sometimes he has seen his harvests shortened for the lack of money for fertilizer, he has not diminished his efforts. In recent years he has gained sufficient experience to know what is coming and to raise his plants through the threats of various pests. Because of this he is always observing his fields. This is his ninth loan with MFP, and he has been very punctual in each one of his repayments. With this loan he has a commitment to continue paying responsibly, as his role of the secretary of the community bank shows effectively, because all the members think highly of him. Edwin has decided to invest the 1500 soles that he is asking for to fertilize his fields of vegetables, and in this manner to continue producing the best quality of the Tarma market.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva C. is currently in the business of distilling and selling local brewed alcohol, and she is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials.

Oliva is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer who works a small plot of land. They have five children, all of whom attend school.

With the extra profit she expects from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights services, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Abinbola

texts.en: Abinbola is very happy with Kiva for their financial support. She is 55 years old and married with seven children. She sells clothes and sarongs. She is requesting the loan of N150,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a business woman at Sefwi. She is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and has four children who are currently in school.

Mary supports her family through her trading business. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen, and lace materials. She mostly sells through hawking--a personal selling method that she said makes her goods move very fast. She has been selling for the past eight years, but progress has been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more consistent profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen, and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102246&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Cristina  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, Cristina sigue vendiendo ropa usada, también se esta dedicando por las mañanas a cocinar en una casa, ha logrado comprase un carro de segunda que lo da para a hace servicio de taxi.   
Cristina necesita un préstamo, de 1600 soles, para la compra de mercadería de ropa y zapatos.  
Desde que esta en Finca, ha sido de mucho apoyo, puede ahorrar  y realizar ahorros voluntarios, las charlas que reciben han sido de ayuda para su negocio.
El sueño de cristina es comprarse un terreno y construir una tienda  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Previous loan found here: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102246&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 . Cristina is a member of the Niño Divino Communal Bank. She continues selling used clothes, and is also spending her mornings cooking in a home. She's been able to buy herself a pre-owned car that she uses as a taxi service. Cristina needs a 1,600 soles loan (Peruvian currency) for the purchase of merchandise: clothing and shoes. Since she's been with Finca, it has been greatly helpful; she has been able to save, and the talks that the receive have aided her in her business. Cristina's dream is to buy herself land where she can construct a store for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing

loans.name: Luzvin

texts.en:
At first, starting up a small business was impossible for Luzvin because she had no access to capital. Her husband's income as a laborer is sporadic and insufficient for the family's daily expenses; therefore, she thought she was stuck doing the household chores because there was no way she thought she could have money to finance a business until she learned about Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) from women in their village.

Luzvin and her husband then agreed to take out a loan from ASHI to start up a business. Seven months ago, 23-year-old Luzvin discovered how an entrepreneur feels, running her own business. Using her loan from ASHI, she put up a small variety store right in their village. Her store offers people from the village convenience in buying their most basic commodities including retailing rice.

Presently, Luzvin's business has acquired a lot of customers and it requires a bigger amount of capital to finance the needs of her clientele. Because of this, Luzvin wants to get a larger loan since she has already repaid her previous loan on time and with a well-performing business. Her two children aged two and four are also excited about their mother's business. Luzvin is so excited to see her business grow with ASHI supporting her for the capital because she wants to send all her children to school up to college.

loans.use: Financing her rice retailing and variety store business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna L. is the frustrated mother of three children: Michael, who is 17 years old, Liezel who is 15, and KC, who is only 3. Edna is 44 years old, and although frustrated in her children, she is happily married to her husband Emelke L.. She is frustrated because, at their young ages, Michael and Liezel are already married. Michael did not finish his college courses, and Melanie got married right after high school graduation. Edna does not want that to happen again with her youngest child.

The hardest part of it is that the families of her married children still count on her and her husband for financial support. The source of Edna and Emelke's income is their mini-general store, which never provides enough money for their big family.

Edna now wants to start a new business, which is hog fattening or the raising of pigs. She is sure that this business will provide more income, because it suits their place. They have a big backyard for the building of the piggery house. Before starting this business, she needs capital that she can use to buy the piglets and their feed, as well as for the construction of the piggery house. She joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), so that she can borrow capital to start her business. She is hoping that this business will provide their big family's needs.

She is also really hoping that her youngest child will finish her studies and find a better future ahead.

loans.use: Capital to start a hog fattening business (raising of pigs)

loans.name: Floriza

texts.en: Floriza J. is from the village of Manamong. She is 62 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Floriza owns and operates a snack-vending business, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Floriza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Floriza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. Mary trades in tubers of yam. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Mary has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on large scale.

loans.use: To buy yam

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: This is Muhamed S.. He is 49 years old, married to a businesswoman, and they have five children together, all of whom attend school – three in junior secondary schools and two in primary schools. Muhamed is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders for the first time to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim P. is 39 years old and sells vegetables in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about ten years and she makes US$5 every day, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$2.50 per day. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and poor weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$500 to invest into her own vegetable business, increasing her stock of vegetables to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: Invest in produce for her vegetables stand.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: K. Marie est née en 1984 et est mariée à KANVE Gabriel, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants et sont scolarisés. Marie vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin, depuis onze ans. Les charges de la famille sont supportées ensemble par le couple. Marie n’a pas été à l’école et a appris le métier de couture. A côté de ce métier,Marie mène comme activité depuis quatre ans, la vente d'habits qu'elle coud et également des chaussures à son domicile. Marie  s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Marie  sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marie K. was born in 1984 and she is married to Gabriel Kanve, a hairdresser. They take care of four children; three of them are their own children and all of them are attending school. For the past eleven years Marie has lived with her children and her husband in Agbalilamè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. The couple provides together for the family expenses. Marie did not attend school and has learned tailoring. Beside this job, four years ago Marie has started a retail business at home and she sells clothes, that she sews, as well as shoes. Marie gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is an old client of ALIDé and she has fully repaid her previous loans. In order to improve her operating fonds and to reinforce her business, she is now requesting to ALIDé her third loan.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Mary Cruz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Mary Cruz, es una mujer que ha logrado cumplir parte de su sueños, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien y ya lleva 02 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Mary Cruz, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mary Cruz is a member of the community bank "María Gracia" and resides in the city of Moyobamba, Moyobamba province, in the region of San Martín. Mary Cruz is 35 years old, married, and has a dependent son. Mary Cruz is a woman who feels very happy and proud to have achieved part of her dream. Little by little she has saved and managed to accrue her own capital through which she began selling cosmetics. Mary Cruz says that she is currently doing well and has been in this business for the last two years. With a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, Mary Cruz plans to increase her stock by buying more beauty products, to include ladies' perfumes, men and children's products, creams, compact powders, lip liners, and nail varnishes. Mary Cruz serves as testament that with perseverance many women who are starting up in business can achieve their dreams. Mary Cruz is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping her and other women to set up their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Sènemè Bernadette

texts.fr: H. Sènemè Bernadette vit depuis 20 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à COKOU Folly, un pêcheur, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais il ne reste qu’un enfant à sa charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Bernadette n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 20 ans, Bernadette vend des poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Bernadette s’approvisionne au Port de Pêche à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Bernadette manque de moyens financiers pour satisfaire la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Bernadette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sènemè Bernadette H. has lived for 20 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a fisherman names Folly Cokou, Bernadette is the mother of four children who all attend school although only one child still resides in her care. Bernadette lives with her husband and one child. Bernadette did not attend school. For almost 20 years, Bernadette has been selling smoked fish at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Bernadette gets her supplies from the fishing port in Cotonou. She is an old client of ALIDé and successfully repaid her two previous loans. Bernadette does not have the financial means to meet the demand of her large clientele and it is for this reason that Bernadette is requesting her third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fish

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam I. makes local drinks called kunu (a popular drink usually made from a grain such as millet or sorghum, although it can be made from maize) and zobo (a local Nigerian drink made from dry leaves called zobo leaves). These drinks are highly medicinal and also have a pleasant taste.

Mariam sells her drinks in a market in Benin City. She needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more materials to produce more local drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Mariam is 38 years old and married with five children. She is an Etsako by tribe but she lives in Benin City. Her husband is a fashion designer and he also supports the home.

Mariam is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more local drinks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 36, is a rice farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She farms a rice field. She supports her family with three children; the eldest is 14 years old. She works hard in order to have a good harvest.

She is limited in her capital, and that’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan. She’s requesting 15,000 Php to support her business by buying seeds and farm materials.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 43-year-old married man and has three unemployed children. He has been working as a painter, specializing in home projects for the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Haidar is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy new painting tools and supplies needed to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años, es una joven muy dinámica, vive con su esposo Andrés y su hijo de 5 años, y su otro bebé está próximo en llegar.

Ella siempre ha trabajado para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, a pesar que él tiene un trabajo más estable ella quiere ser independiente y poder cubrir sus gastos y los de su hijo. Es por eso que optó por una actividad que no le demandara un horario fijo. Ahora se siente muy contenta porque la venta de productos de belleza ha sido la actividad perfecta para obtener buenos ingresos. Además de ofrecerlos a sus vecinas y amigas, también compró una vitrina, la cual colocó en la tienda de su madre, donde la clientela puede apreciar mejor los productos que ofrece. Ella quiere hacer más estable su negocio y es por eso que piensa seguir invirtiendo en él.

Jessica es una cliente antigua de MFP y su grupo “Cristo Morado” uno de los mejores por su buena organización y puntualidad con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old. She is a very dynamic young woman. She lives with her husband, Andrés, and her five year old son; she has another baby on the way. Jessica has always worked to help her husband with household costs. Even though he has a stable job, Jessica wants to be independent and be able to cover her and her son's spending. For this reason, she opted to work doing something that does not demand a set schedule. Now she is really happy because selling beauty products has been the perfect activity to increase income. In addition to offering the products to her friends and neighbors, she bought a display case, which she put in her mother's store so her customers can better appreciate the products Jessica offers. Jessica wants to make her business more stable, so she plans to continue investing in it. Jessica is an old client of MFP, and her group "Cristo Morada" is one of the best with its organization and punctuality with repayments. With the money she is requesting, she will acquire a larger quantity of beauty products so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is 34 years old and is married without children although she hopes to have children in the future. Her husband provides laundry services to support their home.

Caro sells lightly-used shoes and handbags at retail prices. She is a hardworking woman and hopes to own a shoe factory in the future.

Caro is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K., 62, from Kapkiamo village, is married and the father of eight children: Robert, Kenneth Kiprutto, Kibet, Milka, Kangogo, Jepchumba and Kipkulei.

James operates a retail shop in Kapkiamo and a taxi. He started his business twenty years ago and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16,000.

He was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This loan will be James’ third from KADET.  He has borrowed Kshs 40,000 to purchase items like soap, sugar, cooking oil, tea leaves and more for his business.  If this loan boosts his business he will use the extra profit to purchase a dairy cow and to educate his children.

He hopes to purchase more new cars for the taxi business and to expand his retail shop into a supermarket.  James describes himself as hardworking and committed.

loans.use: Purchase stock for retail shop.

loans.name: Kennybeth

texts.en: Kennybeth S. already has her own business, a small bakery. She joined ASHI because she wants to have access to a loan which she will use to grow her business until it becomes stable and profitable enough to support her dreams for her three children. Her children range in age from one to seven years. Kennybeth and her husband are both hard working want to improve the standard of living for their family, especially for their children. Through the proceeds that their business will earn, Kennybeth wants to save some amount for the future expenses of her children's education, until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase large volumes of ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 25 años, es soltero y sólo vive con su hermano menor en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona alta de la selva del Perú.

La agricultura es su oficio desde hace 2 años, cuenta con terrenos propios donde cultiva palta y frutas cítricas con la ayuda de su hermano y algunos operarios. Lo que más le agrada es retirar las malezas de sus tierras para verlas siempre limpias y para que sus frutos se desarrollen adecuadamente, con los que logre cubrir todas sus necesidades.
También desea comprar más terrenos para plantar café e incrementar su producción, ya que Elvis tiene como motivación el esfuerzo de sus padres y quiere que su futura familia tenga lo mejor y no pase las penurias que le tocó vivir de niño.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y confiesa que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas responsables y unidas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará dos sacos de abono para nivelar la producción de sus cultivos, además pagará operarios que le ayuden con los trabajos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Elvis is 25 years old, single, and lives with his younger brother in his own house located in an upper area of the Peruvian jungle.

He has been farming for two years. Elvis has his own land where he grows avocados and citrus fruits with the help of his brother and a few workers. The part of his job that he enjoys most is removing weeds and keeping his land clear so that his crops can develop properly. The fruits they produce help to cover all of his needs. Elvis also wants to buy more land so that he can plant coffee and increase his production. He was motivated by the work of his parents and wants to have his own family in the future. However, he desires to provide them the best so that his children do not experience the hardships he faced as a child.

This is his second loan with MFP. Elvis confesses that he enjoys working with his Communal Bank because the members are responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 800 PEN that he requested, he will buy two sacks of compost for his crops and pay the workers who help around the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & pay his workers

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Jaime owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops which primarily consists of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over nine years now.

Jaime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaime has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jaime is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to grow. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jaime from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and seedlings to grow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pigs and food and vitamins for them

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha for one year now. This has been her primary business. She is 28 years old and married to Peter Mwangi. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She wants to expand her business and diversify her products.  She will use the cash to buy paraffin, which she will sell in small quantities to her clients as a secondary business.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and operate a larger grocery store than what she currently has.

loans.use: To start selling paraffin as a secondary business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of San Isidro, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Phyjesmael

texts.en: Phyjesmael S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 22 years old, married and has one infant child. To make a living, Phyjesmael owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Phyjesmael has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Phyjesmael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phyjesmael is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Phyjesmael from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair cosmetics

loans.name: Biyinzika Kabyuma Group, Mubende

texts.en:
T. Justus is a 38-year-old happily married father of 3 school-going children who has been running a salon business for 10 years in Kibyamirizi, Mubende. With all his efforts, he has been able to maintain it earning him 200,000 Ugandan shillings. This income has always been significant in contributing towards his family's welfare. 

His current setback is lacking additional capital for purchasing salon materials like: hair cutting machines, shampoo, hair oils, and a drier, basically demanded by lady customers. Therefore this loan will help Justus in restocking his business. He is very interested in what he does and he is grateful that he chose the salon as his business.

loans.use: beauty salon equipment and supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 44 years old and a single mother of one. Her child is 27 years old and not in school. Jane earns her income from dairy farming. She has been engaged in the business for the past five years, and has been able to employ one person in her business. Jane also does horticultural farming for more income. She was previously employed before she went into business. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy a cow. She sees herself buying a plot and building a house in a few years.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Buroratraders  B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard-working N. Ivan of Burora Traders group, aged 33, is a married father of two children. He went into a business venture of carpentry now close to 7 years ago, having got this idea from his friend and this being his trade, he built on it. Being a strategically located business in Burora, Kihihi town in western Uganda, Ivan gets many customers earning him 200,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. 

With this loan, he is looking forward to restock his business with more materials such as timber and also doing more advertising to increase the numbers of customers. This will definitely give his enterprise a new lease on life and also help him improve his sales and be able to take good care of his family as his goal is to have his children educated.

loans.use: restocking his business with more carpentry materials such as timber

loans.name: Abarihamwe Women's, Ntungamo Group

texts.en: K. Nathan, 45 years old, of Abarihamwe Women's group is very optimistic about expanding his current kitchen wares sales business. The hardworking and cordial married father of six children has been operating his business for the last 14 years from Muko Ward, Ntungamo. He regularly earns 300,000 UGX monthly with sales from items such as glasses, plates, cups, food flasks, saucepans and other utensils. Because of his need to make his business grow, he is seeking a loan that will help him establish substantial growth through purchasing more stock in order to be able to supply his clients more efficiently. He will be able then to make more sales revenue which will enable him to pay his family bills, including his children's education fees.

loans.use: purchase of more stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is married and has a child. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through junior high school. Mary sells fruit at Abura. Mary is asking for the loan to purchase a variety of fruits for sale. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from her extended business, Mary plans to complete her building.

loans.use: purchase a variety of fruits for sale

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon S. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Solomon is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he plants and harvests bananas to sell. Solomon has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $93 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Solomon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Solomon is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 11th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosendo Justiano

texts.es:
Rosendo de 41 años, tiene un taller de reparación de carros. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos   en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Comenzó a reparar carros como oficial en un taller por tres años pero para tener su propio negocio y ser independiente tuvo que salir a trabajar por su parte. Ubico un taller de reparación de carros hace 18 años atrás en la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. El endereza, pinta y repara los carros según el daño que tengan. Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para los carros que arregla y asi tener más ingresos. 

En el futuro quiere implementar su con venta de repuestos su taller para que a los clientes se les haga más fácil.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 41 years old and has a car repair shop. He lives with his wife and two children in a community called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist sites with a diverse offering of seafood. 

He started fixing cars working in a workshop for three years, but in order to have his own business and be independent he had to get out and start working for himself. He set up a car repair shop 18 years ago and he now works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day. He straightens, paints and repairs the damage to the cars. With this loan he wants to buy parts for the cars he fixes and thus increase his income. 

In the future you wants to sell spare parts in his workshop to make it more convenient for his customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 40 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa has a business buying and selling bananas and coconuts. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. This will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mototaxi

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fantobougou, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce des tubercules et des habillements.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, des tubercules et des condiments
ROKIA SANGARE du groupe Benkadi compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements. Elle s’approvisionne en habillement le plus généralement à Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are all married and average 43 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in the village of Fantobougou, in Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship and community. They work in food service, and they do commerce in tubers and in clothing. The group members are now on their 12th solidarity loan, which will be used for buying clothing, tubers, and condiments.

Ms. ROKIA SANGARE, a member of the solidarity group, intends to use her loan to buy some clothing. She gets her supplies of clothing most often in Bamako (capital of Mali). Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her retail sales locally and at the Fana market.  

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering day-to-day family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Leydi Abigahil

texts.es: Leydi Abigahil G. D. C. D. 25 años D. edad, es una joven madre D. familia, la cual posee su propio negocio, con el enorme deseo D. contar con una vida mejor. Ella resiD. en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D.: 3 y 1 año D. edad. Leydi posee una librería en la cual se dedica a la venta D. libros, cuadernos, peluches y diferentes tipos D. papelería, el negocio se encuentra en su casa D. habitación lo que es muy bueno para ella ya que pueD. dedicarse a sus hijos, al mismo tiempo que trabaja por una vida mejor. Leydi solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, equipándolo D. todo lo necesario para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Leydi Abigahil Gonzalez D. Carcamo is 25 years old and she is a young mother. She has her own business and she has an enormous wish to have a better life. She lives in the community of Mejicanos, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 3 and 1. Leydi has a books store from where she sells books, notebooks, stuffed toys, and a variety of office supplies. She has her business set up in her home which is very convenient for her because she can still take care of the kids, all the while working towards a better life. Leydi requests a loan to have the funds she needs to invest in her business. She will supply the business will that entire she needs to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase books and school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Devine Grace Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Jane  M., 42, who is a happily married mother of three, has been plying her stone quarry trade for the past 15 years in Kiganda and Kireka in Mukono. 

She says profits from her earlier business of charcoal sales were pivotal in helping her take root in this trade, which often calls for a lot of sacrifice in terms of time. Hard work is also needed if one is to obtain a solid footing in this trade. 

Jane has personified hard work through the years, and this trade generates 100,000 shillings weekly. 

With this Kiva loan, Jane says she is going to pay for more land to expand her stone quarry.

loans.use: The purchase of more land to expand her quarry

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El sr. Juan vive en la zona primero de mayo desde hace 2 años en casa propia, es soltero y vive con su hermana. El sr. Juan tiene un vehículo propio con el cual se dedica al transporte publico. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la reparación de su vehículo y compra de llantas. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito ya que es una persona joven pero desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar para ayudar a su familia para el sustento de la misma,  tiene muchas ganas de superación, es un joven muy trabajador con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan lives in the populous part of the 1st of May zone. He has had his own home for two years; he is single and lives with his sister. Juan has his own car, which he uses for public transport. The loan he is requesting is to repair his vehicle and purchase tires. This is the first time he has requested a loan since he is so young, but he started working at a young age to help sustain his family. He has many hopes of succeeding. He is a very hardworking young man with hopes of moving forward and improving his quality of life. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people make up a village bank loan that will be used by each to improve their family's standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Prak to be the village bank president. 

Mrs. Prak was born in 1958 and she is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. She is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can plant rice. She sells some part of the rice yield and the other part she keeps to support her family. 

Although she tries to work hard, she can earn only a little income. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Prak is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Johaima

texts.en: Johaima is a 33-year-old widow who supports her family with fishing and fish vending businesses.  She lives in Rizal, Palawan. Johaima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Johaima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion and house repairs. Johaima is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito D. Tucume en el norte D. Perú. DesD. hace ocho años, se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno situado cerca a su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad D. su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la compra y venta D. sábanas, edredones y colchas lo que  le genera ingresos  adicionales. Con estas actividades, ella pueD. apoyar a su esposo, quien trabaja como mototaxista, con los gastos familiares. Ha solicitado un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles para la compra D. más animales, alimento balanceado para sus animales y también para la compra D. sabanas, edredones y colchas. Espera aumentar sus ventas para generar más ingresos lo que ayudará mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Isidora is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Tucume in northern Peru. Isidora has been raising and selling animals for eight years. Her business is conducted on a plot of land located near her home. She learned this traD. from her father who is known for being a perfectionist. Isidora has an established customer base in the area. In addition, she buys and sells bed sheets, quilts, and bedspreads to generate extra income. These activities enable her to help her husband, who works as a motorcycle taxi driver, with the family expenses.

Isidora is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN to buy more animals, balanced feed, as well as bed sheets, quilts, and bedspreads. She hopes to increase her sales so that she can generate more income to help improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more animals, balanced feed, and bedding to sell.

loans.name: Ediatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Ediatu.  She is married and has 2 children, one is a boy aged 3 and the other is a girl aged 13.  Her son is in a nursery school while her daughter is in a junior secondary school.   Ediatu supports 2 additional dependents, who are her late sister’s children. 

For the past 10 years, Ediatu has been selling cooked rice (locally called cookery) and drinks.  Her business is located in the central business district of Freetown.   Ediatu said "I have passion for this business because since I dropped out of school, it is through this business I have become self reliant."  She opens her business 5 days a week for 6 hours each day.  

Ediatu has a good loan repayment history. She has requested a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy bags of rice, gallons of vegetable oil, and other food items for her business.   Ediatu has employed two young girls to help her sell the food that she prepares.  She wants to educate her children to university level, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and other food items

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with three school-going children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hamisi has operated a poultry business for the past three years, selling door-to-door and from home to hotel (mini-restaurant) operators and neighbors. Hamisi faces a major challenge of market price fluctuation. He dreams of expanding his business and building premises in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase 100 chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: Bilqees is a housewife. She stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a Punjabi food selling business from his cart. Bilqees helps him by preparing a traditional Punjabi food called Nan Tiki (made with potatoes and served with bread) and Dahi Bhalay (a spicy dish made with yogurt and sauces). He puts the food on his cart and sells it by visiting different streets of the city. Bilqees has given birth to four sons. Only her eldest son was able to study till 5th and then started work to financially contribute to the family. Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as spices, potatoes, cooking oil, etc., to prepare a larger quantity of food to sell and increase his profits. Bilqees is hopeful that a loan investment will improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a Punjabi food selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, age 35, operates a cereals and grocery business in the Munyole trading center. He has been in this business for the last six years and this has been his only source of income. From this business, he earns a profit of KES 4,000 a month. He and his wife have four children, all enrolled in school.

Peter is eager to grow both aspects of his business. In order to boost his endeavor, Peter is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. He intends to use the money to purchase beans to offer for resale at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business and to repay the loan. 

His dream is eventually to own a milling company and to give his family the best life he can afford to offer.

loans.use: to purchase beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marifel has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Marifel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha (pictured here) sells finished silk fabrics, while her husband is a teacher. 

She previously asked for a Kiva loan to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school, but she uses the motorbike to carry finished silk fabrics for sale. 

So, she is now requesting a loan to purchase another motorbike for her son, who is attending a pedagogy class, to drive to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is underage. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business selling at retail to her local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish real estate houses in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Sreyny
