texts.en: Sreyny, 42, sells sugar cane juice and cake with her husband and their income is $7 per day. She has four children, aged 13, 9, 4 and 2. Each month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for transporting her sugar cane juice machine to sell in other places. She doesn't yet want to think of changing her career because it can make good income to support her family. She wants to send her children to university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for taking her sugar cane juice machine to sell in different places.

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine is 38 years old, married and blessed with four children.  

Previously, she used to sells newspapers, but she has been farming for six years now. Madrine also relies on her husband, who is employed, for financial support. 

She raises both dairy cows and pigs. She was able to start raising pigs after she got capital from Faulu Kenya, which she used to buy the pigs. 

She hopes to enlarge her farm in the future. She has requested 100,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and motorbikes.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina, se dedica a la venta de “pan de Laja” (es un pan especial hecho en la comunidad de Laja, que tiene la particularidad de ser un pan muy sano, con poca sal y sin levadura) tres veces a la semana y también ayuda a sus padres en la elaboración de los mismos. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  insumos en mayor cantidad como ser: harina, anis, huevo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Laja  del departamento de La Paz,  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Reina se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente pues esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la tercera a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Reina sells “pan de Laja” (It is special bread made in the Laja community.  It has the distinctive quality of being very healthful, with little salt and no yeast).  She sells it three times a week.  She also helps her parents make the bread.

The loan that she needs is to buy ingredients like flour, anise, and eggs in greater quantity. 

She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in Laja in the La Paz department.  She is single and has one child.

Reina is very happy with the previous loans she was granted.  This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, and it is her third time to request a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, anise, and eggs to make a special bread called "Pan de Laja".

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is a worker with a decent salary. Sameera wants to make interior improvements to her house such as fixing doors and windows, changing tiles etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the renovation, so she needs to take out a loan in the amount of $350 from FATEN. When Sameera gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for the necessary interior improvements to her house which will provide better living conditions for her and her family. Sameera is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for interior improvements to her house.

loans.name: Sherwin Oliver

texts.en:
Sherwin Oliver is a hard working man who spent his whole life working hard to provide his family with amsecure and healthy living. He has been in the transportation business for two years. He owns a motorcycle transport that is used to transport students from/to school. 

Sherwin Oliver is requesting a loan amounting to P7,000 to do necessary maintenance to his motorcycle transport to keep it in the best shape and service as it should be. He will be using the loan to buy new wheels, sprockets and new chains for his transportation business. He hopes to increase the profit he generates to be able to support his children's needs and save some for his later years.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, sprockets and new chains for his transportation business.

loans.name: Cliff

texts.en:
In the photo is Cliff who does construction work to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and employs 10-20 people on contract basis.  Being a married man with four children, he works hard in his business to provide for his family.
Cliff hopes to expand his business so that he can generate more income for his family.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand and cement.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two school going children.  Her husband is a businessman.  They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Grace has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her clients are local villagers.  She faces a major challenge of selling on credit to her customers because they take too long to repay.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase rice, maize flour, soap and cooking oil for her shop.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour, soap and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through middle school. Ekua has sold cloth at Kokoado in Elmina, Ghana for eight years. Her husband is a driver. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in raising their children. Ekua will use the loan to purchase cloth and materials for sale. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase cloth and materials for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 42-year-old widow who was left to raise six sons and daughters by herself. Three years ago, she started a retail business at home to sell clothes and shoes (as shown in the picture). She even added home and kitchen products to her range as per customers' requests.
With her business profits, Hala was able to buy more products through the years and was even able to see her son married. Now Hala has applied for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes, so she can increase her profits and open a separate store instead of selling from her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Gf Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF MAHUKPEGO est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même village et font des tontines ensemble. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Victorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victorine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Victorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victorine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Marc. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Victorine exerce depuis une quinzaine d’années, la culture du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Victorine vend des boissons sucrées dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF MAHUKPEGO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The GF Mahukpego group is made up of four people who live in the same village and they operate a revolving finance system know as a "tontine", whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to the different members of the group. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Victorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Victorine is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Marc. The couple has six children, some of whom are at school and four of whom are dependents. Victorine lives with her husband and children. In order to cover the family's various expenses, she has been growing rice in her region for the past 15 years. As a secondary activity, she sells sweetened drinks in a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand while also increasing her turnover and income, Victorine is, together with the other members of the GF Mahukpego group, requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The first three loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy corn for growing

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es: José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería aceite, frijoles, arroz, huevos, embutidos, para fortalecer el negocio ya que debido al buen manejo de sus préstamos estos meses han sido los mejores en venta, pues ha ofrecido a los clientes una variedad de productos tiendan a incrementar su potencial. El considera no ha mejorado frente a las obligaciones y gastos del hogar.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan in order to buy merchandise such as oil, beans, rice, eggs, and sausages so that he can strengthen his business.  Due to managing his loans well in the past few months, he has improved his sales by offering his customers a variety of products.  This has helped to increase his potential.  The area he believes he has not improved is in terms of his obligations and his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, eggs, and sausages.

loans.name: Hasaan

texts.en:
Hasaan is a 39-year-old married man from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. He is the father of four children.

Hassan is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving his house and renewing the appliances.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Mahouna Group

texts.fr: MAHOUNA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Amancha Pélagie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Amancha Pélagie est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Félicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Amancha Pélagie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Amancha Pélagie vend des couches, laits corporels, de l'eau de toilette, coton et poudre pour enfants depuis dix ans par la technique de distribution ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Amancha Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Amancha Pélagie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUNA, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédit  reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des couches, laits corporels, de l'eau de toilette, coton et poudre.

loans.name: Azarias

texts.en:
Azarias is 45 years old. He is married with 5 children aged 10 and 21 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 12 years.  Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy maize fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 34 year old who is married to Eugenius, a 46 year old man, a farmer. They have been blessed with 4 children namely, Apriana, 13, in the 2nd grade of junior high school student, Febrilina, 9, in the 5 grade of Elementary school student, Mario, 5, and the last is Damiana 1 year old.

Maria's daily activities including taking care of her children and weaving. The weaving skills was inherited from her mother and it's a blessings for her because not many women could do that, unfortunately, she is not lucky enough to have golden opportunity to improve her business due to lack of capital. When she heard TLM  offers a group loan for small entrepreneurs like her, she is very glad and thankful for having chance to know about TLM. She then requested a loan of IDR 1,750,000 for more colorful yarns.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of colorful yarns

loans.name: Tavakkul

texts.en:
Tavakkul was born in 1961 in Gazax region of Azerbaijan. Tavakkul has been engaged in this business for 8 years. After wedding he settled with his family in Sumgait. He is married, has 2 children. rent a medicine-chest and to start selling medicinal preparations. The family income is rather limited. 
Now he had difficulties with cash, he needs a loan amount of $1200 has been provided with the medicinal preparations by firm.

loans.use: To buy the medicinal preparations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a motivated woman with huge desires to overcome adversity. She is 33 years old and single. About 18 months ago, she began to sell cosmetics to obtain an income that allowed her to improve her quality of life. She now applies lotion treatments and cosmetics in one of her friend's salons. This has allowed her to increase her clients and order placements; this is how she has made her business grow.

In order to cover her clients' orders, she needs a $250 dollar loan that she will use for the purchase of merchandise. She offers to return this amount in 3 to 6 months. Become a part of Teresa's dream, your help will be a great blessing for her. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera y tiene 33 años de edad, hace aproximadamente año y medio inició con la venta de cosméticos para poder obtener un ingreso que le permitiera mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Actualmente aplica tratamientos de cremas y cosméticos en la estética de una de sus amigas, esto le ha permitido incrementar sus clientes y sus pedidos, así es como Teresa ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir todos los pedidos de sus clientes ella necesita un préstamo de $250 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte de los sueños de Teresa, tu ayuda será de gran bendición para ella, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise 
Compra de mercancía
